Title: Data Analyst Working Student
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

We are currently recruiting a Working Student Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Your focus will be on leveraging our technology stack to derive insights and support various teams within the business.

What You Will Do


Utilize tools like Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, Tableau, and Superset to analyse data from our group data warehouse
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and insights
Develop visualizations and storytelling to communicate complex data analysis in an understandable manner
Understand and apply core e-commerce KPIs in your analysis
Utilize your analytical and problem-solving skills to identify trends and insights



What You Should Bring


Currently enrolled in a degree in business, mathematics, science, or engineering
Experience in writing and reviewing SQL queries
Proficiency in building visualizations and data storytelling
Understanding of core e-commerce KPIs
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

üíºData Analyst

üóìÔ∏èStart Date: Immediate

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Python / SQL / Clean Energy / Hydrogen / Data Engineer




Interested in using your Data Analysis / Engineering background to help tackle some of the biggest challenges in the Clean Technology market?




You'll join a team that are a market leader in the production and storage of Green Hydrogen, who have recently started looking for a Senior Energy Data Analyst to join their team in Berlin (Hybrid / Remote available).




The role:




As a key member of the team's Data group you'll enjoy a lot of responsibility, and will take a lead role in designing the structure of the existing database, analyse weather and market price data, and act as the interface between the electricity market, RES generation, and in-house Hydrogen production teams.




What's on offer?




A very competitive compensation package.




The chance to enjoy a lot of responsibility as part of a small team of experts
A hands-on engineering role with one of the best funded Clean Technology teams in the industry




Ideally you'll have a combination of:




Python
SQL

Title: Growth Data Analyst Intern (all genders)
Description:
As Europe's fastest-growing unicorn, we revolutionize eCommerce globally. Through strategic acquisitions, scaling initiatives, and cutting-edge technology, we're the top player in the industry. Following our recent acquisition of Perch - the leading US aggregator - and a successful Series D funding round led by Presight Captial, we're aimed toward a $1 billion top-line business!

Your Role

As a Growth Data Analyst Intern on our Organic Growth & Automation Team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Team Lead in both strategic and operational development efforts aimed at enhancing the organic growth of our product portfolio. You will be involved in collaborations with external stakeholders to optimize and expand our reach. A great opportunity to develop and refine your skills in a supportive and innovative environment with a talented team that is building Europe's next-generation consumer goods giant!

Your responsibilities will include:


Assisting in the strategic planning and execution of organic growth initiatives to enhance marketplace performance
Utilizing AI and advanced automation tools to ensure product listings for over 40,000 products are optimized to deliver maximum value to consumers, driving sales growth
Leveraging your technical skills to process and analyze data using Excel, SQL, and/or Python, ensuring listings meet the highest standards
Collaborating closely with internal teams and external partners to drive strategic collaborations and partnerships
Maintaining a keen eye for detail to ensure all product listings are accurate, comprehensive, and compelling


Your Profile

To succeed in this role you:


Are currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree from a top-ranking university
Hold strong skills in Excel, SQL, and/or Python
Possess the ability to process and analyze data effectively to drive insights and actions
Pay exceptional attention to detail, ensuring high standards are maintained across all tasks
Are Comfortable working with AI tools and advanced automation technologies
Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and is eager to contribute to the growth of a leading e-commerce company
Have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams


About Razor Group

We are revolutionizing the e-commerce world, reaching over $1 billion in value and over $700 million in revenue, with the backing of top investors like Black Rock, VPC, and Fortress, Apollo, 468 Capital, Rocket Internet. Along with Perch and our previous acquisitions of Factory14 in Spain, Valoreo in Latin America, and our German competitor Stryze, we now operate a catalogue of over 40,000 products across 3 continents and 10+ countries. Headquartered in Berlin, we are also present in Austin, Boston, Delhi NCR, Hangzhou, and Mexico City!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Lockers
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

The Vinted Go Points domain at Vinted Go is responsible for expanding and maintaining points (parcel lockers & shops that act as pick-up and drop-off points) network for our logistics operations. As a Decision Scientist, you will play a crucial role in optimising locker data usage for analytical purposes, gathering insights, and improving user flows by defining success metrics, conducting A/B tests, and creating insightful dashboards. Your responsibilities include ensuring a comprehensive view of locker performance, enhancing maintenance visibility, performing anomaly detection, and analysing recurring issues. This role also offers the opportunity to develop future capabilities for auto-detecting potential problems and upcoming maintenance needs to proactively address locker performance and user experience challenges.

We have three distinct roles within Data Science & Analytics (DSA). We believe each role can make a similar business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation ‚Äì translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed optimally, and designing, developing, and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


In this position, you‚Äôll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities, answer key business questions, improve, and maintain data products.
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact.
Propose and implement key metrics that measure business performance, set up monitoring, and proactively flag issues.
Ensure requests are answered optimally (e.g., in the form of an ad hoc deep dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis).
Define the requirements for A/B testing and analyse the results of A/B tests.
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-service and dashboarding tools (Looker).
Closely collaborate with the product manager and help create a roadmap with prioritised hypotheses and analyses.


About You


Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes.
Strong communication skills, capable of presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences convincingly.
Proficiency in dealing with technical challenges when building data products.
Entry to intermediate experience in the field of data analytics, typically 2+ years of work experience or equivalent proficiency.
Statistical proficiency, including A/B testing and regression analysis.
Fluent in SQL with practical experience in Python.
Experience with dashboarding tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc.
Advantageous: Experience collaborating with cross-functional product teams.
Advantageous: Background in logistics or e-commerce.


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨ 57,000 - ‚Ç¨ 77,100 gross per year.

  • Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation ‚Äì translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
  • Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
  • Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed optimally, and designing, developing, and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.

In this position, you‚Äôll

  • Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities, answer key business questions, improve, and maintain data products.
  • Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact.
  • Propose and implement key metrics that measure business performance, set up monitoring, and proactively flag issues.
  • Ensure requests are answered optimally (e.g., in the form of an ad hoc deep dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis).
  • Define the requirements for A/B testing and analyse the results of A/B tests.
  • Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-service and dashboarding tools (Looker).
  • Closely collaborate with the product manager and help create a roadmap with prioritised hypotheses and analyses.

About You

  • Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes.
  • Strong communication skills, capable of presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences convincingly.
  • Proficiency in dealing with technical challenges when building data products.
  • Entry to intermediate experience in the field of data analytics, typically 2+ years of work experience or equivalent proficiency.
  • Statistical proficiency, including A/B testing and regression analysis.
  • Fluent in SQL with practical experience in Python.
  • Experience with dashboarding tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc.
  • Advantageous: Experience collaborating with cross-functional product teams.
  • Advantageous: Background in logistics or e-commerce.

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨ 57,000 - ‚Ç¨ 77,100 gross per year.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world‚Äôs leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We‚Äôre also a unicorn and have raised more than ‚Ç¨675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Title: Graduate Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like

  • Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
  • Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
  • Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
  • Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
  • Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards

What we are looking for in you?

  • A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
  • Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
  • Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
  • Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
  • Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wen suchen wir?

Willkommen in der faszinierenden Welt der Daten bei PAPER & TEA!

Hier, wo die Kunst der Teezubereitung auf die Wissenschaft der Datenanalyse trifft, suchen wir nach einem Data Analyst (m/w/d), mit einem Verst√§ndnis, Zahlen zum Sprechen zu bringen. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Teams durchforstest du gro√üe Datenstr√∂me, entdeckst verborgene Muster und entfaltest wertvolle Erkenntnisse, die unsere Gesch√§ftsentscheidungen befl√ºgeln. Deine Expertise und dein Gesp√ºr f√ºr Trends helfen uns, die perfekte Balance zwischen Tradition und Innovation zu finden ‚Äì und damit den Tee unserer Zukunft zu kreieren.

Deine Aufgaben

Als Data Analyst (m/w/d) bei PAPER & TEA spielst du eine Schl√ºsselrolle in unserer datengetriebenen Strategie. Deine Aufgaben umfassen:


Datenaufbereitung und Bereinigung: Du sammelst und bereitest Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen auf und stellst sicher, dass sie in h√∂chster Qualit√§t und Konsistenz vorliegen.
Datenanalyse und Interpretation: Mit deinem scharfen Blick f√ºr Details f√ºhrst du statistische Analysen durch, identifizierst Muster und Trends und nutzt Data-Mining-Techniken, um wertvolle Einblicke zu gewinnen.
Datenvisualisierung: Du verwandelst komplexe Daten in ansprechende, visuelle Darstellungen und unterst√ºtzt die Kommunikation durch den Einsatz von Tools wie Tableau, Power BI oder Matplotlib.
Berichte und Dashboards: Du entwickelst regelm√§√üige Berichte und Dashboards zur √úberwachung unserer KPIs und stellst relevante Metriken bereit, die unsere Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung bei strategischen Entscheidungen unterst√ºtzen.
Datenmodellierung: Du entwickelst und pflegst Datenmodelle, die zur Strukturierung und Organisation unserer Daten beitragen und die Qualit√§t der Datenanalyse verbessern.
Machine Learning und Predictive Analytics: Du implementierst Machine-Learning-Algorithmen und entwickelst pr√§diktive Modelle, um zuk√ºnftige Trends fr√ºhzeitig zu erkennen.
Datenbankverwaltung: Du sicherst die Integrit√§t unserer Datenbanken durch Verwaltung, Pflege und Optimierung ihrer Performance und f√ºhrst regelm√§√üig Backups und Wiederherstellungen durch.
Datenqualit√§tssicherung: Du implementierst Prozesse zur Sicherstellung der Datenqualit√§t und f√ºhrst regelm√§√üige √úberpr√ºfungen und Audits durch.
Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern: In enger Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Abteilungen erf√ºllst du deren Datenanforderungen und sorgst daf√ºr, dass die Analyseergebnisse effektiv kommuniziert werden.
Weiterbildung und Schulung: Du bleibst immer auf dem neuesten Stand der Entwicklungen und Best Practices im Bereich Datenanalyse und nimmst an Schulungen und Konferenzen teil, um dein Wissen stetig zu erweitern.


In dieser Position bist du nicht nur Analyst, sondern ein kreativer Gestalter unserer datenbasierten Zukunft.

Dein Profil


Fundiertes Fachwissen: Dein abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem verwandten Bereich sowie deine umfassenden Kenntnisse in SQL und Datenbankverwaltung spiegeln unser Streben nach Pr√§zision und Exzellenz wider.
Analytische Brillanz: Deine Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R und deine F√§higkeiten in Datenvisualisierungstools wie Tableau und Power BI machen dich zum Architekten der Erkenntnisse, die unsere Entscheidungen leiten.
Innovative Technologien: Deine Kenntnisse in Machine Learning und pr√§diktiver Modellierung sowie deine Erfahrung mit SAP Analytics unterstreichen deine Rolle als Wegbereiter f√ºr datengetriebene Innovationen in unserem Unternehmen.
Kommunikationsst√§rke: Deine F√§higkeit, komplexe Analyse Ergebnisse verst√§ndlich zu vermitteln, unterst√ºtzt unsere Philosophie der Transparenz und Zusammenarbeit.
Teamplayer-Mentalit√§t: Du arbeitest gerne in multidisziplin√§ren Teams, verfolgst gemeinsame Ziele und tr√§gst dazu bei, unsere Werte von Herzlichkeit und Gemeinschaft zu leben.
Detailorientierung und Probleml√∂sungsf√§higkeit: Dein Auge f√ºrs Detail und deine F√§higkeit, komplexe Probleme durch logische, datenbasierte L√∂sungen zu meistern, sind zentral f√ºr unseren Erfolg.
Zeitmanagement und Flexibilit√§t: Du planst und priorisierst effektiv, um Deadlines zu halten und passt dich flexibel an neue Anforderungen und dynamische Arbeitsumgebungen an.
Lernbereitschaft und kritisches Denken: Deine Offenheit f√ºr neue Methoden, Tools und Technologien sowie dein Drang, Annahmen zu hinterfragen und alternative L√∂sungswege zu evaluieren, treiben deine kontinuierliche pers√∂nliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung voran.
Projektmanagement-Skills: Deine F√§higkeit, Projekte zu planen, zu organisieren und erfolgreich abzuschlie√üen, macht dich zu einem unverzichtbaren Partner in unserem Team.


Warum wir?

Ein Arbeitsumfeld auf Premium-Niveau: Genie√üe die Vorz√ºge eines exklusiven Arbeitsumfelds, das Professionalit√§t mit der Leidenschaft f√ºr ausgezeichneten Tee und einem tiefen Bewusstsein f√ºr unsere gesellschaftliche Verantwortung verbindet.

Pers√∂nliche Entwicklung: Wir bieten dir zahlreiche M√∂glichkeiten zur fachlichen und pers√∂nlichen Weiterbildung, weil wir die Leistung jedes Einzelnen sch√§tzen und wissen, dass unser gemeinsames Wachstum auf der stetigen Entwicklung jedes Teammitglieds beruht.

Ein Team von Helden: Bei uns findest du ein Team, das sich durch Zusammenhalt, Diversit√§t und das gemeinsame Ziel auszeichnet, nicht nur die Welt sicherer zu machen, sondern auch einen positiven Beitrag zur Gesellschaft zu leisten.

Potenzielle Weiterentwicklung: Diese Position bietet die M√∂glichkeit zur Weiterentwicklung zum Team Lead Business Intelligence (BI). In dieser Rolle √ºbernimmst du die Verantwortung f√ºr ein Team von BI-Spezialisten und gestaltest die BI-Strategie des Unternehmens ma√ügeblich mit. Du leitest die Implementierung und Optimierung von BI-Tools und -Systemen, um eine effektive Entscheidungsunterst√ºtzung zu gew√§hrleisten. Zudem arbeitest du eng mit verschiedenen Abteilungen zusammen, um deren BI-Anforderungen zu verstehen und umzusetzen. Durch die √úbernahme von F√ºhrungsaufgaben und die Weiterentwicklung deiner F√§higkeiten im Bereich Business Intelligence und Teammanagement bereitest du dich auf diese verantwortungsvolle Position vor.

√úber uns

Unsere Marke l√§sst sich nicht kategorisieren. Durch inspirierende und innovative Erlebnisse zeigen wir, was eine Marke in dieser Welt alles sein kann. Intern basiert unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Co-Kreation, individuellem proaktivem Handeln und kollektiver Unterst√ºtzung und Wertsch√§tzung. Nach au√üen hin m√∂chten wir Menschen und Orte mit W√§rme und Freude verbinden. Wir m√∂chten die Grenzen zwischen ihnen und uns aufweichen, unsere G√§ste nicht als blo√üe Konsument:innen betrachten und ein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr ein gegenseitiges Miteinander f√∂rdern. Mit mehr als 35 Stores in aktuell sieben L√§ndern (Deutschland, √ñsterreich, Schweiz, Niederlande, Belgien, D√§nemark, Norwegen), einem internationalen Online-Shop und Team aus √ºber 350 Mitarbeiter:innen tragen wir unsere Mission, das Leben zu bereichern, nach au√üen.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We‚Äôre looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to People Analytics Lead you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (‚ÄúFrom Hire to Retire‚Äù)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨ 68,000 - ‚Ç¨ 92,000 gross per year.

  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨ 68,000 - ‚Ç¨ 92,000 gross per year.

Title: Data Analyst Lead, Go-to-market Strategy
Description:
Remerge helps leading mobile app marketers increase revenue and retention by activating, re-engaging and retaining high-value users through programmatic in-app ads. Founded in 2014, Remerge has established itself as a leading app retargeting player globally, with offices spanning Berlin, New York, Singapore, Seoul and Tokyo. Our international team of experts has contributed to the growth of hundreds of apps across all major verticals, including gaming, on-demand delivery, e-commerce, and finance.

Job mission

We're seeking a highly organised Data Analyst Lead, Go-to-market Strategy to join our team. In this role, you'll redesign how data is presented within the revenue department and lead the definition and implementation of a collective, data-driven and decision-making culture.

Job Responsibilities


Assist with formulating and communicating annual board goals to the revenue team. Prepare a status report on what regions may require to achieve the appointed board goals
Define KPIs for productivity measurement of sales, account management, and marketing. Develop monthly productivity reports and share key insights with stakeholders
Select key KPIs for revenue strategy planning and provide preliminary analysis of data every quarter
Ensure accurate forecasting and anecdotal insight population during our quarterly business reviews. Prepare quarterly business reports summarising key highlights and action items
Manage and mentor a CRM specialist, guiding their professional development and ensuring best practices in CRM management


Job Requirements


Innate interest in understanding the business context
Ability to create precise business narratives based on data analysis
Strong project management and organisational skills
Advanced qualitative and quantitative research skills
Proven practices for effective internal communication
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, PowerBI, or other data visualisation tools
Proficiency in Salesforce


Our promise


Direct Impact: Accelerate your career in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of responsibility.
Competitive Remuneration: Enjoy a top-tier package including stock option awards in a profitable company.
Personal Growth: Take advantage of our budget for books, conferences, and other training materials.
Flexible Schedule: We offer flexible working hours, unlimited home office days, and the ability to take as much time off as you need.
Office Exchange: Travel to our global offices for short-term assignments.
Team Events: Celebrate achievements and enjoy team off-sites with an amazing team.


Remerge is an Equal Opportunity Employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, gender, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, veteran status or disability. We're looking forward to your application!

Important notice: Protect yourself from scammers representing Remerge

Do not respond to job offers from third parties claiming to recruit on behalf of Remerge, or individuals impersonating as Remerge employees offering freelance or remote work opportunities. We do not ask job applicants for personal information like bank account numbers, address, money transfer requests, or other confidential details on any messaging platform. If someone reaches out to you to offer you a job, make sure that they are a verified Remerge employee by checking their identity on official Remerge channels.

Please note that the only job openings we offer are listed on our official website: remerge.io/careers

Stay vigilant and protect yourself from potential scams.

Please review our Applicants Privacy Policy.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. Your role will involve developing dashboards, reports, and visualizations, collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and meet their data needs, and conducting advanced statistical analyses. You will ensure data integrity and accuracy, communicate findings effectively, and contribute to the strategic direction of our data division within the engineering department. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to track key metrics.
Own part of our data transformation layer where we apply data modeling techniques (via dbt) to transform raw data into analytics-friendly data assets
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Conduct advanced statistical analyses and predictive modeling to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Develop domain expertise in a set of business domains (e.g. Product, Marketing, Operations or Sales) to become a valuable partner to our business stakeholders
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.




ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Experience in data modeling using DBT
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with statistical analysis and predictive modeling is a plus.


MORE THAN A JOB:

We are Blacklane, providers of premium global chauffeur services. Our mission is to create true peace of mind for discerning travellers by delivering perfect experiences around the world and to inspire a better future. Blacklane is offering airport transfers, City-to-City commutes, In-city mobility chauffeur hailing and Chauffeur-by-the-hour in over 50 countries globally, either pre-booked or on-demand. Whether it's for business or pleasure, Blacklane and its 300 employees and tens of thousands of chauffeur partners have the right premium transportation service for you. By changing how people move, we opened up new opportunities for our chauffeur providers and set industry standards for climate protection in the travel industry.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture:


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days.
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit √ºber 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 L√§ndern und f√ºhrend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.

Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir f√∂rdern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und sch√§tzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Gro√üartiges.

Aufgaben

Deine Leidenschaft


Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen f√ºr Kund:innen
Zusammenh√§nge komplexer Gesch√§ftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren
Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung
Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen



Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Qualifikation

Dein Talent


Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)
Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics
Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin
Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region



Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erf√ºllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert f√ºr die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne dar√ºber sprechen!

Benefits

Unser Versprechen

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant, entry-level)
Description:
Come work with us




Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight‚Äôs purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.







About us




Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.







What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight?




Join the Netlight Berlin team as a consultant and be a part of shaping the software products and technical solutions of today and tomorrow alongside your colleagues and clients. The role will vary between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you.




Our focus is not just on the digital product, but also on the team and the business. You'll have the ownership to carve your own career path, starting somewhere familiar and building from there. As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. As a consultant within the data area, you will help our clients in roles such as Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer, Data Architect, Analytics Engineer, to name a few. We build comprehensive data platforms that encompass data warehousing & data lake infrastructure, data modeling, and the implementation of ETL/ELT data pipelines, whether batch or real-time. We design and implement innovative data products, incorporating elements of backend and cloud engineering. We are at the forefront advising clients around emerging topics such as data governance, AI and data mesh. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.







Minimum Qualifications




Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering AND 2 years of full-time working experience in a similar role
Working student and/or internship experience in agile software engineering roles
Verbal and written proficiency in English
Based in Berlin or willingness to relocate to Berlin (or see other open Netlight job ads) - no travelling required!




Preferred Qualifications

Master's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering




We are looking for newly graduated software developers with 1-2 years of relevant experience within tech projects. If we find that your profile matches what we are looking for, you will hear from us within two weeks of applying.




We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Climate Change Analyst | Carbon Footprinting, Data Insights | Berlin
Description:
My client is an innovative tech-for-good start-up based in Berlin. With almost a third of global greenhouse gases coming from food production, this cutting-edge software provider is at the forefront of the solution securing funding of over ‚Ç¨10 million in just 2 years. They require a Business Analyst to help their clients understand the climate data insights in order to set an accurate and achievable Net Zero target.

The role


Conduct calculations to work out carbon footprints for several different clients
Work closely with their client base ensuring accurate data collection, calculations and data analysis
Produce insights from the calculations to be used for Net Zero target plans
Keeping up to date with the latest environmental regulations and protocols
Create ‚Äúproducts‚Äù from the calculations to offer the same service to future clients


Skills And Experience Required


At least 3 years‚Äô experience with client facing positions
Previous experience in consulting start-ups (or other fast paced environments)
Strong skills in complex datasets and quantitative analysis
Any experience in carbon footprint calculations would be valuable
Fluent in both German and English


In Return, They Can Offer


A salary of up to ‚Ç¨80k depending on experience
Generous benefits package
Top of the range city centre office


If this role sounds of interest, feel free to apply or reach out to Luke Rose directly!

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Scoutbee is looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join our team in Berlin. and reporting directly to the Strategy & Operations Lead.

In this role you'll focus on advancing our thinking beyond the "here and now" with responsibility for structured data analysis, Business Intelligence, data visualisation. You will be a key player in enabling decision making across the business, importantly providing data and insights to senior management and executive teams.

Your role in our hive


Data-driven & analytics mindset : Contribute to Scoutbee's success by analyzing and visualizing datasets from various sources, developing analytical solutions, and delivering actionable insights that support in our strategic business decisions.
Critical thinking and problem-solving: Use analytical skills to impact strategy execution, break down existing business processes using data, identify potential inefficiencies and suggest effective solutions to enhance overall processes across the whole organization.
Interpersonal skills: Work closely with the C-level team and ensure that data & insights that support our strategic goals are communicated simply, clearly and effectively across the organization and among senior stakeholders and to our investors.
Drive strategic projects: Manage BI projects throughout the entire lifecycle, planning and delegating tasks while strategising solutions and ensuring the successful completion and execution of the project.
Major Plus - Salesforce Proficiency


What you bring to our hive


3+ years of experience as a BI Analyst in analytics/insights/strategy
University degree within engineering, data & insights, business strategy or equivalent
Strong Data analysis / insights and Data Visualization skills with proven track record in delivering exceptional results in these fields
Hands-on experience with BI & analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Superset, or PowerBI)
Analyzing usage statistics is something you enjoy, as well as collaborating with stakeholders to refine our requirements and create improvements.
Proficiency in structured problem solving, business case modeling and engaging storytelling.
You are a team player with a hands-on mentality, comfort with ambiguity, ability to translate insights into actionable recommendations and strong organizational skills.
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite.
Experience and availability to work with global stakeholders, especially across Europe and North America.
Nice to have: Understanding of programming languages (e.g., R, Java, Python)


What's in it for you? #beehivelife:


Work with a team on a mission to revolutionize digital procurement - for better data, better decisions, and a better world.
Contribute your ideas and work on challenging projects that will impact the future of modern procurement.
Virtual Stock Option Program for all employees, because ownership at all levels matters.
Development budget and growth paths for your individual learning journey.
Hybrid working model with flexibility for remote work and onsite collaboration.
Benefits supporting your health and wellbeing (Urban Sports Club, Counseling through Better Help, company organized sports activities).
Kindergarten grant, with priority selection for Kita in our Berlin building.


Worried that you don't quite tick all the boxes? Don't sweat it. For us, personality and willingness to grow and learn are more important than qualifications. We're aware that underestimation of one's own abilities or imposter syndrome can be reasons why someone doesn't apply. We say that not knowing it all can actually be a good thing and that we're more than happy to support ‚Äì and learn from ‚Äì our new employees while they find their feet at Scoutbee.

About Scoutbee:

Unlike traditional in-house solutions, search engines, and generic Gen AI tools, Scoutbee provides deep category expertise and a sophisticated technology stack developed over seven years in collaboration with procurement experts, data scientists, and developers. Our unique Large Language Model enriches supplier profiles and understands complex user requirements, offering results that align closely with buyers' needs.

Scoutbee leverages the entire internet as its database, providing unparalleled access to a vast number of suppliers. Our impartial search technology ranks suppliers based on the relevance of their website content, ensuring unbiased results. As an endorsed SAP partner, Scoutbee's integration within SAP Ariba Guided Sourcing delivers seamless access to advanced supplier discovery capabilities, driving efficiency and value for organizations.

We'd love to hear from you!

At Scoutbee, we're on a mission to connect. Our employees focus on shared experiences so they can have a more accurate view of the world. This enables us to innovate, challenge our own ideas and assumptions, and be ourselves at work. For us, personality and cultural fit are more important than qualifications. If you're worried that you don't quite tick all the boxes, don't be. We say that not knowing it all can actually be a good thing and we're more than happy to support ‚Äì and learn from ‚Äì our new colleagues while they find their feet at Scoutbee. Scoutbee is an equal opportunities employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnic background, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

HTML:
Scoutbee is looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join our team in Berlin. and reporting directly to the Strategy & Operations Lead.

In this role you'll focus on advancing our thinking beyond the "here and now" with responsibility for structured data analysis, Business Intelligence, data visualisation. You will be a key player in enabling decision making across the business, importantly providing data and insights to senior management and executive teams.

Your role in our hive

  • Data-driven & analytics mindset : Contribute to Scoutbee's success by analyzing and visualizing datasets from various sources, developing analytical solutions, and delivering actionable insights that support in our strategic business decisions.
  • Critical thinking and problem-solving: Use analytical skills to impact strategy execution, break down existing business processes using data, identify potential inefficiencies and suggest effective solutions to enhance overall processes across the whole organization.
  • Interpersonal skills: Work closely with the C-level team and ensure that data & insights that support our strategic goals are communicated simply, clearly and effectively across the organization and among senior stakeholders and to our investors.
  • Drive strategic projects: Manage BI projects throughout the entire lifecycle, planning and delegating tasks while strategising solutions and ensuring the successful completion and execution of the project.
  • Major Plus - Salesforce Proficiency

What you bring to our hive

  • 3+ years of experience as a BI Analyst in analytics/insights/strategy
  • University degree within engineering, data & insights, business strategy or equivalent
  • Strong Data analysis / insights and Data Visualization skills with proven track record in delivering exceptional results in these fields
  • Hands-on experience with BI & analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Superset, or PowerBI)
  • Analyzing usage statistics is something you enjoy, as well as collaborating with stakeholders to refine our requirements and create improvements.
  • Proficiency in structured problem solving, business case modeling and engaging storytelling.
  • You are a team player with a hands-on mentality, comfort with ambiguity, ability to translate insights into actionable recommendations and strong organizational skills.
  • Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite.
  • Experience and availability to work with global stakeholders, especially across Europe and North America.
  • Nice to have: Understanding of programming languages (e.g., R, Java, Python)

What's in it for you? #beehivelife:

  • Work with a team on a mission to revolutionize digital procurement - for better data, better decisions, and a better world.
  • Contribute your ideas and work on challenging projects that will impact the future of modern procurement.
  • Virtual Stock Option Program for all employees, because ownership at all levels matters.
  • Development budget and growth paths for your individual learning journey.
  • Hybrid working model with flexibility for remote work and onsite collaboration.
  • Benefits supporting your health and wellbeing (Urban Sports Club, Counseling through Better Help, company organized sports activities).
  • Kindergarten grant, with priority selection for Kita in our Berlin building.

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company‚Äôs performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You‚Äôll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
4+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987
