Title: Staff Data Analyst - Digital Tracking (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You‚Äôll Do


Accountable for your teams‚Äô data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the ‚Äúso-whats‚Äù of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




¬∑ Work up to 20 hours per week.

¬∑ Earn a competitive rate of pay.

¬∑ Develop your research skills.

¬∑ Avoid the long commute.

¬∑ Work from the comfort of your home office.

¬∑ Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando‚Äôs Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What We‚Äôre Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About the team:

Within the Global Operations organisation, our mission is to build the best customer experience in the fintech industry by delivering an effortless journey to all our merchants. We are looking for a skilled and passionate Senior Data Analyst to join our talented Data & Insights Team.

As a Senior Data Analyst at SumUp, you will be responsible for pushing forward a data-driven culture within the Operations organisation. You will be the primary point of contact for the Customer Success team, working alongside them to define and evaluate impactful retention, acquisition, and growth campaigns. Additionally, you will directly impact the definition of the merchant activation journey, allowing the business to identify weak areas in the funnel and understand Churn across different business segments. You will work with other data analysts, analytics engineers and data scientists to leverage business knowledge into impactful insights and recommendations.

What You‚Äôll Do


Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Customer Success and Operations Leadership teams.
Partner up with Operations Leadership to develop strategies based on data-driven insights and qualitative analysis, focusing on Customer Lifecycle and Churn.
Visualise insights and interpret results to present findings to stakeholders across the organisation, providing actionable recommendations based on your analysis.
Help define and implement KPIs to measure the success of acquisition, retention and growth campaigns driven by CSM.
Leverage SQL and data modelling best practices to manage and transform high volumes of data into actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven strategies.
Mentor junior members to elevate analytics across the team.


You‚Äôll be great for this position if you have:


5+ years experience working as a Data Analyst, preferably with knowledge of customer behaviour and lifecycle.
Proficiency in developing, optimising and validating SQL queries and data models.
Hands-on experience developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau.
The capacity to examine business requirements across various functional areas and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards.
Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex data findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working independently as well as play a key role in mentoring and guiding others in a team


Why you should join SumUp:

üåç Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

üåà Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

üìö A dedicated annual L&D budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

üöÄ Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp‚Äôs future success

üí∂ A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

üîÑ 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

üîó Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

üöµüèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We‚Äôre the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.




We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.




Responsibilities




Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.




Required Skills




5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Desirable Skills




Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Show more
HTML:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)


As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.


We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.


Responsibilities


  • Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
  • Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
  • Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
  • Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
  • Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
  • Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
  • Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
  • Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.


Required Skills


  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
  • Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
  • Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
  • Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
  • Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
  • Previous experience with AB testing
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
  • Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
  • Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


Desirable Skills


  • Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
  • Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
  • An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Title: Staff Data Analyst - BI and Marketing Analytics (All genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are looking for a Staff Data Analyst (All genders) to join the BI and Marketing Analytic ( BIMA) team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences. This is a global position working closely with our brands in over 70 countries and implementing strategy from our HQ in Berlin.

BIMA is part of the Global marketing team responsible for central BI and marketing analytics . BIMA‚Äô s team mission is to drive marketing actions through data-driven solutions & strategic insights to ensure sustainable growth. We drive strategic projects such as customer segmentation, marketing ROI measurement , CLV and support the C-level in making strategic decisions across all brands and countries.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

The Staff Data Analyst will be responsible for optimizing our marketing strategies through data-driven insights and advanced analytics. This role will collaborate closely with the marketing leads , product, and data science teams, and regional analytic teams to analyze marketing performance and optimize our acquisition and retention strategies.

Your key responsibilities include :


Utilize analytics to provide actionable insights on marketing performance.
Design and implement A/B testing and other experimental frameworks to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
Create tools , KPI frameworks, and reports to measure ROI of marketing spend. Continuously monitor and guide marketing spend across various channels to maximize ROI.
Analyze and improve the customer segmentation to drive targeting strategies in the local markets and increase customer retention
Create statistical models to project customer lifetime value, measure customer acquisition costs (CAC) and use analytics to reduce CAC and increase LTV
Work closely with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure alignment on data needs and create global guidelines on how data needs to be collected and consumed.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.


What you need to be successful


4+ years of experience in marketing analytics, with a focus on user retention for technology-driven consumer facing companies.
Strong proficiency in analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Google Big Query, Google Analytics, Tableau, SQL, Python/R).
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with A/B testing, attribution modeling, and other experimental design methodologies.
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels and strategies, including CRM, paid search, social media, and content marketing.


Nice to have:


Experience in agile development and methodologies
BS, MS or PhD in computer science, statistics, math, physic, business, etc
Expertise in developing and implementing naming conventions and tagging strategies to ensure data consistency in a global organization. Experience with Market mix modeling


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can‚Äôt wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Was du bei uns machst

Wenn du dazu noch eine Leidenschaft f√ºr Werbung hast und dich in einem lebendigen und kreativen Umfeld weiterentwickeln m√∂chtest, bist du bei uns genau richtig!


Entwicklung und Pflege von Dashboards
Entwicklung und Erstellung von Reportings f√ºr Kunden
Erstellung von Audiences und Insights als Basis f√ºr Strategieausarbeitungen

Unterst√ºtzung bei der Erarbeitung von Kanalstrategien und strategischen Empfehlungen f√ºr Kunden im Bereich Datenanalyse/Reporting

Aufbau und Vorantreiben der Dateninfrastruktur des Teams


Was du mitbringst


Du hast bereits Berufserfahrung im Bereich Social Media in einer digitalen Agentur mit dem Schwerpunkt Datenanalyse gesammelt (Performance Agentur, Mediaagentur)
Du bringst Kenntnisse in der Social Media Analyse von Tools mit (zB Facebook Business Manager, Twitter Analytics, Instagram Analytics, Emplifi etc.), sowie Kenntnisse in der Visualisierung von Tools und Datenbanken (zB Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI, IBM Kognos / SQL, MS SQL, P SQL)
Du hast bereits fundierte Erfahrung mit Web- und Marketing Analytics (zB Google Analytics, SAS, Salesforce, Adobe, Microsoft etc.)
Du besitzt fachliches Know How in Global Web Index oder Best4Planning
Besonders deine Erfahrungen mit Looker Studio und Supermetrics bringst du erfolgreich bei uns ein
Du besitzt die F√§higkeit Social Media KPIs und ihre Abh√§ngigkeit zu verstehen (Paid und Organic) sowie das Verst√§ndnis, Erkenntnis in ansprechende und verst√§ndliche Darstellungen zu √ºbertragen
Durch dein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr Prozesse der Social Media Datenerhebung und Darstellung bereicherst du das gesamte Team (Benchmarking, Index-Berechnung, Mittelwert, Lineare Regression, Box Plot und Skalenniveaus)


Wer wir sind

Gegr√ºndet 1981 in Hamburg, sind wir als eine der f√ºhrenden Kreativ-Agenturen im deutschsprachigen Raum mittlerweile mit Standorten in Berlin, D√ºsseldorf, Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Z√ºrich, Wien und Br√ºssel vertreten. Bei uns arbeiten rund 1.200 Kolleg*innen ‚Äì wir nennen sie Friends ‚Äì mit Leidenschaft und Kreativit√§t f√ºr gro√üe und kleine Kunden aus allen Branchen.

Wie wir unsere Friendskultur leben

Alle Friends haben bei uns den Raum, sie selbst zu sein, zu lernen und zu wachsen. Du kannst innovative Ideen einbringen und gro√ü werden lassen. Auf dich warten neue Herausforderungen und vielf√§ltige Weiterbildungsangebote. Im Mittelpunkt stehen immer die Menschen und ein wertsch√§tzendes Miteinander. Daher sind Vielfalt, Gleichberechtigung und Inklusion wesentlich in unserer Wertekultur und Managementstrategie. In unserer Academy und mit unseren Angeboten setzen wir auf Mental Health, Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf sowie einen gro√üen Fokus auf Diversity-Impulse in Unconscious-Bias-Workshops, in Vortr√§gen oder innerhalb verschiedener Mitarbeitendennetzwerke (ERGs).

Was es oben drauf gibt


Wir erm√∂glichen ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (zwei Office-Tage) und flexible Arbeitszeiten
Arbeiten aus dem EU-Ausland | bis zu 45 Tage
Discounts bei Dienstleistern und Fitnessstudios im Umkreis unserer Standorte
VerguÃànstigter Paketpreis von "Wellhub" fuÃàr Sport-, Freizeit-, Wellness- oder App-Angebote
M√∂glichkeit der Mitgestaltung der Agenturkultur durch Round Tables und Mitarbeitendeninitiativen, wie z.‚ÄØB. unserer &Queer*-Community
Scholz & Friends Academy: offene Weiterbildungsangebote zu Fachthemen, Impulsgebungen, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging (D.E.I.B.) und vielem mehr
Mental-Health-Support in Kooperation mit unseren Partner*innen von Telus Health: u.a. Videositzungen mit Therapeut*innen und Psycholog*innen, zur F√∂rderung der individuellen mentalen Gesundheit
Eltern-Kind-Service zur F√∂rderung des familienfreundlichen Klimas am Arbeitsplatz und eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance mit unseren Partner*innen von voiio


Weitere Benefits an deinem Standort erf√§hrst du im pers√∂nlichen Gespr√§ch!

Verrate uns gerne, wie du angesprochen werden m√∂chtest (Wunschname und Pronomen). Dann k√∂nnen wir dies im gesamten Prozess ber√ºcksichtigen.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Onsite. Berlin Mitte, Germany.

About Us

Founded in 2021, the company is a trailblazing supply chain platform that has redefined the way large construction material orders are sourced, distributed, and financed. The company is on a mission to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing access to high-quality construction materials at a global scale through their innovative platform. Since its launch in January 2022, the company has successfully served hundreds of companies and generated exponential growth towards profitability.

The company‚Äôs distinct competitive advantage lies in its ability to organize the supply chain through digital innovation. By eliminating middlemen and embracing tech-first and AI, it creates a seamless connection between suppliers and buyers. Its proprietary platform technology not only facilitates supply and demand matching but also offers a comprehensive suite of services, including cloud inventory management, fulfilment solutions, and fintech capabilities.

Since its inception, the company has been at the forefront of construction material management, helping companies access high-quality materials efficiently and cost-effectively. The platform provides a user-friendly experience that empowers businesses to thrive. The company counts 75+ FTEs located across Germany (Berlin HQ), China, and India. The company is on track to achieve profitability and generated triple digits million GMV.

About This Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in the heart of Berlin. In this pivotal role, you will define and execute our data modeling and analysis strategy, drive data governance and quality assurance excellence, take the lead in tool and system innovation, and introduce best practices and mentoring.

You will work closely with business intelligence professionals, senior engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders from sales, procurement, and accounting to develop features that drive business growth.

Tasks

What You Will Do


Lead the development and maintenance of the company‚Äôs BI structure to support strategic business initiatives
Conduct complex data analysis to extract deep insights and trends that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Create advanced dashboards, reports, and visualizations that facilitate data-driven decision-making at all levels of the organization
Act as a strategic partner to senior management and department heads, understanding their data needs and delivering actionable intelligence
Translate high-level business requirements into detailed technical specifications for robust data reporting and analysis
Facilitate data-driven discussions and workshops with stakeholders to enhance organizational data literacy
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data across the organization
Develop and implement comprehensive data validation and cleansing processes to maintain the highest data quality standards
Lead the continuous improvement and optimization of the BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities using advanced BI tools and platforms (such as Tableau, Power BI, SQL, and Databricks)
Mentor and develop junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth within the team



Requirements

What you bring


Master‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree is strongly preferred.
5+ years of extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting.
Proven track record of delivering strategic insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau/Power BI, SQL and Google Sheets
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks



Who You Are


Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and translate them into actionable business insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Strong ability to present data insights and strategic recommendations to diverse audiences, including senior leadership
High level of attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting
Ability to ensure data quality and integrity in all analytical processes
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and drive results in a rapidly evolving organization



Benefits

What we offer


A role with entrepreneurial freedom in a pre-validated business model, to push to the next level
An experienced founding team of serial founders
A future-proof job with an attractive salary
Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts
A challenging yet rewarding work environment, and the opportunity to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing company
Beautiful office space in the center of Berlin, monthly All-Hands, team events, and team lunches



Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs, and experienced executives!

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree is strongly preferred.
  • 5+ years of extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting.
  • Proven track record of delivering strategic insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment.
  • Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau/Power BI, SQL and Google Sheets
  • Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks


Who You Are

  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and translate them into actionable business insights
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
  • Strong ability to present data insights and strategic recommendations to diverse audiences, including senior leadership
  • High level of attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting
  • Ability to ensure data quality and integrity in all analytical processes
  • Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and drive results in a rapidly evolving organization


Benefits

What we offer

  • A role with entrepreneurial freedom in a pre-validated business model, to push to the next level
  • An experienced founding team of serial founders
  • A future-proof job with an attractive salary
  • Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment, and the opportunity to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing company
  • Beautiful office space in the center of Berlin, monthly All-Hands, team events, and team lunches


Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs, and experienced executives!

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. That‚Äôs why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

We are looking for a senior people data analyst to join our talented analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and data visualisation to support and influence key business initiatives. Your insights will directly contribute to optimising our operations and will help guide strategic decisions across the organisation.

Your new adventure:


Gather and analyze data from various P&C systems and sources, including HRIS, ATS, performance management tools, employee surveys, and external benchmarks
Identify current industry trends and patterns within People data to provide insights into areas such as recruitment, talent management, workforce demographics, turnover rates, performance metrics, and employee engagement and proactively identify opportunities to enhance the organization‚Äôs analytical capabilities
Develop and maintain key People metrics and dashboards to track progress and identify areas for improvement. Present findings and recommendations through clear and compelling data visualizations and presentations
Provide data-driven recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders to inform strategic decisions related to human resources and organizational development
Collaborate with P&C business partners and other stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions that optimize the employee experience and drive organizational success
Lead or participate in special projects and initiatives related to HR analytics, such as predictive modelling, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the HR analytics team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.


Does this sound like you?


4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
Flexible working hours as long as you‚Äôre there for your team members
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits you‚Äôd expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)


Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.

Title: Trainee Data Analytics (w/m/d)
Description:

Zus√§tzlich kannst du bei PwC Deutschland √úberstunden auf einem pers√∂nlichen Jahresarbeitszeitkonto sammeln. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von verg√ºnstigten Beitr√§gen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

‚Äì Wir m√∂chten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten m√∂glich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

Dabei stellen wir als integriertes Finance Transformation-Team das reibungslose Ineinandergreifen aller Teilprojekte entlang der gesamten Wertsch√∂pfungskette sicher.

Title: Financial Analyst ‚Äì Accounting & Data Analyst (m/w/d) 40-50%
Description:
DEINE AUFGABEN

Wenn Du Eine Leidenschaft F√ºr Digitales Lernen Hast, Teil Eines Schnell Wachsenden HR-Tech Unternehmens Sein M√∂chtest Und Mit Uns Gemeinsam Neue Standards F√ºr Die Digitale Wissensvermittlung Setzen M√∂chtest, Dann Freuen Wir Uns √úber Deine Bewerbung Als

Financial Analyst (m/w/d) ‚Äì Accounting & Data Analyst (m/w/d) mit 16-20 Stunden / Woche (40-50%) in Berlin oder Remote

Wir suchen einen Financial Analyst (m/w/d), der nicht nur die Buchhaltung im Griff hat, sondern auch das Datenuniversum beherrscht. Wenn du gerne mit Zahlen jonglierst und Daten f√ºr dich sprechen l√§sst, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!


Data Detective: Du tauchst tief in unsere Datenwelt ein, entdeckst Trends und Muster, und erstellst Berichte, die das Management umhauen.
Reporting Ninja: Du bringst unseren Datenhaushalt auf das n√§chste Level und automatisierst Reportings im Schlaf ‚Äì dank deiner Liebe zu Zahlen und Power BI.
Teamplayer Extraordinaire: Gemeinsam mit anderen Abteilungen sorgst du daf√ºr, dass unsere Entscheidungen immer auf den besten finanziellen und datenbasierten Einblicken beruhen.
Abschluss-Guard: Du sicherst die Qualit√§t unseres monatlichen Abschlussprozesses wie ein Profi.
Finance Allrounder: Du √ºbernimmst Verantwortung in den Bereichen Billing, Accounting, Controlling und Cashflow ‚Äì und das mit Leidenschaft!


DEIN PROFIL

Zahlenfreak: Ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Finanzen, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder BWL w√§re top, aber deine Skills sind entscheidender.

Pro im Finance Datagame: Du hast schon erste Erfahrungen im Finanzbereich oder als Data-Analyst gesammelt, besonders in Accounting und/oder Datenanalyse? Perfekt!

Excel Enthusiast & Power BI Profi: Excel ist f√ºr dich wie die Luft zum Atmen und Power BI dein treuer Begleiter.

Analytiker durch und durch: Du liebst es, analytisch zu denken und Zahlen sprechen zu lassen ‚Äì das ist ein absolutes Muss!

Hands-on Hero: Motivation, Flexibilit√§t und eine ‚ÄûPacken wir‚Äôs an‚Äú-Mentalit√§t zeichnen dich aus.

DAS ERWARTET DICH BEI UNS


100% remote m√∂glich Wir sind davon √ºberzeugt, dass unsere Mitarbeitenden ihr volles Potenzial entfalten k√∂nnen, wenn sie die Freiheit haben, ihre Arbeit in Einklang mit ihrem Privatleben zu bringen. Deshalb bieten wir mobiles Arbeiten, ob in unserem B√ºro in Berlin, von zu Hause oder auch Remote aus dem Ausland, je nach Wunsch.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten Wir verstehen, dass jeder Mitarbeitende unterschiedliche Bed√ºrfnisse und Verpflichtungen hat. Deshalb bieten wir flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle an. Damit wollen wir sicherstellen, dass Arbeit und Privatleben im Einklang sind und du deine Arbeit in einer Weise erledigen kannst, die f√ºr dich am besten funktioniert.
Weiterbildung Wir sind davon √ºberzeugt, dass kontinuierliches Lernen ein wichtiger Bestandteil der pers√∂nlichen und beruflichen Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeitenden ist. Deshalb bieten wir nicht nur ein Weiterbildungsbudget, sondern auch Zugriff auf unsere reteach Akademie an, um sicherzustellen, dass du dein volles Potenzial entfalten kannst.
Urban Sports Mitgliedschaft Wir glauben, dass eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist und dass regelm√§√üige k√∂rperliche Aktivit√§t zu dieser beitr√§gt. Daher stellen wir dir einen Beitrag von 40 EUR/Monat zu deiner Urban Sports Mitgliedschaft zur Verf√ºgung.
betriebliche Altersvorsorge Wir m√∂chten, dass unsere Mitarbeitenden bestm√∂glich f√ºrs Alter vorsorgen k√∂nnen. Daher bieten wir nicht nur die M√∂glichkeit eine provisionsfreie bAV abzuschlie√üen oder deine bisherige zu √ºbernehmen, sondern wir legen auch noch auf den monatlichen Einzahlungsbetrag zus√§tzlich was oben drauf.
Virtual Employee Stock Option Plan (vESOPS) Wir m√∂chten, dass unsere Mitarbeitenden die Chance haben, am Erfolg von reteach beteiligt zu sein. Daher bieten wir die M√∂glichkeit virtuelle Anteile (vESOPS) zu erhalten.
Geburtstagsurlaub Wir schenken dir zu deinem Geburtstag einen zus√§tzlichen Tag Urlaub, damit du diesen in vollen Z√ºgen genie√üen kannst.


√úber uns

Let‚Äôs make learning a great experience.

reteach ist eine innovative Software-as-a-Service L√∂sung, die digitales Lernen revolutioniert. Sie ist die ideale Lernplattform f√ºr effektive unternehmensinterne Trainings (z.B. Onboarding, Unterweisungen, Qualit√§tsmanagement) sowie Produkt- und Kundentrainings.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Referrals (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Referrals Analytics team, you'll play a key role in the Global Virality department. This team works on getting customers to share their HelloFresh experiences and recommend us to their friends. We aim to build a flexible referral program offering attractive deals to customers across the HelloFresh Group. The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, you‚Äôll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our company‚Äôs success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.


What You‚Äôll Bring


4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if you‚Äôve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

Title: (Junior) Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Startdatum

Wir suchen Dich ab sofort an einem unserer Standorte in M√ºnchen, N√ºrnberg, Leipzig, Berlin!

Deine Aufgaben

Data und AI sind Dein zu Hause? Des Weiteren gestaltet sich Deine neue Herausforderung wie folgt:


Entwurf und Entwicklung, Testen und Debuggen sowie Automatisierung, Dokumentation und Optimierung von Data Pipelines auf Cloud Plattformen
Mitarbeit an der Architektur, der Entwicklung und der Technologieauswahl f√ºr die Realisierung von Data Analytics Plattformen und Data Analytics Use Cases
Regelm√§√üige Beratung und Kommunikation mit unseren Kunden
Entwicklung von Data & Analytics Use Cases entlang der Gesch√§ftsprozesse unserer Kunden, inkl. Requirements Engineering und Use Case Konzeption
Datenexploration und Datenvisualisierung bspw. mit Power BI und/ oder Tableau


Dein Profil

Data ist auch in Deiner DNA? Das solltest Du mitbringen:


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Computer Science, Data Science, Data Engineering oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Erste Berufserfahrung als Software Engineer, Software Developer, Data Engineer oder in einem √§hnlichen Berufsfeld
Starke schriftliche und m√ºndliche Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten auf Deutsch und Englisch
Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python und/ oder SQL
Praktische Erfahrung mit Cloud Technologien (Azure und/ oder AWS) sowie mit relationalen Datenbanken (z.B. MySQL und/ oder PostgreSQL)
W√ºnschenswert sind Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Data Warehouse oder Data Lakehouse L√∂sungen, um strukturierte und unstrukturierte Daten zu speichern, zu organisieren und f√ºr Analysen zug√§nglich zu machen, beispielsweise mittels der Verwendung des Spark-Frameworks
W√ºnschenswert sind Kenntnisse in Git, CI/CD Tools (GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, Jenkins) und Docker bzw. Kubernetes
Nice to have: Erfahrungswerte im Umgang mit Large Language Models
Reisebereitschaft im Rahmen einer Consulting T√§tigkeit


Wir bieten

Data bewegt uns! Was Dich auf Deiner pers√∂nlichen Journey erwartet, findest Du hier:

Work-Life-Balance

Vertrauensarbeitszeit mit flexibler Arbeitszeitgestaltung - ob voll remote oder in einem unserer modern eingerichteten Innenstadtb√ºros (inkl. Dachterrasse), workation - nutze die M√∂glichkeit aus dem EU-Ausland zu arbeiten

Kultur & Zusammenarbeit

Einzigartige Teamatmosph√§re, flache Hierarchien zu unserem CEO Alex sowie eine offene Feedbackkultur, j√§hrliche Teamworkshops auf unserem Data.Castle im Zillertal, gelebtes Data.Musketeer Prinzip ‚Äì ‚Äûeiner f√ºr alle, alle f√ºr einen!‚Äú, unser [at] Buddy Programm zur besseren Vernetzung, regelm√§√üig stattfindende Fach- und Freizeitevents, hundefreundliche B√ºros

Fachliche & pers√∂nliche Entwicklung

Intensiver Onboarding- & Einarbeitungsprozess, pers√∂nlicher Entwicklungsplan und individuelle Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten, vielf√§ltiges Workshop- und Schulungsangebot innerhalb der Data.Academy durch unsere erfahrenen Data.Musketeers sowie externen Anbieter, F√ºhrungs-, Projektleiter- und Expertenlaufbahn

Verg√ºtung & Zusatzleistungen

Kita-Zuschuss, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit 20% Bezuschussung, zahlreiche Corporate Benefits & Mitarbeiterangebote (z.B. f√ºr Events und Reisen), Startguthaben in unserem internen Merchandise-Shop, kompetitives Gehalt mit variablen Anteilen

Gesundheit & Wohlbefinden

Mental Health & Wellbeing Support sowie Coaching und Meditation durch nilo.health, Fitness- und Yogar√§ume im M√ºnchner Office, regelm√§√üige Mitarbeiterumfragen, EGYM Well Pass Mitgliedschaft mit Plus1 Option, Fahrradleasing √ºber Jobrad nach der Probezeit, interne Gruppen f√ºr sportliche Aktivit√§ten, kostenlose Hei√ü- und Erfrischungsgetr√§nke sowie frisches Obst im Office, Dachterrasse (Grill)

Mobilit√§t

Zentrale Lage der Offices, gute Anbindung an den √ñffentlichen Nahverkehr, M√∂glichkeit von anderen Standorten zu arbeiten

Ansprechpartnerin

Marina Sommer, Principal Recruiting Manager: marina.sommer@alexanderthamm.com

√úber uns

Die Alexander Thamm GmbH ist einer der f√ºhrenden Anbieter von Data Science und K√ºnstlicher Intelligenz im deutschsprachigen Raum. Das Unternehmen generiert f√ºr und mit seinem Kunden aus Daten echte Mehrwerte, damit diese auch in Zukunft wettbewerbsf√§hig sind. Dazu entwickelt und implementiert die Alexander Thamm GmbH datengetriebene Innovationen sowie Gesch√§ftsmodelle. Das Leistungsportfolio umfasst die gesamte Data Journey ‚Äì von der Datenstrategie √ºber die Entwicklung von Algorithmen und den Aufbau von IT-Architekturen bis hin zu Wartung und Betrieb. Du willst mehr √ºber uns erfahren und hinter die Kulissen schauen, dann besuch uns auf Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn oder Stackoverflow.

Zentrale Lage der Offices, gute Anbindung an den √ñffentlichen Nahverkehr, M√∂glichkeit von anderen Standorten zu arbeiten

Ansprechpartnerin

Marina Sommer, Principal Recruiting Manager: marina.sommer@alexanderthamm.com

√úber uns

Die Alexander Thamm GmbH ist einer der f√ºhrenden Anbieter von Data Science und K√ºnstlicher Intelligenz im deutschsprachigen Raum. Das Unternehmen generiert f√ºr und mit seinem Kunden aus Daten echte Mehrwerte, damit diese auch in Zukunft wettbewerbsf√§hig sind. Dazu entwickelt und implementiert die Alexander Thamm GmbH datengetriebene Innovationen sowie Gesch√§ftsmodelle. Das Leistungsportfolio umfasst die gesamte Data Journey ‚Äì von der Datenstrategie √ºber die Entwicklung von Algorithmen und den Aufbau von IT-Architekturen bis hin zu Wartung und Betrieb. Du willst mehr √ºber uns erfahren und hinter die Kulissen schauen, dann besuch uns auf Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn oder Stackoverflow.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data team based at our HQ in Berlin, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years‚Äô experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You‚Äôll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe‚Äôs automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant, entry-level)
Description:
Come work with us




Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight‚Äôs purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.







About us




Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.







What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight?




Join the Netlight Berlin team as a consultant and be a part of shaping the software products and technical solutions of today and tomorrow alongside your colleagues and clients. The role will vary between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you.




Our focus is not just on the digital product, but also on the team and the business. You'll have the ownership to carve your own career path, starting somewhere familiar and building from there. As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. As a consultant within the data area, you will help our clients in roles such as Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer, Data Architect, Analytics Engineer, to name a few. We build comprehensive data platforms that encompass data warehousing & data lake infrastructure, data modeling, and the implementation of ETL/ELT data pipelines, whether batch or real-time. We design and implement innovative data products, incorporating elements of backend and cloud engineering. We are at the forefront advising clients around emerging topics such as data governance, AI and data mesh. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.







Minimum Qualifications




Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering AND 2 years of full-time working experience in a similar role
Working student and/or internship experience in agile software engineering roles
Verbal and written proficiency in English
Based in Berlin or willingness to relocate to Berlin (or see other open Netlight job ads) - no travelling required!




Preferred Qualifications

Master's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering




We are looking for newly graduated software developers with 1-2 years of relevant experience within tech projects. If we find that your profile matches what we are looking for, you will hear from us within two weeks of applying.




We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Show more

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Scoutbee is looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join our team in Berlin. and reporting directly to the Strategy & Operations Lead.

In this role you'll focus on advancing our thinking beyond the "here and now" with responsibility for structured data analysis, Business Intelligence, data visualisation. You will be a key player in enabling decision making across the business, importantly providing data and insights to senior management and executive teams.

Your role in our hive


Data-driven & analytics mindset : Contribute to Scoutbee's success by analyzing and visualizing datasets from various sources, developing analytical solutions, and delivering actionable insights that support in our strategic business decisions.
Critical thinking and problem-solving: Use analytical skills to impact strategy execution, break down existing business processes using data, identify potential inefficiencies and suggest effective solutions to enhance overall processes across the whole organization.
Interpersonal skills: Work closely with the C-level team and ensure that data & insights that support our strategic goals are communicated simply, clearly and effectively across the organization and among senior stakeholders and to our investors.
Drive strategic projects: Manage BI projects throughout the entire lifecycle, planning and delegating tasks while strategising solutions and ensuring the successful completion and execution of the project.
Major Plus - Salesforce Proficiency


What you bring to our hive


3+ years of experience as a BI Analyst in analytics/insights/strategy
University degree within engineering, data & insights, business strategy or equivalent
Strong Data analysis / insights and Data Visualization skills with proven track record in delivering exceptional results in these fields
Hands-on experience with BI & analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Superset, or PowerBI)
Analyzing usage statistics is something you enjoy, as well as collaborating with stakeholders to refine our requirements and create improvements.
Proficiency in structured problem solving, business case modeling and engaging storytelling.
You are a team player with a hands-on mentality, comfort with ambiguity, ability to translate insights into actionable recommendations and strong organizational skills.
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite.
Experience and availability to work with global stakeholders, especially across Europe and North America.
Nice to have: Understanding of programming languages (e.g., R, Java, Python)


What's in it for you? #beehivelife:


Work with a team on a mission to revolutionize digital procurement - for better data, better decisions, and a better world.
Contribute your ideas and work on challenging projects that will impact the future of modern procurement.
Virtual Stock Option Program for all employees, because ownership at all levels matters.
Development budget and growth paths for your individual learning journey.
Hybrid working model with flexibility for remote work and onsite collaboration.
Benefits supporting your health and wellbeing (Urban Sports Club, Counseling through Better Help, company organized sports activities).
Kindergarten grant, with priority selection for Kita in our Berlin building.


Worried that you don't quite tick all the boxes? Don't sweat it. For us, personality and willingness to grow and learn are more important than qualifications. We're aware that underestimation of one's own abilities or imposter syndrome can be reasons why someone doesn't apply. We say that not knowing it all can actually be a good thing and that we're more than happy to support ‚Äì and learn from ‚Äì our new employees while they find their feet at Scoutbee.

About Scoutbee:

Unlike traditional in-house solutions, search engines, and generic Gen AI tools, Scoutbee provides deep category expertise and a sophisticated technology stack developed over seven years in collaboration with procurement experts, data scientists, and developers. Our unique Large Language Model enriches supplier profiles and understands complex user requirements, offering results that align closely with buyers' needs.

Scoutbee leverages the entire internet as its database, providing unparalleled access to a vast number of suppliers. Our impartial search technology ranks suppliers based on the relevance of their website content, ensuring unbiased results. As an endorsed SAP partner, Scoutbee's integration within SAP Ariba Guided Sourcing delivers seamless access to advanced supplier discovery capabilities, driving efficiency and value for organizations.

We'd love to hear from you!

At Scoutbee, we're on a mission to connect. Our employees focus on shared experiences so they can have a more accurate view of the world. This enables us to innovate, challenge our own ideas and assumptions, and be ourselves at work. For us, personality and cultural fit are more important than qualifications. If you're worried that you don't quite tick all the boxes, don't be. We say that not knowing it all can actually be a good thing and we're more than happy to support ‚Äì and learn from ‚Äì our new colleagues while they find their feet at Scoutbee. Scoutbee is an equal opportunities employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnic background, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Our unique Large Language Model enriches supplier profiles and understands complex user requirements, offering results that align closely with buyers' needs.

Scoutbee leverages the entire internet as its database, providing unparalleled access to a vast number of suppliers. Our impartial search technology ranks suppliers based on the relevance of their website content, ensuring unbiased results. As an endorsed SAP partner, Scoutbee's integration within SAP Ariba Guided Sourcing delivers seamless access to advanced supplier discovery capabilities, driving efficiency and value for organizations.

We'd love to hear from you!

At Scoutbee, we're on a mission to connect. Our employees focus on shared experiences so they can have a more accurate view of the world. This enables us to innovate, challenge our own ideas and assumptions, and be ourselves at work. For us, personality and cultural fit are more important than qualifications. If you're worried that you don't quite tick all the boxes, don't be. We say that not knowing it all can actually be a good thing and we're more than happy to support ‚Äì and learn from ‚Äì our new colleagues while they find their feet at Scoutbee. Scoutbee is an equal opportunities employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnic background, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
