HTML:
DEINE AUFGABEN

Wenn Du Eine Leidenschaft F√ºr Digitales Lernen Hast, Teil Eines Schnell Wachsenden HR-Tech Unternehmens Sein M√∂chtest Und Mit Uns Gemeinsam Neue Standards F√ºr Die Digitale Wissensvermittlung Setzen M√∂chtest, Dann Freuen Wir Uns √úber Deine Bewerbung Als

Financial Analyst (m/w/d) ‚Äì Accounting & Data Analyst (m/w/d) mit 16-20 Stunden / Woche (40-50%) in Berlin oder Remote

Wir suchen einen Financial Analyst (m/w/d), der nicht nur die Buchhaltung im Griff hat, sondern auch das Datenuniversum beherrscht. Wenn du gerne mit Zahlen jonglierst und Daten f√ºr dich sprechen l√§sst, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!

  • Data Detective: Du tauchst tief in unsere Datenwelt ein, entdeckst Trends und Muster, und erstellst Berichte, die das Management umhauen.
  • Reporting Ninja: Du bringst unseren Datenhaushalt auf das n√§chste Level und automatisierst Reportings im Schlaf ‚Äì dank deiner Liebe zu Zahlen und Power BI.
  • Teamplayer Extraordinaire: Gemeinsam mit anderen Abteilungen sorgst du daf√ºr, dass unsere Entscheidungen immer auf den besten finanziellen und datenbasierten Einblicken beruhen.
  • Abschluss-Guard: Du sicherst die Qualit√§t unseres monatlichen Abschlussprozesses wie ein Profi.
  • Finance Allrounder: Du √ºbernimmst Verantwortung in den Bereichen Billing, Accounting, Controlling und Cashflow ‚Äì und das mit Leidenschaft!

DEIN PROFIL

Zahlenfreak: Ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Finanzen, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder BWL w√§re top, aber deine Skills sind entscheidender.

Pro im Finance Datagame: Du hast schon erste Erfahrungen im Finanzbereich oder als Data-Analyst gesammelt, besonders in Accounting und/oder Datenanalyse? Perfekt!

Excel Enthusiast & Power BI Profi: Excel ist f√ºr dich wie die Luft zum Atmen und Power BI dein treuer Begleiter.

Analytiker durch und durch: Du liebst es, analytisch zu denken und Zahlen sprechen zu lassen ‚Äì das ist ein absolutes Muss!

Hands-on Hero: Motivation, Flexibilit√§t und eine ‚ÄûPacken wir‚Äôs an‚Äú-Mentalit√§t zeichnen dich aus.

DAS ERWARTET DICH BEI UNS

  • 100% remote m√∂glich Wir sind davon √ºberzeugt, dass unsere Mitarbeitenden ihr volles Potenzial entfalten k√∂nnen, wenn sie die Freiheit haben, ihre Arbeit in Einklang mit ihrem Privatleben zu bringen. Deshalb bieten wir mobiles Arbeiten, ob in unserem B√ºro in Berlin, von zu Hause oder auch Remote aus dem Ausland, je nach Wunsch.
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten Wir verstehen, dass jeder Mitarbeitende unterschiedliche Bed√ºrfnisse und Verpflichtungen hat. Deshalb bieten wir flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle an. Damit wollen wir sicherstellen, dass Arbeit und Privatleben im Einklang sind und du deine Arbeit in einer Weise erledigen kannst, die f√ºr dich am besten funktioniert.
  • Weiterbildung Wir sind davon √ºberzeugt, dass kontinuierliches Lernen ein wichtiger Bestandteil der pers√∂nlichen und beruflichen Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeitenden ist. Deshalb bieten wir nicht nur ein Weiterbildungsbudget, sondern auch Zugriff auf unsere reteach Akademie an, um sicherzustellen, dass du dein volles Potenzial entfalten kannst.
  • Urban Sports Mitgliedschaft Wir glauben, dass eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist und dass regelm√§√üige k√∂rperliche Aktivit√§t zu dieser beitr√§gt. Daher stellen wir dir einen Beitrag von 40 EUR/Monat zu deiner Urban Sports Mitgliedschaft zur Verf√ºgung.
  • betriebliche Altersvorsorge Wir m√∂chten, dass unsere Mitarbeitenden bestm√∂glich f√ºrs Alter vorsorgen k√∂nnen. Daher bieten wir nicht nur die M√∂glichkeit eine provisionsfreie bAV abzuschlie√üen oder deine bisherige zu √ºbernehmen, sondern wir legen auch noch auf den monatlichen Einzahlungsbetrag zus√§tzlich was oben drauf.
  • Virtual Employee Stock Option Plan (vESOPS) Wir m√∂chten, dass unsere Mitarbeitenden die Chance haben, am Erfolg von reteach beteiligt zu sein. Daher bieten wir die M√∂glichkeit virtuelle Anteile (vESOPS) zu erhalten.
  • Geburtstagsurlaub Wir schenken dir zu deinem Geburtstag einen zus√§tzlichen Tag Urlaub, damit du diesen in vollen Z√ºgen genie√üen kannst.

√úber uns

Let‚Äôs make learning a great experience.

reteach ist eine innovative Software-as-a-Service L√∂sung, die digitales Lernen revolutioniert. Sie ist die ideale Lernplattform f√ºr effektive unternehmensinterne Trainings (z.B. Onboarding, Unterweisungen, Qualit√§tsmanagement) sowie Produkt- und Kundentrainings.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Onsite. Berlin Mitte, Germany.

About Us

Founded in 2021, the company is a trailblazing supply chain platform that has redefined the way large construction material orders are sourced, distributed, and financed. The company is on a mission to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing access to high-quality construction materials at a global scale through their innovative platform. Since its launch in January 2022, the company has successfully served hundreds of companies and generated exponential growth towards profitability.

The company‚Äôs distinct competitive advantage lies in its ability to organize the supply chain through digital innovation. By eliminating middlemen and embracing tech-first and AI, it creates a seamless connection between suppliers and buyers. Its proprietary platform technology not only facilitates supply and demand matching but also offers a comprehensive suite of services, including cloud inventory management, fulfilment solutions, and fintech capabilities.

Since its inception, the company has been at the forefront of construction material management, helping companies access high-quality materials efficiently and cost-effectively. The platform provides a user-friendly experience that empowers businesses to thrive. The company counts 75+ FTEs located across Germany (Berlin HQ), China, and India. The company is on track to achieve profitability and generated triple digits million GMV.

About This Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in the heart of Berlin. In this pivotal role, you will define and execute our data modeling and analysis strategy, drive data governance and quality assurance excellence, take the lead in tool and system innovation, and introduce best practices and mentoring.

You will work closely with business intelligence professionals, senior engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders from sales, procurement, and accounting to develop features that drive business growth.

Tasks

What You Will Do


Lead the development and maintenance of the company‚Äôs BI structure to support strategic business initiatives
Conduct complex data analysis to extract deep insights and trends that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Create advanced dashboards, reports, and visualizations that facilitate data-driven decision-making at all levels of the organization
Act as a strategic partner to senior management and department heads, understanding their data needs and delivering actionable intelligence
Translate high-level business requirements into detailed technical specifications for robust data reporting and analysis
Facilitate data-driven discussions and workshops with stakeholders to enhance organizational data literacy
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data across the organization
Develop and implement comprehensive data validation and cleansing processes to maintain the highest data quality standards
Lead the continuous improvement and optimization of the BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities using advanced BI tools and platforms (such as Tableau, Power BI, SQL, and Databricks)
Mentor and develop junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth within the team



Requirements

What you bring


Master‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree is strongly preferred.
5+ years of extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting.
Proven track record of delivering strategic insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau/Power BI, SQL and Google Sheets
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks



Who You Are


Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and translate them into actionable business insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Strong ability to present data insights and strategic recommendations to diverse audiences, including senior leadership
High level of attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting
Ability to ensure data quality and integrity in all analytical processes
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and drive results in a rapidly evolving organization



Benefits

What we offer


A role with entrepreneurial freedom in a pre-validated business model, to push to the next level
An experienced founding team of serial founders
A future-proof job with an attractive salary
Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts
A challenging yet rewarding work environment, and the opportunity to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing company
Beautiful office space in the center of Berlin, monthly All-Hands, team events, and team lunches



Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs, and experienced executives!

Title: Staff Data Analyst - BI and Marketing Analytics (All genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are looking for a Staff Data Analyst (All genders) to join the BI and Marketing Analytic ( BIMA) team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences. This is a global position working closely with our brands in over 70 countries and implementing strategy from our HQ in Berlin.

BIMA is part of the Global marketing team responsible for central BI and marketing analytics . BIMA‚Äô s team mission is to drive marketing actions through data-driven solutions & strategic insights to ensure sustainable growth. We drive strategic projects such as customer segmentation, marketing ROI measurement , CLV and support the C-level in making strategic decisions across all brands and countries.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

The Staff Data Analyst will be responsible for optimizing our marketing strategies through data-driven insights and advanced analytics. This role will collaborate closely with the marketing leads , product, and data science teams, and regional analytic teams to analyze marketing performance and optimize our acquisition and retention strategies.

Your key responsibilities include :


Utilize analytics to provide actionable insights on marketing performance.
Design and implement A/B testing and other experimental frameworks to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
Create tools , KPI frameworks, and reports to measure ROI of marketing spend. Continuously monitor and guide marketing spend across various channels to maximize ROI.
Analyze and improve the customer segmentation to drive targeting strategies in the local markets and increase customer retention
Create statistical models to project customer lifetime value, measure customer acquisition costs (CAC) and use analytics to reduce CAC and increase LTV
Work closely with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure alignment on data needs and create global guidelines on how data needs to be collected and consumed.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.


What you need to be successful


4+ years of experience in marketing analytics, with a focus on user retention for technology-driven consumer facing companies.
Strong proficiency in analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Google Big Query, Google Analytics, Tableau, SQL, Python/R).
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with A/B testing, attribution modeling, and other experimental design methodologies.
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels and strategies, including CRM, paid search, social media, and content marketing.


Nice to have:


Experience in agile development and methodologies
BS, MS or PhD in computer science, statistics, math, physic, business, etc
Expertise in developing and implementing naming conventions and tagging strategies to ensure data consistency in a global organization. Experience with Market mix modeling


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can‚Äôt wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Data Analyst - FinTech (w/m/d)
Description:
Finmas ist DER digitale Partner der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe. Unsere Kund:innen sind Sparkassen, Landesbausparkassen und Versicherer in ganz Deutschland. F√ºr sie entwickeln wir digitale Finanzmarktpl√§tze f√ºr Immobilienfinanzierungen und Privatkredite in der Sparkassenwelt. Wir helfen ihnen, die W√ºnsche ihrer Kund:innen nach einer passenden Finanzierungsl√∂sung zu erf√ºllen. Neben der Baufinanzierung der Zukunft ist f√ºr uns die Vernetzung von Immobilie und Finanzierung ma√ügeblich, damit die Kund:innen der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe vollumf√§nglich im √ñkosystem ‚ÄûWohnen & Leben‚Äú begleitet werden.

Du hast Lust bekommen, Teil der Finmas zu werden und bist ein Data Analyst (w/m/d) und brennst f√ºr abwechslungsreiche Projekte in unserem FinTech? Dir sind Selbstverantwortung gepaart mit Selbstorganisation und eine Vielfalt in deinen Aufgaben wichtig?




Dann bewirb dich bei uns! Wir suchen zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt am Standort Berlin (mit der Option auf mobiles Arbeiten) eine:n Data Analyst:in (w/m/d)!




Das ist dein Spielfeld




Du entwickelst Dashboards und interne Reportings in Power BI, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und Gesch√§ftsprozesse zu verbessern.
Du arbeitest eng mit den Fachbereichen zusammen, um ihre Anforderungen zu verstehen und zu erf√ºllen.

Title: Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM

Nutze die M√∂glichkeit, Deine Expertise erfolgreich einzubringen und Analysen zu erarbeiten, die Grundlage f√ºr richtungsweisende Entscheidungen bei Verti sein k√∂nnen. Werde Teil unseres dynamischen und multikulturellen Clients Bereichs.

Verti ist auf Wachstumskurs und sucht Dich zur Verst√§rkung als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Teltow bei Berlin.

Standort: Teltow

Startdatum: nach Vereinbarung

Die Position ist in Vollzeit zu besetzen.

Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM

Evaluierung der Erreichung der genannten Ziele im Erfolgsmonitoring
Aufbereitung von aussagekr√§ftigen Dashboards zur kontinuierlichen Erfolgskontrolle und √úberwachung der Entwicklung der relevanten Customer KPIs
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen zur F√∂rderung des Bestandserhalts oder der Kundenwerterh√∂hung und Kommunikation dieser im eigenen Team sowie an das Management
Schnittstelle zu anderen datenverarbeitenden Bereichen im Unternehmen wie dem Data Warehouse, Versicherungsmathematik oder Data & Analytics


Das bringst Du mit:

Relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data/ Customer Analytics
Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung im versicherungsmathematischen Bereich, Erfahrungen im Umfeld der Kfz- und Sachversicherung
Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL-basierten Anwendungen und Statistiitkprogrammen, Sicherer Umgang mit den g√§ngigen MS Office-Anwendungen
Sehr gutes analytisches Denkverm√∂gen, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, selbstst√§ndige, ergebnisorientierte sowie proaktive Arbeitsweise
F√§higkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen klar und verst√§ndlich zu visualisieren und zu kommunizieren
Sicheres Auftreten, Durchsetzungsf√§higkeit und gute Pr√§sentationsf√§higkeiten
Arbeitserlaubnis der Europ√§ischen Union
Deutschkenntnisse Level C1, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse

Video-Interviews) und halten uns bei pers√∂nlichen Gespr√§chen an definierte Hygiene- und Abstandsregeln.

Ebenso hat bei uns der verantwortungsvolle Umgang mit Ressourcen einen hohen Stellenwert. Aktuell fokussieren wir uns darauf bis 2024 klimaneutral zu werden.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. That‚Äôs why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

We are looking for a senior people data analyst to join our talented analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and data visualisation to support and influence key business initiatives. Your insights will directly contribute to optimising our operations and will help guide strategic decisions across the organisation.

Your new adventure:


Gather and analyze data from various P&C systems and sources, including HRIS, ATS, performance management tools, employee surveys, and external benchmarks
Identify current industry trends and patterns within People data to provide insights into areas such as recruitment, talent management, workforce demographics, turnover rates, performance metrics, and employee engagement and proactively identify opportunities to enhance the organization‚Äôs analytical capabilities
Develop and maintain key People metrics and dashboards to track progress and identify areas for improvement. Present findings and recommendations through clear and compelling data visualizations and presentations
Provide data-driven recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders to inform strategic decisions related to human resources and organizational development
Collaborate with P&C business partners and other stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions that optimize the employee experience and drive organizational success
Lead or participate in special projects and initiatives related to HR analytics, such as predictive modelling, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the HR analytics team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.


Does this sound like you?


4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
Flexible working hours as long as you‚Äôre there for your team members
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits you‚Äôd expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)


Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Referrals (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Referrals Analytics team, you'll play a key role in the Global Virality department. This team works on getting customers to share their HelloFresh experiences and recommend us to their friends. We aim to build a flexible referral program offering attractive deals to customers across the HelloFresh Group. The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, you‚Äôll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our company‚Äôs success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.


What You‚Äôll Bring


4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if you‚Äôve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, you‚Äôll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our company‚Äôs success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
  • Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
  • Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
  • Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
  • Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
  • Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.

What You‚Äôll Bring

  • 4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if you‚Äôve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
  • Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
  • A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
  • Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
  • Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
  • A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program

What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.

  • Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
  • Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
  • Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
  • Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
  • Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR101535

Title: Junior Insight Analyst
Description:
The Insight Analyst will be a junior role; supporting Liberty and the Insights & Analytics team by providing actionable insight to help the business deliver an unparalleled customer experience, as well as driving improvement in key business metrics.




The successful candidate will be someone with excellent communication skills, engaging with stakeholders at all levels of the business. They will play an integral role in influencing both business and customer strategies through quantitative data analysis.




They will work closely with the Insights & Analytics Manager to develop key analytics strategies and approaches to improving processes within the business.




Key Responsibilities:

Communicate with stakeholders to capture requirements and identify key opportunities for improvement
Use analytical and storytelling skills, taking the business owners on a journey to better understand the customer
Ownership of regular and ad-hoc customer insight reports
Work closely with the Insights & Analyst Manager to deliver action orientated insights
Analysis of CRM campaigns across all marketing channels including the post campaign analysis to ensure ROI on activity
Continuously improve existing reporting methods within Liberty
Improve the efficiency of existing reporting methods using data visualisation and techniques in SQL, Microsoft Excel and BI
Help monitor customer data quality and ensure any issues are appropriately resolved or escalated with IT stakeholders.




Acting as a provider of insights and reporting, the successful candidate will show the ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders across the business. They will show an interest in customer insights, product performance and the entire purchasing journey on the Liberty website and in the Flagship store. They will be willing to use new tools and approaches to insights.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Analysing data sets in Excel
Presenting results and key recommendations in Powerpoint (or equivalent tool)
SQL and data interrogation of data sets
Communication with stakeholders
E-commerce analytics experience




Desirables

Data Visualisation and BI (eg Power BI, Tableau, Pyramid Analytics)
Google Analytics
Retail and Customer Experience
Marketing campaign analysis
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity







Analytics is the compass that guides Sephora on its strategic journey, and we are on the lookout for a Data Analyst who can harness the power of data to propel our business forward. As a Data Analyst, you'll play a critical role in analyzing and interpreting customer data to drive business decisions across our digital platforms. Leveraging your strong experience in BigQuery SQL, you'll craft scripts that seamlessly integrate back-end data with Google Analytics 4 for in-depth customer analysis and segmentation.




Your expertise in data modeling will enable you to map out data structures that support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and reports, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) related to online engagement, traffic, conversion rates, and marketing effectiveness. In this role, you'll work with data visualization tools like Power BI and Google Data Studio to develop compelling visual reports that convey complex insights in a clear and actionable manner. Additionally, you'll ensure the accuracy and quality of data, while effectively communicating your insights to non-technical stakeholders.







You will also be responsible for:

Writing and optimizing BigQuery SQL scripts for GA4 analysis, integrating back-end data to segment and analyze customer data.
Developing and maintaining dashboards and regular weekly/monthly reports to track KPIs related to performance, online engagement, A/B testing, traffic, conversion rates, marketing attribution, and campaign effectiveness.
Using data visualization tools such as Power BI and Google Data Studio to create clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.
Engaging in data modeling to effectively map out data structures that support business goals.
Utilizing digital analytics tools like Google Analytics and Quantum Metric to deliver data-driven recommendations.
Ensuring the accuracy and quality of data while drawing insightful conclusions and making strategic recommendations.







What You'll Bring







Your passion for detail is matched by your logical thinking and curiosity. You not only obsess over details but also possess the agility to communicate improvements rapidly and clearly. You thrive in an ever-evolving landscape, where driving innovation and continuous improvement is paramount. We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with strong analytical skills, capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a dynamic team environment.

We value ambition paired with a logical mindset‚Äîindividuals who are curious, inquisitive, and able to articulate suggestions with precision. You will utilize your strong foundation in BigQuery SQL, particularly in GA4 analysis, coupled with hands-on experience in data visualization using tools like Power BI. Your deep understanding of digital analytics, especially within Ecommerce and Retail, will enable you to provide actionable insights that drive business success. Your proficiency in digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Quantum Metric will be essential in providing recommendations that optimize performance.







Our ideal candidate will also possess:

Proficiency in Google Analytics, Quantum Metric, or similar digital analytics platforms.
Experience with Google Marketing Platform.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, for conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
An eye for detail and a commitment to data accuracy and quality.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, A/B testing tools, competitor research using market share tools, setting up data feed APIs, and UX platforms would be advantageous.







While at Sephora, You‚Äôll Enjoy...







The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams ‚Äì people you can be proud to work with.
The learning. We invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.
The culture. As a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000 stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
payabl. empowers businesses to grow through payments innovation and banking services. Our ambition is to expand our strong portfolio of global financial services we provide to business and make them all available in one place on our platform we call payabl.one.

As a licensed financial company with principal membership with card schemes, we specialize in global payments and providing businesses with multi-currency accounts. With offices located in Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Limassol, and London, we are currently undergoing significant expansion and are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. This role can be in one of our offices in Frankfurt, Limassol, Amsterdam, or London, it can also be remote anywhere in Europe.

This role is about:

The Data Analyst role is responsible for collecting, processing data of business information systems to discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision-making. Furthermore you will identify challenges and opportunities within the organization and provide solutions that help achieve the business' goals. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must-have traits. You will be a driving force in data systems development, backing up suggestions with evidence.

You will:


Analyse data, outlining challenges, opportunities and solutions based on the internal and external data
Filtering the data, handling missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance
Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyze data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends
Create visual representations of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make the data understandable at a glance
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate the insights and findings from the data to stakeholders, which can influence policy and decision-making processes
Work with other departments to understand their data needs and help them make informed decisions based on data insights



What we need:


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent at presenting data analysis insights to any type of audience in a clear and actionable way
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in everything you do
Experience working with senior decision makers
Conduct data analysis with Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy), SQL, Excel
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau or Qlik) and databases (PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Apache Druid)
Ability to automate data reports, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in data delivery
Familiarity with tools and software that enable scheduling and automatic generation of reports (e.g., cron jobs, Apache Airflow, Microsoft Power Automate)
Experience with Event Tracking, conceptualizing product events, and product analytics tools (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Matomo, etc.)



The perks of being a payabler:


üöó Drive in Style: After your probation, a sleek company car is all yours.
Future-Proof Your Finances: Jump on board, and after your probation period, we'll kickstart your Provident Fund
üå± Grow Without Limits: Our environment is all about nurturing your talents and fueling your ambition with endless opportunities for professional development.
Speak Like a Local: Greek language classes, offered twice a week for all team members.
üí≥ Shop and Save: Get exclusive access to a discount card at various local businesses.
üåçThrive in a multicultural workplace that celebrates diversity and values your unique contributions. Here, every perspective is appreciated, and every voice is heard.
Lead the Charge in Pioneering Projects: Be at the forefront of innovation by playing a key role in groundbreaking projects.
üèù Max Out Your Downtime: With 25 days off plus public holidays, and an extra 10 days for when you're under the weather, we make sure you have ample time to relax, recharge, and return brighter.
üìö Support for Your Educational Aspirations: We're here to support your educational pursuits because we believe in investing in your growth.
üçî Wolt Your Way Through Lunch: Enjoy a Wolt lunch allowance of ‚Ç¨150 per month


Ready to Join Us?

Let's embark on a journey to redefine the landscape of payments together. We're not just offering a role; we're inviting you to be a part of something bigger. Join our team, and let's innovate, disrupt, and lead the future of payments. Together, we can make an impact that resonates. Welcome to the team!

If this role seems like a good match, please submit your resume all applications are treated with the strictest confidentiality. Please note that we may keep your CV for a period of one (1) year for future relevant job opportunities. For more information about how we process your data please see our privacy policy at https://www.payabl.com/privacy-policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Allica bank

Allica is the UK‚Äôs fastest growing company - and the fastest-growing financial technology (fintech) firm ever. Our purpose is to help established SMEs, one of the last major underserved opportunities in fintech. Established SMEs are the backbone of local communities - representing over a third of our economy - yet have been largely neglected both by traditional high street banks and modern fintech providers




Role Description

Data is a key asset to Allica and is deeply embedded in all our teams and products. With data, we assist and work with Finance, Operations, Credit Risk, Product and management. This role will be for the Lending Tribe.




We are looking for ambitious and curious people who can help us understand our data better, contribute to facilitating the discussions between engineering and the data stakeholders and have an impact on the business by telling stories around the insights they generate.




You will be an integral part of the lending data squad, and the initial focus will be scaling up our ability to deliver analytics/insights that shape our understanding of the business and enhancing our foundations for automated reporting




Principal Accountabilities

Understand our products and processes through the data we have or collect
Work with the Lending Tribe and other stakeholders (Ops, risk, etc) to understand their data needs and provide solutions that address the core need (not just the immediate request)
Contribute meaningful insights from our data that proactively drive decisions and new lines of inquiry
Build visualizations and reports that enable the Lending business to service their ongoing data needs and measure KPIs
Develop data knowledge base (definitions, working rhythms etc.) within the team that enables us to become an information hub for the business




Personal Attributes & Experience

Previous experience working as a data analyst (in finance is desirable but not essential)
You like to investigate and challenge narratives using data
The ability to write queries in SQL with logic to combine multiple data sources
You work well with stakeholders across the business.
You communicate effectively and are comfortable with learning how to translate technical detail into business and commercial language.
You have a solid foundation in Python programming OR a strong desire to learn




Don‚Äôt tick every box?

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt have all the skills or requirements listed on the job description. If you think you‚Äôll be a good fit, we‚Äôd still love to hear from you!




Flexible working

We know the ‚Äò9-to-5‚Äô isn‚Äôt right for everyone. That‚Äôs why Allica Bank is fully committed to flexible and hybrid working. Please let us know what is best for you and, if we can, we will do our best to accommodate.




Diversity

We‚Äôre a diverse bunch here at Allica, with all kinds of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. Our openness and differences make us stronger, and we want everybody to feel comfortable bringing as much of themselves to work with them as they like.




Additional Information

Working at Allica Bank

At Allica Bank we want to ensure our employees have the right tools and environment in which to succeed in their role and in support of our customers.




Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, so our benefits are designed with you in mind:

Full onboarding support and continued development opportunities
Options for flexible working
Regular social activities
25 days holiday ‚Äì with the option to Buy/Sell
Pension contributions
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private health cover (with the option to add family members)
Life assurance
Income Protection
Family friendly policies including enhanced Maternity & Paternity leave
Season ticket loans
Show more
HTML:
About Allica bank

Allica is the UK‚Äôs fastest growing company - and the fastest-growing financial technology (fintech) firm ever. Our purpose is to help established SMEs, one of the last major underserved opportunities in fintech. Established SMEs are the backbone of local communities - representing over a third of our economy - yet have been largely neglected both by traditional high street banks and modern fintech providers


Role Description

Data is a key asset to Allica and is deeply embedded in all our teams and products. With data, we assist and work with Finance, Operations, Credit Risk, Product and management. This role will be for the Lending Tribe.


We are looking for ambitious and curious people who can help us understand our data better, contribute to facilitating the discussions between engineering and the data stakeholders and have an impact on the business by telling stories around the insights they generate.


You will be an integral part of the lending data squad, and the initial focus will be scaling up our ability to deliver analytics/insights that shape our understanding of the business and enhancing our foundations for automated reporting


Principal Accountabilities

  • Understand our products and processes through the data we have or collect
  • Work with the Lending Tribe and other stakeholders (Ops, risk, etc) to understand their data needs and provide solutions that address the core need (not just the immediate request)
  • Contribute meaningful insights from our data that proactively drive decisions and new lines of inquiry
  • Build visualizations and reports that enable the Lending business to service their ongoing data needs and measure KPIs
  • Develop data knowledge base (definitions, working rhythms etc.) within the team that enables us to become an information hub for the business


Personal Attributes & Experience

  • Previous experience working as a data analyst (in finance is desirable but not essential)
  • You like to investigate and challenge narratives using data
  • The ability to write queries in SQL with logic to combine multiple data sources
  • You work well with stakeholders across the business.
  • You communicate effectively and are comfortable with learning how to translate technical detail into business and commercial language.
  • You have a solid foundation in Python programming OR a strong desire to learn


Don‚Äôt tick every box?

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt have all the skills or requirements listed on the job description. If you think you‚Äôll be a good fit, we‚Äôd still love to hear from you!


Flexible working

We know the ‚Äò9-to-5‚Äô isn‚Äôt right for everyone. That‚Äôs why Allica Bank is fully committed to flexible and hybrid working. Please let us know what is best for you and, if we can, we will do our best to accommodate.


Diversity

We‚Äôre a diverse bunch here at Allica, with all kinds of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. Our openness and differences make us stronger, and we want everybody to feel comfortable bringing as much of themselves to work with them as they like.


Additional Information

Working at Allica Bank

At Allica Bank we want to ensure our employees have the right tools and environment in which to succeed in their role and in support of our customers.


Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, so our benefits are designed with you in mind:

  • Full onboarding support and continued development opportunities
  • Options for flexible working
  • Regular social activities
  • 25 days holiday ‚Äì with the option to Buy/Sell
  • Pension contributions
  • Discretionary bonus scheme
  • Private health cover (with the option to add family members)
  • Life assurance
  • Income Protection
  • Family friendly policies including enhanced Maternity & Paternity leave
  • Season ticket loans

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data/Business Analyst

Location: London, UK

Hybrid work: 3 days per week

Full-Time role




GET THE FUTURE YOU WANT!

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.




YOUR ROLE

Capgemini is seeking a Data/Business Analyst to join Capgemini Financial Services. This is a permanent, full-time position in I&D practice and this represents a unique opportunity for someone to enhance their I&D Consulting career.

Data/Business Analyst will be to join the BAPM team (Business Analyst/Project Manager) to support the requirements analysis and implementation of new requirements for critical projects across the FX business.
You will be expected to: Work closely with business users from front office sales and trading operations risk and product control to develop and document business requirements Write detailed business and integration requirements documents using the Confluence/Wiki based documentation approach aligned with an Agile / sprint-based development methodology.
Work closely with developers test team and delivery managers to develop the design and ensure the developed software meets the requirements.
Obtain formal sign-off of business requirements from all key project stakeholders and ensuring traceability throughout the development cycle as requirements evolve.
Assist in all relevant stages of the Project's lifecycle including analysis design test & deployment/go-live.




YOUR PROFILE

Emerging Markets experience gained in Middle Office/Ops/Product Control/Business Mgt. role Knowledge of FX Electronic Trading including pricing trade flows and processes.
Experience of bringing new products/capabilities to market F2B Ability to write high quality Business Requirement Documents and Functional Specs that are clear and concise enough for both traders and developers to follow Ability to build strong relationships with the Middle Office Operations Compliance and Technology.
Skills that will help you in the role: Technical knowledge or experience would be helpful e.g. sql Experience in agile project delivery Knowledge of FIX protocol Product knowledge, Bonds/TRS/Financing.




ABOUT CAPGEMINI

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Introduction

Working within the Risk Models and Data team, part of the banks' 2LOD Risk function, this role as Data Analyst is to work within the Data Analytics workstream of the team.

This is a great opportunity for an analytics professional to be part of a diverse analytics team and be actively involved in a broad range of initiatives.

Main Responsibilities


Run regular production of MI and ad-hoc requests for data analysis
Support the development of robust data analysis for both ad-hoc and regular management reporting
Support the development of efficient management information (MI) production
Support the resolution of Data Quality issues and the Data Lineage activities of the team
Support the build out of a robust data governance and data quality process within the risk function


Ideal Candidate

Research (by Harvard University) shows that women are particularly likely to second guess themselves and not apply - so if you are worried you don't meet all the criteria, get in touch anyhow and let us do the worrying‚Ä¶


A strong communicator who can collaborate cross-functionally
Have relevant experience working with data analysis within financial services
Ideally you will be degree educated, or equivalent, preferably in a STEM subject
Have an intermediate knowledge of SAS and SQL; and be eager to develop further
Have a good understanding of risk/financial terminology and be interested in developing this knowledge further
Be comfortable working with various MS Excel features such as formulas and pivot tables. Knowledge of Power BI is also desirable; but not mandatory


Company Information

Handelsbanken is a relationship bank with a decentralised way of working, a strong local presence thanks to a nationwide network of branches, and a long-term approach to customer relations. Each Handelsbanken branch operates as a local business enabling it to make decisions at a local level and provide a bespoke service. The focus is always on the need of the individual customer and not on the sale of specific products.

The Bank is deeply committed to embedding good equality and diversity practice into all of our activities. This is so that we are an inclusive, welcoming and inspiring place to work that encourages everyone to apply, regardless of socio-economic background, age, disability, pregnancy and/or parental status, race (including colour, nationality, and ethnic or national origin), veteran status, marital and civil partnership status, religion or belief, sex, gender reassignment or sexual orientation.

Check our Handelsbanken website for further information

At Handelsbanken, we deeply value our unique culture and values including trust in and respect for each individual. We take pride in nurturing a work environment where people flourish, and where they are empowered to take decisions in their areas of expertise. We take a long term perspective in everything we do and want each employee who joins us to build a long terms successful career with the Bank.

What is in it for you?


We have a wide range of learning and development available, empowering and enabling our colleagues to take ownership of their own development.
Competitive Salary and an extensive range of benefits is provided, including private medical insurance, income protection and life assurance
A market-leading pension contribution of 15% paid by the bank, which can be invested in a wide range of funds (including ESG and Shariah funds)


Application next steps

Your journey with us begins once you have submitted your application. One of our Handelsbanken recruiters will be reviewing your details and will later organise a phone conversation if you match the role requirements. If there is a mutual fit, we will extend an invitation for you to participate in an interview.

How can we support you to be your best self? Our Talent Acquisition team will be happy to provide support e.g. if you need additional time to prepare for an interview or you have any requirements for any part of the interview/hiring process ‚Äì just let us know by email uk_talent@careers.handelsbanken.co.uk .

This advert will be live for a minimum of two weeks. However, please note that after the two weeks, the closing date could change at any time depending on the number of responses received.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Bauer Media Audio

London - Hybrid (1-2 times per month)




Sadly we are not able to sponsor candidates




Bauer Media Audio is leading the charge in transforming our digital business, scaling innovative products and services across 9 dynamic territories. We're excited to announce the formation of our Centre of Excellence (CoE) within the Audio Data Organisation, and we are searching for passionate, driven individuals to join us. Be a key player in this pivotal transformation as we evolve our data architecture and engineering solutions, supporting high value implementations for future platforms. Our mission? To enhance user experience, engagement, competitions, and commercial ventures.




The role:

As a Data Analyst at Bauer Media Audio, you will play a crucial role in supporting our Marketing, Commercial, and Product teams by enabling them to use data effectively. Your primary focus will be on the Competitions, CRM, Ad, and Finance data domains, acting as the bridge between business needs and the central data organization. You will empower local teams to make actionable decisions based on data insights, ensuring data-driven strategies and operations.




Key Aspects of the role:

Act as a liaison between the business units and the central data organization to ensure data solutions meet business needs.
Gather and refine business requirements for data projects and communicate them effectively to the central data team.
Ensure data quality and consistency across different data sources and domains.







Tech stack:

Expert in SQL (Postgres, Cloud SQL).
Proficient in Python for data processing and analysis.
Skilled in data segmentation and analysis.
Experience with data segmentation, data analysis, and developing insightful reports.
Confident with BI Platforms like Looker or Power BI.
Experience with web analytics technologies such as Google Analytics (GA4 or UA360) / Firebase
Experience in developing and maintaining dashboards and reports.
Strong problem-solving skills and a flexible attitude to managing projects and engaging with senior stakeholders.







Why Join Us?

Exciting Projects:

Dive into diverse datasets that reveal the journey of our consumers as they interact with our apps, websites, and smart devices. Your work will help define and enhance the relevance and timeliness of our products, services, and messaging.




Innovative Environment:

With recent launches like Rayo in the UK, the expansion of our SMS and Competitions business, and ongoing development, there‚Äôs always something new and exciting on the horizon.




Expertise and Growth:

Our team has access to cutting-edge data, events, and analytics, offering a golden opportunity for you to become an expert and take ownership of the platforms, products, and services you help shape. Be a Part of Something Bigger Join us and be at the heart of the digital transformation at Bauer Media Audio. Together, we‚Äôll craft compelling stories and create impactful experiences for our audience. Don‚Äôt miss out on the chance to make a significant impact and grow with us.




We‚Äôd love to hear from you of you bring the following qualities:

‚Ä¢ Challenger Mindset: Thrive in a dynamic environment, always seeking out new challenges and opportunities for growth.

‚Ä¢ Team Player: Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively across multiple topics and stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Independent Worker: Self-motivated and capable of working autonomously, driving projects from conception to completion.




Be part of an innovative team that‚Äôs transforming the digital landscape of audio media. If you're ready to take on a challenge and grow your career in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.




Join Bauer Media Audio and help us shape the future of digital audio!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

YouLend is the preferred global embedded financing platform for many of the world's leading e-commerce sites, tech companies and payment services providers such as Amazon, eBay, Shopify, Mollie, Dojo, Paysafe, Just Eat Takeaway and Takepayments. Our software platform and APIs enable our partners to offer flexible financing products, in their desired branding, to their merchant base. With YouLend's AI-driven credit risk assessment solutions, more merchants and SMEs than ever can receive fast, flexible and affordable funding. We operate in 9+ geographies across the UK, EU and the US.

We believe that the future of financial services will be delivered by customer-oriented tech companies that embed financing in their customer journeys, and we are building the solutions that will power that future.

The Role:

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data Team. The person taking on this role will collaborate with stakeholders in other departments to understand and specify problems within the business. You will navigate our data, conduct transformations and provide insight and analysis. From there you will communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders. You will also create new data assets (data models, dashboards, models) to serve recurring requests for information and insight.

Requirements


Quantitative educational background, particularly mathematical methods and statistics
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions and providing support to the business
Highly skilled in SQL and Python
Strong written & verbal communication skills, particularly in being able to translate detailed data work for non-technical stakeholders and drive towards impact for the business



Essential:


Previous experience in the financial services / lending
Experience working with dbt, Snowflake, Metabase and Tableau



Benefits

Why join YouLend?


Award-Winning Workplace: YouLend has been recognised as one of the "Best Places to Work 2024" by the Sunday Times for being a supportive, diverse, and rewarding workplace
Award-Winning Fintech: YouLend has been recognised as a "Top 250 Fintech Worldwide" company by CNBC



We offer comprehensive benefits package that includes:


Stock Options
Private Medical insurance via Vitality
EAP with Health Assured
Enhanced Maternity and Paternity Leave
Modern and sophisticated office space in Central London
Free Gym in office building in Holborn
Subsidised Lunch via Feedr
Deliveroo Allowance if working late in office
Monthly in office Masseuse
Team and Company Socials
Football Power League / Squash Club



Salary Range: ¬£55,000 - 85,000 + 20% annual bonus

At YouLend, we champion diversity and embrace equal opportunity employment practices. Our hiring, transfer, and promotion decisions are exclusively based on qualifications, merit, and business requirements, free from any discrimination based on race, gender, age, disability, religion, nationality, or any other protected basis under applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why work for us?

A career at Janus Henderson is more than a job, it‚Äôs about investing in a brighter future together.

Our Mission at Janus Henderson is to help clients define and achieve superior financial outcomes through differentiated insights, disciplined investments, and world-class service. We will do this by protecting and growing our core business, amplifying our strengths, and diversifying where we have the right.

Our Values are key to driving our success, and are at the heart of everything we do:

Clients Come First - Always | Execution Supersedes Intention | Together We Win | Diversity Improves Results | Truth Builds Trust

If our mission, values, and purpose align with your own, we would love to hear from you!

Your opportunity

To join the Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team - tasked with leading the data analysis on the components of strategic projects associated with the investment community
The Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team is part of the Investment Management Chief Operating Officer Office (IM COO) working within Investment Management
Identify and analyse data attributes within JHI (Janus Henderson International) systems and document the impact proposed by change through projects or initiatives
Create functional requirements documents detailing current state and proposed changes and be able to clearly articulate these to impacted teams
Liaise with Technology teams, clearly communicating the development changes required for delivery and overseeing testing and sign off with business users
Generate appropriate business requirements, documents, workflows, and process maps
Analyse the usage of core and non-core data, identify opportunities to optimise or align with strategic solutions
Work with centralised Data Management teams to ensure that efforts in the Investment Management community work in synergy with those teams
Creation of repeatable data testing frameworks to ensure requirements built to your specification meet the necessary standards
Facilitate requirements gathering meetings
Leverage emerging technology and techniques to achieve your work goals in a timely manner
Liaise with stakeholders and ensure regular communications with the business, technology, and data teams
Collaborate with Data Architects to ensure all change is clearly documented by updating of conceptual and logical models and ensuring data catalogues, definitions and lineage is all aligned
Carry out other duties as assigned

What to expect when you join our firm

Hybrid working and reasonable accommodations
Generous Holiday policies
Excellent Health and Wellbeing benefits including corporate membership to ClassPass
Paid volunteer time to step away from your desk and into the community

Why work for us?

A career at Janus Henderson is more than a job, it‚Äôs about investing in a brighter future together.

Our Mission at Janus Henderson is to help clients define and achieve superior financial outcomes through differentiated insights, disciplined investments, and world-class service. We will do this by protecting and growing our core business, amplifying our strengths, and diversifying where we have the right.

Our Values are key to driving our success, and are at the heart of everything we do:

Clients Come First - Always | Execution Supersedes Intention | Together We Win | Diversity Improves Results | Truth Builds Trust

If our mission, values, and purpose align with your own, we would love to hear from you!

Your opportunity

  • To join the Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team - tasked with leading the data analysis on the components of strategic projects associated with the investment community
  • The Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team is part of the Investment Management Chief Operating Officer Office (IM COO) working within Investment Management
  • Identify and analyse data attributes within JHI (Janus Henderson International) systems and document the impact proposed by change through projects or initiatives
  • Create functional requirements documents detailing current state and proposed changes and be able to clearly articulate these to impacted teams
  • Liaise with Technology teams, clearly communicating the development changes required for delivery and overseeing testing and sign off with business users
  • Generate appropriate business requirements, documents, workflows, and process maps
  • Analyse the usage of core and non-core data, identify opportunities to optimise or align with strategic solutions
  • Work with centralised Data Management teams to ensure that efforts in the Investment Management community work in synergy with those teams
  • Creation of repeatable data testing frameworks to ensure requirements built to your specification meet the necessary standards
  • Facilitate requirements gathering meetings
  • Leverage emerging technology and techniques to achieve your work goals in a timely manner
  • Liaise with stakeholders and ensure regular communications with the business, technology, and data teams
  • Collaborate with Data Architects to ensure all change is clearly documented by updating of conceptual and logical models and ensuring data catalogues, definitions and lineage is all aligned
  • Carry out other duties as assigned

  • Experience of working within a data team or dealing with processing large amounts of data
  • Experience does not need to be in the Asset Management industry
  • Experience writing & implementing business requirements, process maps, and user stories.
  • Good stakeholder management skills
  • Strong Microsoft Excel skills
  • Strong SQL & Python (Pandas) skills
  • Experience with process mapping software applications: Visio, Lucid Charts etc.
  • Strong technical aptitude
  • Analytical, structured, and logical in approach

  • Organised & collaborative

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Are you able to leverage data and insights to enhance the customer journey, personalize marketing campaigns, and increase customer conversion?




Do you have a strong background in understanding and utilising business intelligence systems to create various dashboards?




Do you have the ability to present complex analytical findings in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders at all levels?




MacGregor Black is currently partnering with a Leading Consumer Health, Wellness and Home Business, on the search for a Data Analyst. This is a permanent role based in London, UK.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in leveraging BI software to analyse complex datasets, generate actionable insights, and drive strategic decisions to enhance business performance and customer experience. Your analyses will illuminate the paths for product evolution and will be key in bringing the very best of the company‚Äôs brand to their customers.

You will play a crucial role in helping to define roadmaps for global markets, identifying opportunities for improvement, liaising with senior 3rd-party stakeholders, and forecasting products timelines.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyse large and complex datasets to identify trends, pattens and insights to improve business outcomes.
Effectively communicate discoveries and recommendations to senior leadership and key stakeholders, distilling intricate data concepts into actionable insights and business implications.
Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and security of data across various business data platforms and systems.
Stay abreast of industry dynamics, consumer trends, and competitive landscapes via diligent market research and analysis. Harness external data sources, market intelligence, and keep up to date on the latest AI advancements.
Utilize data-driven insights to enrich the customer journey, personalize marketing endeavours, and refine product functionalities to augment user satisfaction.




What are we looking for?




Proven experience (2+ years) in a deep-seated analytical and e-commerce role, with a proven track record of creating valuable insights.
Strong technical proficiency in data analytics tools and technologies (SQL, Python, Tableau, Power BI) and experience with data warehousing and business intelligence platforms.
Expertise and proficiency in machine learning, and data analytics, with a strong foundation in programming and data visualization tools.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations.
Strong business acumen and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Competitive salary + benefits.




Please contact Benjamin Welsh today for more information.
