Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics Training Programme




Want to start a career in tech?

Albany Beck are hiring for passionate individuals to join the Pioneer Technology Programme, to learn the skills to become Junior Data Analysts. This will give you the opportunity to channel your enthusiasm and be part of an Agile team who are always working with exciting technologies.




Why Choose the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme?

By choosing to join our Pioneer Technology Programme, you‚Äôll be choosing to work with an organisation that‚Äôs passionate about your learning journey and committed to your ongoing professional development. The programme combines a world-class training, with the potential to gain industry standard professional qualifications. Consultants will get the opportunity to work with our interesting clients in the Financial Services, on projects that have a genuine impact from day one. We‚Äôll ensure that you get to work within a stimulating environment, where you‚Äôll have infinite opportunities to challenge yourself, grow with us and carve out the future you desire.




What to expect on the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme

An 8 week training course on Data and Business Analytics, including SDLC, SQL and BI Tools
CV workshop, interview training, career coaching, soft skill mentoring and project management principles and tools.
Deployment to a mainstream firm upon completion, allowing you to work with cutting edge technologies.
An Engagement Manager will be assigned to you before your first day who will support you throughout your placement whilst keeping your progression on track, answering any questions about the project and providing upskilling support as required.
A great social environment where you are surrounded by likeminded consultants, you can expect various social events arranged by your Engagement Manager with not just your team but other Pioneers too.




What You Need

Bachelor's degree STEM subject (science, technology, engineering, math) OR, a Non-STEM degree or qualifications provided you have a passion for technology - either through doing online courses, building websites or learning technology in your spare time




What You‚Äôll Get

Fully funded training through in-person classes and one on one coaching
Competitive graduate salary, once placed, and half year pay reviews
Ongoing training and support through your designated AB Coach
Financial industry experience with one of the top global organisations
An inclusive environment, here at AB we believe in increasing representation and making sure everyone can bring their whole self to work. We don't just say the right things, we do the right thing and remove barriers to entry into Technology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Mandatory secondary language (Mossi/Moor√©)

About the Company - This team focuses on safeguarding the billions of users across our clients family of apps from harmful content, malicious actors, and detrimental behaviors. By leveraging cutting-edge technology and collaborating with cross-functional teams worldwide, the team plays a crucial role in creating and upholding a secure and positive environment for the global community. In this organization, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact by promoting integrity and fostering trust among users, businesses, and partners alike.







About the Role - As a member of this team, your role will involve responding to real-time crises while also proactively recognizing and assessing emerging risks. You will perform risk-related investigations and consider ways to better support our communities through improved strategies and practices. Leveraging your comprehensive knowledge of our clients systems, including tools, products, policies, and processes, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to implement tailored mitigation plans addressing various operational risks across platforms, domains, policies, and regions. This role places you at the center of managing crises, elections, and unconventional issues arising on our platforms, ensuring the continued safety and well-being of our user communities.




Responsibilities




Serve as an expert to interpret and enforce our clients‚Äô terms of service. (including but not limited to Community Standards, Advertiser & Commerce Policies and Product specific guidelines)
Investigate and resolve emerging risks that are reported on our clients‚Äô products, such as requests for account support and potentially abusive content including but not limited to graphic images, videos and writings, offensive or derogatory language, and other objectionable material across organic, ads and commerce.
Gather, analyze and utilize data from escalations and content/ad reviews to develop improvements for the overall escalation process, policies, products, and generate operational insights for the supported community
Showcase grace under pressure and ensure effective and timely collaboration with multiple internal stakeholders including but not limited to Public Policy, Core Policy, Legal, Sales, Product and Engineering
Adapt to changing requirements and prioritize escalation requests effectively
Liaise closely with our our clients‚Äô vendor teams to ensure all operational KPIs meet and exceed targets and work collaboratively to improve processes and tools and scale solutions.
Work as part of a 24/7 global team, including the potential for on-call shifts during weekends/after-hours when needed.
Mandatory secondary language (Mossi/Moor√©) requirement to use a combination of language and market specific geopolitical knowledge, deep understanding of cultural, language nuances and minority communities, to capture signals and insights to enforce and solve complex risk and operational issues within the region.




Qualifications




2 to 4 years of experience in Trust & Safety or Online Operations for a tech company, consulting, operations or similar roles
Strategic thinking with a proven track record of enhancing customer experience through innovation and continuous improvement
Strong communication skills and ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders across functional boundaries and globally
Ability to work with graphic and objectionable content coupled with a broad understanding of our clients‚Äô Community Standards
Ability to make judgments under tight deadlines and competing priorities
Proficiency/ Basic knowledge in analytical tools (e.g., Excel, SQL) for driving analytics, reporting and operational decision-making







Pay range and compensation package - Approx. ¬£70,000 (Plus Benefits) | London (Hybrid)

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Data Analyst



Salary: ¬£450 - ¬£550 per day Outside IR35



Location: Remote



Data Idols is working with a global FMCG who are looking for a Business Analyst to join on a contract basis. Your role will involve collaborating with stakeholders across the company to gather business needs, define data domains, and streamline operational processes.






The Opportunity



In this exciting role, you will be interviewing different stakeholders and managers across the company to help understand what data requirements are needed.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will be facilitating workshops with various departments to outline the different data fields and understand the framwork in order to replay this back to the development teams.







Skills and Experience


Experience working within a CPG/FMCG
Experience working on data projects
Good stakeholder management

If you would like to be considered for the role and feel you would be an ideal fit with our team then please send your CV to us by clicking on the Apply button below!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London üåÜ




Remuneration: Hourly rate ¬£35.58 üí∏




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ‚åõ




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ‚è∞




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. üìà




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. üåü




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! ‚ú®




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.üíº




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Mission

We're not your average benefits platform; we're the unordinary force that uplifts people's lives. Our technology is the link that connects the entire benefits ecosystem, creating better outcomes for employers, employees, brokers, and providers.

Our mission is clear: we're here to create a world where everything operates at its very best, ensuring that every employee receives the support they need to live life to the fullest, both at work and beyond.

Your Mission

As a Data Analyst at Ben, you will be joining at a crucial time in the evolution of our product-engineering organisation as we build out the foundational pillars of our data function.

This is an incredible opportunity to join a business where we are looking to build out our analytical function from scratch. You will be owning a number of tools and work closely with the product and business teams to define KPIs, perform exploratory analysis and set up reporting that will drive the business towards being truly data-driven.

Things you will be working on‚Ä¶


Be the first port of call for the business in triaging data issues, determining the root cause and resolving where appropriate
Work collaboratively with our Marketplace, Product, Support, Operations, Customer Success and other engineering teams to resolve issues in a timely fashion
Maintain our service levels with customers by ensuring queries are investigated and resolved within SLA timeframes
Support the business in making data driven decisions and carrying out repeatable analysis
Develop reporting and dashboards to enable the business to track trends and perform business-critical analysis at scale
Establish processes to root cause and solve open-ended problems
Be an expert on the product - understand and communicate the underlying concepts within the product, be the point of contact when supporting other business functions in their understanding of the products dataflows


You‚Äôll Love This Role If You Have


SQL expertise: you can debug complex queries to optimise for both quality and performance
The ability to identify the root cause of data issues and working with engineering teams to resolve them in a timely manner
Experience with a BI/visualisation tools such as Looker, Metabase, Lightdash. You know how to design and build dashboards to enable repeatable analysis
An analytical mindset: you know how to turn raw data into actionable insights. You have experience defining KPIs and building the reporting to measure them
Familiarity with dbt is a nice to have


and you...


are a self-starter who thrives on autonomy, enjoys a rapid pace and wants to make a difference
have a continuous improvement mindset. You appreciate that there are always ways to do things better and ensure your team does too
have a preference to action-oriented behaviour with just enough analysis, as compared to too much time spent doing analysis with no action
have the ability to make decisions balancing different factors such as business requirements, technical integrity, overall priorities etc.
appreciate the opportunities and challenges of a distributed work environment
are solution-focused with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving


Diversity and Culture at Ben

We are organically growing a brilliantly diverse, inclusive and respectful bunch of people we are extremely proud of. This should go without saying but all applications are very much welcome. If you need any adjustments to support you with your application, just let us know by emailing jobs@thanksben.com.

Our BENefits

(... It's all in the name! üòâ)

üí≥ ¬£100 monthly personal Ben Balance: for whatever works for you, whether that's Netflix, Spotify, or a really expensive cup of coffee! This allowance will increase by ¬£50 for each year of service until you reach ¬£250

üîã ¬£1000 annual Learning & Personal Development Ben Balance: plus 3 days paid study leave a year to support you with your professional development

üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª ¬£500 work from home set up allowance, which you can put towards your home office

üçî Weekly lunch provided in office so you can spend quality time with the team over some tasty food!

üèñ 28 days of holidays a year (plus bank holidays, which you have the option of swapping for days of celebration that are significant to you)

Our Mission

We're not your average benefits platform; we're the unordinary force that uplifts people's lives. Our technology is the link that connects the entire benefits ecosystem, creating better outcomes for employers, employees, brokers, and providers.

Our mission is clear: we're here to create a world where everything operates at its very best, ensuring that every employee receives the support they need to live life to the fullest, both at work and beyond.

Your Mission

As a Data Analyst at Ben, you will be joining at a crucial time in the evolution of our product-engineering organisation as we build out the foundational pillars of our data function.

This is an incredible opportunity to join a business where we are looking to build out our analytical function from scratch. You will be owning a number of tools and work closely with the product and business teams to define KPIs, perform exploratory analysis and set up reporting that will drive the business towards being truly data-driven.

Things you will be working on‚Ä¶

  • Be the first port of call for the business in triaging data issues, determining the root cause and resolving where appropriate
  • Work collaboratively with our Marketplace, Product, Support, Operations, Customer Success and other engineering teams to resolve issues in a timely fashion
  • Maintain our service levels with customers by ensuring queries are investigated and resolved within SLA timeframes
  • Support the business in making data driven decisions and carrying out repeatable analysis
  • Develop reporting and dashboards to enable the business to track trends and perform business-critical analysis at scale
  • Establish processes to root cause and solve open-ended problems
  • Be an expert on the product - understand and communicate the underlying concepts within the product, be the point of contact when supporting other business functions in their understanding of the products dataflows

You‚Äôll Love This Role If You Have

  • SQL expertise: you can debug complex queries to optimise for both quality and performance
  • The ability to identify the root cause of data issues and working with engineering teams to resolve them in a timely manner
  • Experience with a BI/visualisation tools such as Looker, Metabase, Lightdash. You know how to design and build dashboards to enable repeatable analysis
  • An analytical mindset: you know how to turn raw data into actionable insights. You have experience defining KPIs and building the reporting to measure them
  • Familiarity with dbt is a nice to have

and you...

  • are a self-starter who thrives on autonomy, enjoys a rapid pace and wants to make a difference
  • have a continuous improvement mindset. You appreciate that there are always ways to do things better and ensure your team does too
  • have a preference to action-oriented behaviour with just enough analysis, as compared to too much time spent doing analysis with no action
  • have the ability to make decisions balancing different factors such as business requirements, technical integrity, overall priorities etc.
  • appreciate the opportunities and challenges of a distributed work environment
  • are solution-focused with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving

Diversity and Culture at Ben

We are organically growing a brilliantly diverse, inclusive and respectful bunch of people we are extremely proud of. This should go without saying but all applications are very much welcome. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are News UK: One of the leading media businesses in the UK and Ireland, our newsbrands include The Times, The Sunday Times, The Sun, The Sun on Sunday and The TLS. Our national broadcast brands include talkSPORT, Times Radio, talkRADIO and Virgin Radio UK, and we have market-leading local radio stations across Ireland. Our world-famous brands provide news, analysis, opinion and entertainment to almost 40 million people each month. Spanning digital and print, audio and video, events and experiences, our brands are home to a plurality of opinion, representing the diverse communities we serve. News UK is wholly owned by News Corp.




The Sun is Britain‚Äôs largest newspaper which launched in 1969 with the slogan ‚Äòforward with the people‚Äô, because that is what we believe in. We are a group of talented, dedicated, and creative people with a real passion for delivering real stories to our ever-growing audiences. Our newspapers and digital products include some of the most powerful storytelling, reaching over 30 million people each month. The Sun is more than a newspaper. It is an entertainer, a cultural reference point, and a finger on the pulse.




Your Team: You‚Äôll be joining the Analytics team to help maximise our relationship with the 30m+ monthly readers of The Sun, contributing to continued annual growth. We are at the forefront of innovative approaches to both data and customer experience, evidenced by the team recently winning 4 ‚Äòbest use of data‚Äô awards, living up to our vision of driving the business through data.




Your Role: You will add value by partnering with senior stakeholder groups across The Sun to drive customer behaviour and advise on how we can utilise our data to meet our objectives. You will work closely with teams including the Newsrooms, Product Development, Marketing, User Experience and Technology to provide innovative ideas and actionable insights to improve decision making, content commissioning and ultimately engagement and upsell.




Day to day you will:

Generate Actionable Insights: Work with key stakeholders from Products, CRM, Audience, Marketing & Promotions and others. Produce automated reporting, provide in-depth analysis and actionable insights to improve decision making within Product, Editorial, Marketing & Promotions, Audience, etc., ultimately contributing to audience growth and increasing revenue.
Collaborate with Technical Teams: Work closely with Data Engineering, Architecture, and Analytics Implementation teams to ensure smooth data flow and accurate reporting. Your collaboration will ensure that data is effectively utilised across all departments.
Enable Strategic Decision-Making: Engage with senior stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable strategies. Participate in business meetings, identify critical data needs, and assist in crafting clear, actionable recommendations that align with business goals.




What we‚Äôre looking for from you:

Utilise SQL in Google BigQuery to manipulate and process large data sets to enable concise reporting and analysis.
Embrace the challenge of visualising data in a meaningful and actionable way in Tableau & Looker Studio.
Enjoy presenting and communicating detailed analysis to non-technical stakeholders.
Develop the technical understanding in the area of expertise in your role, be it in customer acquisition, churn, A/B tests, digital audience measurement or commercial advertising.
An understanding of the subscription business and how data can be used to support different elements of the subscription funnel.
A clear understanding of the media landscape across print, digital, radio and television.




If you think you have what it takes but don‚Äôt tick every requirement on the list, please do apply. We recognise that considering someone‚Äôs potential as well as their experience is a great way to hire. We want to hear from people who have a passion to learn and develop.




Life at News: Driven by passion, guided by principles and acting with purpose. We represent, reflect and reach the nation, telling the stories that matter. We inform our audiences so that they can make decisions based on trusted information.




To do this, we believe our employees must represent different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. We strive to maximise and encourage every individual‚Äôs potential and ensure everyone feels valued. We support this through our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Strategy, which focuses on three main priorities - attracting talent from a wider, more representative pool, developing equity programmes to drive better representation in our leadership, and ensuring diversity and inclusivity in our workforce as well as the journalism and content we produce. We also currently have 12 employee led networks and groups that support our strategy and connect like minded employees socially.




Benefits:

Some of our benefits include:

Maternity leave up to 18 weeks full basic salary & paternity leave up to 2 weeks
Wide range of training available, plus full LinkedIn Learning access
Private medical insurance including coverage for pre-existing conditions
Discounted gym memberships, free ClassPass at Home, weekly virtual yoga classes
‚ÄòBikes for Work‚Äô and ‚ÄòElectric Car‚Äô scheme
Up to 60% discount on Harper Collins books
Access to exclusive events and competitions with exciting brands such as talkSPORT, Virgin Radio UK & The Times. Weekly virtual panel chats with top journalists and celebrities
Access to wellbeing benefits such as EAP, physio/massage and counselling
A generous pension scheme with employer contributions of up to 5%
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays and up to 4 volunteering days per year
Thriving employee networks supporting colleagues to embed and grow, including women in technology, parenting, wellbeing, GenZ, NewsIsOut and faith-oriented groups.




We want to ensure that everyone we meet has the opportunity to perform to their best when applying for a role. Please let us know, at any stage, whether you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, and we will do our best to accommodate.

Title: Data Analyst (Middle Office) ‚Äì Global Hedge Fund ‚Äì ¬£100-125k total comp + amazing benefits!
Description:
A market leading, global hedge fund, are looking to hire a data analyst into its London operations / middle office function.




The role that we are looking to hire has a hybrid remit split across project management / data analyst (tech) responsibilities + BAU operations tasks.




The core project management component of the role (roughly 50%, albeit even more so initially whilst the hire is being trained on the subject matter) will heavily focus on process improvements / infrastructure development for the BAU remit that you‚Äôll have coverage of ‚Äì as the work is tech focused, the hire will use Python, SQL and VBA to a very strong standard in the role. Additionally, the hire will take on a large volume of ad-hoc project work for specific investment desks, focused on data analytics / fund performance metrics. The BAU component will focus on oversight of the reconciliations and settlements processes, analyzing large volumes of data to produce reports / presenting analysis to the relevant investment desks. This is a highly quantitative role.




We are looking to hire a junior that is ambitious and would like to progress within the firm ‚Äì our client is one of the most progressive firms on the street. From this role, internal moves into other areas of technology, trading assistant, risk, quant or COO function roles are plausible, as are internal international transfers.




Candidates will ideally have 1-2yrs experience in a data analyst / data management role, that has had a strong focus on process improvement and automation work. Coding skills are a pre-requisite (python and/or SQL preferred). Candidates must have a top tier STEM degree.




Whilst this is a junior level role, our client are an industry leader for compensation ‚Äì the hire can expect a year one total comp package of ¬£100-125k if they perform to a strong standard. In addition, the firm offer a very large pension, top of the range healthcare, fully subsidised gym membership, an annual allowance to use on personal development / qualifications and a restaurant serving fully subsidised breakfast & lunch daily.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Enna is a specialised recruitment agency for neurodivergent job seekers - we support candidates who identify as neurodivergent - autistic, ADHD, dyslexia, dyspraxia etc.

About The Role

OmniGov‚Äôs Communication‚Äôs Intelligence team are searching for a Data Analyst to join the team and help provide best in class data analysis and marketing effectiveness solutions for Omnigov, private sector clients and media agencies within OMG. Uniquely in OmniGOV, the strategic analytics team within the wider communications intelligence group runs consultancy and MMM projects with commercial clients, as well as delivering cross-government campaign analysis to OmniGOV and HM Government.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our ongoing quest for understanding and insights. You‚Äôll contribute to building and maintaining our essential Government benchmark database and knowledge system. Your responsibilities will include sophisticated data analysis, methodology evolution, and generating reports for key categories and brands. Additionally, you‚Äôll create visualisations and automate processes related to Government files and databases.

The role is varied, interesting and provides excellent opportunities to work with a wide range of people, techniques and solutions, within OmniGOV and the wider agency group.

The Communications Intelligence team are a team of 16 people based in Omnicom‚Äôs impressive offices in Bankside. We are passionate about data, all types of analysis but especially strategic analysis and leading the provision of marketing effectiveness solutions for all our stakeholders.

Role Requirements

Government Benchmark Database Maintenance:


Collaborate with a Manager to add new data to the Government benchmark databases managed by Omnigov and the Benchmarking team.
Quality checks and data loading using tools like R, Python, and Power BI.


Support the wider Communications Intelligence Team


Support and mentor Junior Analysts to ensure high-quality work and a commitment to growth and development.
Engage in the wider Communications Intelligence Strategic goals to drive higher quality work for our clients.
Feed into our wider vision and strategy as a team


Agency Relationships


Support and coach Junior Data Analysts
Cultivate day-to-day relationships with users of the knowledge system within agencies and OmniGOV‚Äôs Government databases
Provide excellent service levels to agencies working with analysts and managers


Client Relationships


Support the team in consultancy engagements with Government clients
Update and build comprehensive datasets for agency pitch analysis from the knowledge database content
Deliver high-quality visualisations and effectively communicate data insights to agency clients
Use advanced analytical approaches to analyse data to establish norms and averages, interpreting findings


Skills Required


Experience in a Marketing Analytics role (MMM or similar)
Understanding of the role of media
Experience in developing analytic models
Coding proficiency (R or Python preference)
Expertise in Excel
Interested in Government marketing and media
Strong attention to detail
Good written and communication skills
Highly organised & Strong critical thinking
Willingness to Learn, energetic, determined, proactive and curious


Nice To Haves


English and maths GCSEs at grade C (4) or above or equivalents.
Degree in an analytical subject 2:1 Or higher


About The Agency

OmniGov is a specialist division created to handle UK Government media buying, the largest advertiser in the UK, and a top 10 UK agency in its own right, handling over 80 very different government departments. We were originally awarded the four year contract in 2018 and late 2021 we became the first agency ever to retain the business for the next 4 years.

Our ambition is to be the best Government Media Buying service in the world, intelligently using media to deliver public services. In doing so we want to lead the industry in the UK and be one of the best places to work and learn in the media sector. In fact, we have been Campaign‚Äôs Agency Team of the Year for the last 3 years.

Our team of c.150 people are passionate about delivering better outcomes for the public sector. Why? This is taxpayers‚Äô money we are dealing with, and the outcomes of these campaigns really do matter. Effectiveness is the driving factor. You will work on campaigns that can represent the most profoundly challenging issues in our society aiming to help, improve or save lives. At other times they simply aim to inform the public. But at all times they matter. To people across the UK and beyond, to us, our families and our own communities.

We are organised across different client hubs themed by government priority nationally, regionally and internationally.

Our core teams and expertise encompass Account Management, Effectiveness & Evaluation, Implementation Planning and Media Activation across all channels. We also have specialist services such as Strategic partnerships, Innovation, Behavioural Planning, Communications Intelligence including Data Engineering, Reporting/Visualisation, Data Science, Strategic Analytics, Brand Safety and Data Ethics.

OmniGOV draws from the best of Omnicom Group UK and sits as a unit within MG OMD, Campaigns Media Agency of the year 2021 and 2024, the largest agency within OMG UK and the most awarded media agency ever for IPA Effectiveness.

Working for OmniGOV is different to other jobs in the media agency sector. Working with government can be challenging, dynamic and demands the highest standards, but above all it is important work and rewarding. We believe there is no better place to learn and grow in the industry.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Analytics & Insights/ Performance, Investment Management




London, Hybrid




Duration: FTC 9-12 months




Our client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Analytics & Insights team for a 9-12 month fixed-term contract. In this role, you will be pivotal in collecting, organising, and analysing performance data from a wide range of companies. Your contributions will be essential to key reporting and will support internal performance management, delivering high-quality insights that help shape strategy and portfolio management decisions.




Key Responsibilities:




Collect, structure, and input data from investee companies (including financial metrics, ESG indicators, and impact reports) into the company‚Äôs management information system.
Collaborate closely with various teams to ensure data accuracy, check for anomalies, and liaise with investees to resolve inconsistencies.
Provide Excel-based analysis on impact and performance, contributing to the company‚Äôs annual report and internal tools.
Oversee the migration of legacy impact metrics into a new data management system, ensuring data integrity throughout the process.
Support the team with ongoing improvements to data analysis and reporting processes.




Key Skills:




Data analysis: Strong experience in collecting and analysing data, ensuring accuracy and consistency across multiple sources.
Excel proficiency: Essential, with a preference for experience in automating analysis processes.
Technical know-how: Familiarity with Power BI, Microsoft PowerPoint, and accounting terminology.
Project management: Strong organisational skills to handle large datasets and meet deadlines.
Attention to detail: Critical for managing and analysing data from various reports and systems.




Personal Attributes:




Collaborative: Proven ability to work closely with cross-functional teams.
Detail-oriented: High attention to detail with a focus on data accuracy and quality assurance.
Results-driven: Motivated by achieving high-quality outcomes and continuously improving processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
London based - hybrid (ideally 3 days per week in the office)
Salary ¬£40k - ¬£45k + 10% bonus + benefits
SQL proficiency is required




Company overview




Join a formidable product team that is shaping the future of online advertising and advertising technology (Ad Tech). Our client (circa 100 staff) is well-funded and growing fast, with innovative solutions and an exciting product roadmap.




Their offering helps major advertisers (brands) and media agencies reach their current and future customers online; across desktop, mobile and TV.




Role overview




We are now seeking aData Analyst to work alongside other experienced Data Analysts and Product Managers to identify and deliver insights across our client's advertising technology and audience solutions - and run future experiments to help drive new innovations.




Responsibilities




Use your analytical skills to query, manipulate and transform datasets.
Convert analytical findings into actionable insights for the product team.
Collaborate with product management and data stakeholders to develop and maintain data models and performance metrics for new product experiments.
Support junior data analyst on SQL and other analytical tools and approaches




About you - must have




Data analytical experience (gained either at University, during internships or in post graduation employment).
A desire to learn and continuously develop your analytical skills, building on SQL and related technical language skills and tools.
Curious and problem-solving mindset.




Tech & Skills requirements - must have




Intermediate level SQL or equivalent
Computer Science, Stats or Mathematics related degree




Tools you'll have access to in the role and can be trained / up-skilled on




Looker and Looker Studio (equivalent to Power BI, Tableau
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
DBT and transformation of data, pipelines and dependencies
Github and JIRA for sprint planning
...plus more depending on your technical area of interest




What‚Äôs on offer?




Hybrid home/office flexibility
Genuine and guided career progression to support your learning and growth
Extensive benefits including, but not limited to medical, health & wellness coaching, cycle to work, lifestyle benefits, retailer discounts, company pension, critical health cover + more
Active social calendar full of entertainment, rooftop events, sports-related and competitions

Title: Data Analyst (JR100931)
Description:
At Clarion, our people are at the absolute heart of what we do. We're proud that our core values of PASSION, CARE, IMAGINATION, and TRUST define the way we carry out our work across all of our exhibitions and conferences.

If you share our values and want to be a part of a successful, dynamic, and creative global business then we want to hear from you.

The Opportunity:

Clarion Gaming Digital are a market-leading media and marketing services provider. We work hand in hand with our Clarion Events team, who organise the largest B2B Global Gaming event, ICE London.

Our leading digital media site, igamingbusiness.com, is the leading B2B website in the sector and we have exciting yet ambitious plans to scale our existing Gaming digital business model, and diversify into other digital media products within the B2B Gaming space.

We have spent the last year investing significantly in building out a fit for purpose operating model, including building a new team and technology stack. Now we are ready to take our growth to the next level, and are looking for committed and talented individuals to drive that journey.

Our team are aligned around a mission to become the number one growth partner for Gaming Companies Globally. We've made incredible progress against this mission and are excited for the forward opportunities!

The data analytics team is a new team with CGD that is core to gaining a better understanding of Clarion's Gaming customers and enabling revenue growth. The types of analytics work include customer segmentation, predictive modelling, marketing campaign reporting and campaign optimisation.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and deliver comprehensive reporting solutions to key business areas including commercial, marketing, and customer service departments using PowerBI and SQL
Maintain high standards of data accuracy and quality by performing rigorous data validation and error-checking processes
Oversee the usage and performance of reports and dashboards, ensuring they meet the needs of internal stakeholders and remain up-to-date
Conduct statistical analysis to uncover insights, trends, and patterns in data, providing actionable recommendations to improve business decisions
Learn and apply key data visualization techniques to create insightful and easy-to-understand reports for various stakeholders
Work with the team to establish and implement data quality measurement and reporting frameworks to ensure data integrity across all reporting solutions
Continuously seek out new technologies and methodologies to innovate and optimize data management processes
Support the implementation of automation in reporting solutions to support the self-service adoption of analytics, enhancing efficiency and scalability



Requirements

Knowledge, Skills & Behaviours:


Previous experience with PowerBI, SQL, Excel and a background with advanced data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g., Python, R, Apache Spark)
Experience working with multiple business functions (e.g. sales, marketing, content, product teams) to deliver value from data analytics
A background within data analytics environment with a strong emphasis on customer and marketing related analytics
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Innovative thinking with a proactive approach to identifying and solving data management challenges.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail
Knowledge of data governance principles and practices
Ability to manage workload and prioritise accordingly.
A solid understanding of relevant data standards and regulations (HIPAA, GDPR, etc.)



About Clarion Events

Clarion Events is one of the world's leading event organisers, producing and delivering innovative and market-leading events since 1947. (https://clarionevents.com/welcome)

Clarion Events embrace diversity and equal opportunities in all that we do. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Clarion is private equity backed and owned by Blackstone. Blackstone is one of the world's leading global investment funds, investing capital for the long term in order to build successful, resilient businesses. (https://www.blackstone.com/)

Our purpose is to deliver exceptional customer outcomes and experiences, by making every connection count.

Our vision is we want every one of our products to be a market leader in customer satisfaction and delight.

Benefits


25 days' holiday plus bank holidays
End of year wellbeing shutdown (closed for the last week of the year)
Celebration day off (e.g. birthday, Diwali, Eid, etc)
Summer Hours in August (3pm finish on Fridays)
Helping Our World (HOW) Days - one paid day per quarter to carry out charity work
Pension Scheme
Private Medical Insurance
Health Cash Plan
Wellbeing Library (MYNDUP)
Mentoring Programme
Subsidised Caf√©
Season Ticket Loan
Cycle to Work Schemes
Free on-site gym and shower facilities
Free eyesight tests
Free flu vaccination - offered on site once a year for all employees
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Digital
Description:
Working at the RFU means being part of the ‚Äòbigger picture‚Äô at England Rugby: to be rooted in our purpose, which is to enrich lives, introduce more people to rugby union & develop the sport for future generations. If our purpose resonates with you, and you recognise the value that sport can bring to people‚Äôs lives, we‚Äôd love to work with you. An opportunity has arisen for a Digital Marketing Analyst (Web) to join the team on a permanent basis.




Job Title : Data Analyst - Digital

Department : Marketing

Reports to : Senior Customer Data Analytics Manager

Job Level : Implement

Location : Twickenham

Employment Type : Permanent




Application Information:

Please submit an anonymised CV and cover letter (i.e. please exclude personal details).
The closing date for applications is Friday 26th July at 5pm.
The RFU reserves the right to close this vacancy early if we receive sufficient applications.
Applications may be considered whilst this vacancy is advertised.




To download the full job description for this role, please click here.




Nature and Scope:




The RFU has been undergoing a period of significant change, responding to changes in the external environment whilst adjusting to the demands of a modern governing body. The organisation is currently one year into delivering an exciting strategic plan that hopes to have a transformational impact on Rugby Union.




As part of this strategic plan, the RFU has an ambition to become a data-driven, user-centric organisation with market leading digital capabilities that will not only transform the rugby experience for players, volunteers and fans today, but also future proof the RFU for years to come.




As part of a small Customer Data & Analytics team, you will play a key role in helping the RFU's Marketing & Digital Team transform the experience for our customers through analysis of marketing data and audiences. The role will enable growth for analysts with a digital first mindset and a passion for customer experience whilst contributing to the overall success of the RFU and England Rugby.




The role will analyse web data to identify patterns and trends in order to improve engagement and conversion.
The role will help to augment and improve the quality of data captured.
The role will support marketing campaigns and identify audience preferences.
The role will measure and assess marketing campaigns to provide insight.
This role will measure performance of web advertising.
This role will measure the performance of experiments (e.g. A/B) on the website in collaboration with the Digital Product Team.




What will you be doing?




Some key responsibilities include:

Developing a comprehensive web analytics strategy to deliver the company's digital objectives from platform down to tagging.
Creating and maintaining a roadmap to deliver data quality and enhanced analytics capabilities.
Managing and optimize Google Tooling to ensure accurate data collection and reporting to track benefit realisation and support prioritisation decision-making.
Leading the effort to improve overall analytics effectiveness including segmentation opportunities and personalisation to drive engagement and advocacy.
Supporting the development of new ways to evaluate our digital assets and grow our commercial revenues through key websites.
Analysing web data to identify opportunity areas to optimise performance and improve the overall digital experience.
Creating and delivering regular reports on web performance to the wider business.
Acting as an ambassador for, and promoting the best interests of the RFU, including the promotion of the RFU core values.




Your approach to Life (your behaviours):

You're a strategic thinker who is able to influence and drive change.
You have strong influencing and consensus building skills, and you're able to build sustaining relationships.
You're able to work collaboratively.
You are process driven and able to work well under pressure.
You're able to inspire confidence and create trust.
You possess sound judgement and the ability to think creatively to reach desired goals.




What you Know:




Essential:

Demonstrable experience in a data analysis role or another quantitative field.
Expertise in Google Analytics 4(GA4) and Google Tag Manager (GTM) (GAIQ certified preferred).
Experience in go-to-market, configuring GA4 & GTM to measure success by defining tags, triggers, variables, data streams, events, and enhanced measurement features.
Experience with other web feedback capture tooling e.g. Hotjar, Optimizely.
Proficient with reporting tooling e.g. Looker / Tableau.
Good breadth of knowledge of digital analytics to make recommendations on tooling, best practices, and strategic approach.
Proficiency in debugging and troubleshooting Google analysis-related issues.
Experience with web analytics, A/B & MVT strategy and implementation requirements.
Knowledge of GDPR and other privacy around handling user data.
Effective communication and problem solving ensuring the right people are involved and updated.
Good understanding of software development practices and web/mobile technologies.
Committed to actively contributing to and building an inclusive culture in your role and day to day behaviours.




Desired:

Experience with Salesforce and Marketing Cloud Intelligence (previously Datorama).
Experience with a Customer Data Platform.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Maths, Sciences).




Additional Information:

We want you to have every opportunity to demonstrate your skills, ability and potential. If there is anything we could do to support you through your application or to provide the best environment for your interviews, including assistance or adjustment, please reach out to recruitment@rfu.com.
During your application, we will ask questions about your identity. This information is considered highly confidential and will not be seen by hiring managers. You can find out more about why we ask these questions here.




To download the full job description for this role, please click here.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital & Creative Agencies
Description:
Fantastic opportunities available for impressive and award winning global agencies working with a breadth of well-known and household brands.




Our clients are a mix of creative, digital, & media agencies who are looking for data talent to transform raw data into actionable insights and aid business critical decision making.




Hybrid working- circa 3 days a week in a London office
Negotiable salary depending on level of experience




The role:




Link data and tech with creativity to provide statistics and data driven insights to their clients marketing & business challenges
Partner with the internal data teams (Data visualisation, Data science) to ensure you work together to solve all client data driven challenges
Develop and maintain data systems, preparing detailed reports, and presenting findings to stakeholders
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, providing insights that drive business decisions and enhance client campaigns.
Continuously seeking ways to improve data collection and analysis processes
Drive measurable results
- Staying updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to implement best practices.




The person:




Inquisitive with an analytical mindset
Ambitious and career driven
Previous experience working in a marketing or creative agency
Experience using data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R, along with experience in data visualisation software like Tableau or Power BI.
A solid understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques
Experience in customer journey analysis and planning
Ideally a degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics
Attention to detail, a high level of accuracy, and the ability to work under pressure




We are committed to ensuring and supporting representation from all backgrounds across the creative industry, irrespective of race, religion, belief, ethnicity, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability or socio-economic background.

With this in mind, we welcome applications from all areas of the community. Please do get in touch and let us know if there is any additional support or reasonable adjustments we can cater for, to ensure our process and roles fit your needs and creates a comfortable & enjoyable recruitment process.

Title: Insight Analyst
Description:
As the nation‚Äôs flag carrier, we take great pride in connecting Britain with the world and the world with Britain.

It‚Äôs something we‚Äôve been doing for over 100 years, ever since we launched the world‚Äôs first international scheduled air service between London and Paris.

This originality has been in our blood since day one. It‚Äôs the spirit we share with the people that fly with us, our partners, and our colleagues.

So, whether you are a reassuring voice on the end of a phone, a smile at the door, under a wing keeping the turbines spinning or landing us gently in far-flung places, a job at British Airways is yours to make.

We know great things can happen when you‚Äôre inspired to think big and bring your ambition to work every day, which is why, at British Airways the sky is never the limit.

The role

This role in the Distribution, Payments and Digital team within British Airways, aims to deliver insightful and actionable analysis to influence decision making within the Digital department and wider commercial team, with a key focus on driving revenue and customer experience improvements. It will look to provide a deep understanding of digital performance through the use of analytics

What You‚Äôll Do


Become an expert in BA Digital performance
Deliver accurate and timely analysis, interpret output and communicate clearly and effectively to drive business change
Proactively develop site performance analysis to deliver actionable recommendations
Responsible for Digital test and learn product development evaluation
Build effective working relationships with product owners
Support others in using Adobe Analytics
Shared responsibility for Adobe Analytics using Tag Management technology to ensure data integrity and standard methodology of digital performance analysis
Collaborate effectively within and across teams to drive business improvement.


What You Will Bring To The Team


Strong analytical skills: Highly numerate and able to generate and structure insight from complex and sometime disparate data.
Skilled in data cleansing, manipulation and extraction from multiple sources.
Proficient at interrogating and interpreting complex data, critically evaluating output and identifying actionable recommendations, considering the wider context and impact of alternative solutions.
Experienced in data visualisation techniques, identifying new and insightful ways to convey data and insights.
Excellent data storyteller who effectively communicates results and recommendations to stakeholders with varying levels of technical ability to drive action.
Strong customer awareness, commercially astute both strategically and analytically, with ability to see application of data insights to business problems.
Good stakeholder and portfolio management.
Numerate degree or proven numerical proficiency in a relevant role
Experienced in web analytics tools i.e. Adobe/Google and data exploitation: SQL and/or Python (desirable)


What We Offer

We believe that all the people who work with us should feel valued for the part they play. It‚Äôs one of the reasons our rewards go far beyond a competitive salary.

From the day you join us, you‚Äôll get access to brilliant staff travel benefits including unlimited basic and premium standby tickets on British Airways flights. You‚Äôll also receive up to 30 discounted ‚ÄòHotline‚Äô airfares per year for yourself, friends, and family.

At British Airways you‚Äôll have the chance to take on new challenges and move forward in a way that feels right for you. We encourage all those who work for us to consider opportunities right across our business to help you develop and progress.

We never stand still, and we don‚Äôt expect our people to either.

Inclusion & Diversity

At British Airways we all have a part to play in creating an inclusive place to work. Diverse representation among our people is really important to us and we recognise that all our colleagues are uniquely different and bring their own originality, creativity and identity to work.

Inclusion and diversity is a key driver of innovation and we‚Äôre committed to creating a culture where everyone feels that they can be themselves. We‚Äôre looking for people from all backgrounds and cultures to join us and be a part of our journey to become a Better BA as we continue to connect Britain with the world and the world with Britain.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | ¬£40,000 - ¬£50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)




Here at Burns Sheehan, we have partnered up with a well-established name in the UK market for over 20 years who have just been bought out by an experienced leader in the gambling industry as they look to invest heavily within growth and explore International Markets.




As a result, they are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team and report into the Head of Analytics as one of the 1st key hires in this initial growth phase. In this role you will be responsible for taking over the curation and development of a suite of Power BI reports, which are used across all areas of the business to help drive strategy and run the day to day mechanics of the organisation.




Skills and Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Similar...
2 + Years experience within Data Analysis
Proficient in SQL / T-SQL and PowerBI (Potentially Tableau)




With a two-decade presence in the UK, this company has a proven track record of success and customer loyalty this an amazing time to join as the companies goes from strength to strength. If you are a Data Analyst with excellent experience across both SQL and PowerBI feel free to apply and I will get back to you accordingly !!!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:Goldstar is a leader in the transport and warehousing industry, committed to excellence and continuous growth. Our mission is to deliver outstanding results while fostering a culture of integrity, collaboration, and professional development. As we continue to expand, we are offering an exciting opportunity for a talented individual to join us a Data Analyst.

As a Data Analyst at Goldstar, you will be responsible forcreating and maintaining dashboards, reports, and systems to provide valuable and actionable insights into the business.You will also play a key role supporting the Business Analyst and IT team with the development, implementation, and maintenanceof our TMS system and API/EDI interfaces, to ensure seamless data integration.

About The Job

Full Time, Permanent

Location - Colnbrook

Monday to Friday (42.5 hours/week)

Salary ¬£28,000 - ¬£32,000per annum

Key Responsibilities


Develop, maintain, and optimise dashboards and reports using Power BI, Alteryx, Power Automate, and Cognos to provide actionable insights.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in reports and dashboards by performing regular data validation and quality checks.
Analyse datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with the Business Analyst to understand reporting requirements and develop data solutions that meet business needs.
Assist in translating business requirements into technical specifications for reports and data models.
Provide ad-hoc data analysis and support for various business units as required.
Assist in the maintenance of our Transport Management Systems, ensuring that they are running smoothly and efficiently.
Support, maintain and assist in the development of API/EDI system interfaces to ensure smooth and efficient connectivity and data flow.
Work with IT and other teams to troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues in our systems.
Identify opportunities for automation within the data reporting process and implement solutions to reduce manual workload.
Document processes, data flows, and reporting methodologies to ensure consistency and knowledge sharing across the team.
Provide training and support to end-users on how to use dashboards and reports effectively.
Assist in continuously reviewing operational processes for efficiency.


What are we looking for from you to join us:


Experience using data analytics and business intelligence tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power Automate, Power BI.
Advanced Excel skills, including pivot tables.
Strong analytical thinking with the ability to interpret complex datasets and provide meaningful insights.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality.
Creative problem solver who can identify opportunities for process improvement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
An understanding of the transport and logistics industry is desirable.
Understanding of API/EDIconnectivityis beneficial but not essential.


How We Help You Thrive


28 days annual leave.
Free onsite parking.
Workplace Pension.
EAP for employees at work.
Employee committee meeting.
Mental health and wellbeing.
Sage Benefits.
Learning and development.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

THE AGENCY

Creative Artists Agency (CAA) is the leading entertainment and sports agency, with global expertise in filmed and live entertainment, digital media, publishing, sponsorship sales and endorsements, media finance, consumer investing, fashion, trademark licensing, and philanthropy. Distinguished by its culture of collaboration and exceptional client service, CAA‚Äôs diverse workforce identifies, innovates, and amplifies opportunities for the people and organisations that shape culture and inspire the world. The trailblazer of the agency business, CAA was the first to build a sports business, create an investment bank, launch a venture fund, found technology start-up companies, establish a philanthropic arm, build a business in China, and form a brand marketing services division, among other innovations.

Named Most Valuable Sports Agency by Forbes for nine consecutive years, CAA represents more than 3,000 of the world‚Äôs top athletes in football, baseball, basketball, hockey, and soccer, in addition to coaches, on-air broadcasters, and sports personalities and works in the areas of broadcast rights, corporate marketing initiatives, social impact, executive search, and sports properties for sales and sponsorship opportunities. Founded in 1975, CAA is headquartered in Los Angeles, and has offices in New York, Nashville, Memphis, Chicago, Miami, London, Munich, Geneva, Stockholm, Shanghai, and Beijing, among other locations globally.

Overview

Are you passionate about entertainment, brands, music, sports, and analytics? Have a natural aptitude toward storytelling through data? Join our growing data team as we provide advanced data solutions and strategic analysis to enhance the creation of opportunities for world-class clients across Film, TV, Music, Sports, Digital Media, and beyond.

CAA has an opening for an Analyst on our Data Insights team. In this role, you will be a member of a highly motivated and collaborative team responsible for providing actionable insights to business unit stakeholders (Agents Executives, and client management teams) using cutting-edge data and analytical tools.

Your role is to provide data that is accurate, congruent, contextualised and actionable to ensure information is easily available to users for direct consumption. In collaboration with the team, you will help educate and train internal stakeholders to explore and understand information in new ways, generating compelling insights that inform and support effective decision-making and client servicing. It will be essential, and a success criterion, that you build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables you to identify and address critical issues and opportunities.

This position will work in CAA‚Äôs London Office during typical business hours. Flexibility is expected as the Data Insights team is predominately based in CAA‚Äôs Los Angeles office. Communication across time-zones will be required as you be reporting to a manager based in the Los Angeles, CA office. Occasional travel, including company meetings and events, is also expected.

Main Responsibilities to include, but limited to:


Collaborate closely with senior analysts on the team to derive strategic and actionable insights from various sources to garner audience and marketplace intelligence on clients across all departments (Film, TV, Music, Sports, Brands, Consumer Products, etc.), with a special focus on Music, Comedy and Sports.
Participate in translating findings into digestible and visually intuitive outputs through compelling analysis and storytelling to Agents, Executives, and client teams.
Assist with data vendor relationships to respond to the changing information needs of the business.
Leverage proprietary & third-party analytics tools to demonstrate the popularity, value, and impact of our client‚Äôs work and/or their related businesses.
Provide analyses on brand, category, and consumer trends to uncover opportunities in support of CAA‚Äôs brand and brand-building groups.
Act as a liaison between data teams and business stakeholders (CAA Agents and Executives) to gather and organise requirements for the design of optimal data solutions and internal platforms.
In coordination with the data group, participate in workstream planning processes including gathering requirements, testing, delivery, and training of new analytics features.
Balance numerous projects across different departments and sustain open communication with the team/stakeholders to ensure deadlines are met.
Assist with training and adoption of CAA‚Äôs internal analytics platforms, including conducting company-wide, departmental, and one-on-one training sessions; maintaining documentation and training guides; and championing CAA‚Äôs data products.
Collaborate effectively across all areas of the Data Team (Data Analytics, Data Science, Data Management, Data Engineering, etc.)



Qualifications/Requirements


Bachelor's Degree in Business, marketing, computer science, information systems, or specialised training/certification in a related field is preferred.
Four or more years of experience as an Analyst or similar role at an entertainment agency, consumer brand, market research agency, ad agency, or related company preferred.
Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills; highly collaborative and inclusive team player while also being a self-starter.
Highly detail-oriented and well-organised; able to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple tasks/deadlines at once and can easily adapt to change.
Strong passion for and knowledge of cultural and industry trends that affect brands and consumers. Preference for a passion in the live entertainment space (music, comedy and sports)
Understanding of the entertainment, social media and digital landscape including consumer & platform trends, audience measurement & metrics, monetisation strategies, etc.
Experience mining and analysing data from social listening, digital analytics, and consumer/market research tools (e.g., Meltwater, NetBase, Helixa, Nielsen, MRI/Simmons, Google Analytics, E-Poll, etc.).
Avid user and fluency with social media platforms (e.g., Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Twitter, and Facebook).
Experience working in Microsoft Excel and can create beautiful client-facing PowerPoint presentations.
Experience working with data to solve business problems, i.e., generate and communicate actionable insights to business users.
Committed to the data education of stakeholders, sharing of information, and empowerment through data.
Experience with modern Data Visualisation tools (e.g., Power Bl, Tableau, Qlik) preferred.



Please ensure you provide complete and legible information in your application. An incomplete application may affect your consideration for employment.

Creative Artists Agency (‚ÄúCAA‚Äù) is committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and creating a workplace culture in which diversity and inclusion is valued and everyone is treated with dignity and respect. As part of our zero-tolerance approach to discrimination in any form, you and any job applicants will receive equal treatment regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation, or any other legally recognised protected basis under UK law.

Please inform CAA‚Äôs Recruitment Department if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

CAA does not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless they were contractually engaged by CAA to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any such employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the acknowledgement and agreement that CAA will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Opencast Software helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




Opencast Software are a growing team of specialists who work at the heart of government, global finance and growth enterprise with a range of digital consultancy and tech services. Their OpenCulture empowers independent-minded people in their mission to do the right thing for their clients, their team and wider society: good teamwork to make life better. As a privately owned company, they are truly agile, with no debt or external stakeholders. They‚Äôve grown profitably year on year and they are results-focused, not methodology-focused.




The role




You‚Äôll help clients improve their services by selecting the appropriate techniques to turn data into insights, by working within a product delivery team to develop performance measuring frameworks to track goals, user needs, or KPIs. You‚Äôll operate within the client's requirements and the appropriate legal, technical and ethical constraints.




Leading by example and promoting Opencast‚Äôs approach, you‚Äôll mentor junior colleagues, provide constructive feedback, and demonstrate an understanding of each product delivery stage and how to apply appropriate measurements for that phase of work.




Essential experience




¬∑ worked with data platforms such as Google Analytics, Splunk, Datadog, or similar

¬∑ used data visualisation tools such as Data Studio to create service performance dashboards

¬∑ designed and implemented a performance framework including KPIs or OKRs for a service or product

¬∑ analytical skills in identifying the right data sources and then validate and understand how to interpret the results

¬∑ collected, collated, cleansed, and interpreted data to derive meaningful and actionable insights

¬∑ an ability to use the most appropriate medium to visualise data to tell compelling and relevant actionable stories

¬∑ created hypotheses that can be tested, and developed insights based on your findings

¬∑ working within a GDS delivery environment within a government department

¬∑ valid Security Clearance or eligibility (5+ years residency in the UK)




Desirable experience




¬∑ visualising data using Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, Power Query or similar

¬∑ scripting and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R etc

¬∑ security and data privacy

¬∑ making recommendations for service changes




Where you‚Äôll work




Your working time at Opencast will be split between multiple locations, including from their HQ and hub locations, client site or home. Travel is part of life at Opencast, and takes in account requirements of your work, their clients and your team.

They include you




They welcome candidates from all identities, attributes, ways of thinking and backgrounds to thrive in a career at Opencast. Their aim is for the diversity of their people to be reflected in the solutions they deliver, to help create a fairer society for all.




Interview




Job interviews are on Microsoft Teams. They'll make any adjustments to help you.
