HTML:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Opencast Software helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.


Opencast Software are a growing team of specialists who work at the heart of government, global finance and growth enterprise with a range of digital consultancy and tech services. Their OpenCulture empowers independent-minded people in their mission to do the right thing for their clients, their team and wider society: good teamwork to make life better. As a privately owned company, they are truly agile, with no debt or external stakeholders. They‚Äôve grown profitably year on year and they are results-focused, not methodology-focused.


The role


You‚Äôll help clients improve their services by selecting the appropriate techniques to turn data into insights, by working within a product delivery team to develop performance measuring frameworks to track goals, user needs, or KPIs. You‚Äôll operate within the client's requirements and the appropriate legal, technical and ethical constraints.


Leading by example and promoting Opencast‚Äôs approach, you‚Äôll mentor junior colleagues, provide constructive feedback, and demonstrate an understanding of each product delivery stage and how to apply appropriate measurements for that phase of work.


Essential experience


¬∑ worked with data platforms such as Google Analytics, Splunk, Datadog, or similar

¬∑ used data visualisation tools such as Data Studio to create service performance dashboards

¬∑ designed and implemented a performance framework including KPIs or OKRs for a service or product

¬∑ analytical skills in identifying the right data sources and then validate and understand how to interpret the results

¬∑ collected, collated, cleansed, and interpreted data to derive meaningful and actionable insights

¬∑ an ability to use the most appropriate medium to visualise data to tell compelling and relevant actionable stories

¬∑ created hypotheses that can be tested, and developed insights based on your findings

¬∑ working within a GDS delivery environment within a government department

¬∑ valid Security Clearance or eligibility (5+ years residency in the UK)


Desirable experience


¬∑ visualising data using Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, Power Query or similar

¬∑ scripting and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R etc

¬∑ security and data privacy

¬∑ making recommendations for service changes


Where you‚Äôll work


Your working time at Opencast will be split between multiple locations, including from their HQ and hub locations, client site or home. Travel is part of life at Opencast, and takes in account requirements of your work, their clients and your team.

They include you


They welcome candidates from all identities, attributes, ways of thinking and backgrounds to thrive in a career at Opencast. Their aim is for the diversity of their people to be reflected in the solutions they deliver, to help create a fairer society for all.


Interview


Job interviews are on Microsoft Teams. They'll make any adjustments to help you.

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
So Energy ‚Äì BI Data Analyst

üåç UK, Hybrid

üå± Job Level: Mid-Senior

Please note we are not able to facilitate Visa or Relocation Sponsorship at present or in the future and therefore can only accept UK based applications from candidates who are able to commute to HQ in London, Chiswick 1-2 times per week.

Our Perks

Values-driven culture ‚Äì we‚Äôre really proud of our culture.

Drive Your Own Experience


Personalised Learning and Development Budget
Hybrid working hours ‚Äì Each team has their own Smart Working Charter that empowers you to do your work in the best way you can
Technology ‚Äì Your choice of Mac or Windows


Empowering you to be your most authentic self


25 Holiday Days + your local bank holidays
1 Birthday day ‚Äì it only happens once a year!
3 So Giving Days - spend these days giving back to your chosen cause
Religious Celebrations Leave
Mental Healthcare ‚Äì Sessions with Unmind
Enhanced Family Leave


So Energy

So Energy was created in 2015 because we knew energy suppliers could be better. Since then, we‚Äôve grown rapidly but sustainably, with 350,000 customers and over 450 Energists (what we call our people). We‚Äôre not done yet. We are on the road to a net zero future, and thanks to our partnership with ESB, we‚Äôre well on the way. We‚Äôre customer-centric, tech-led, and passionate about sustainability.

We want to do the best we can for our customers, each other, and our planet, so we‚Äôve created a workplace that's encouraging, supportive, and offers the opportunity for growth. As a company, we live by six core values that guide everything we do:


Clear
Honest
Ambitious
Inquisitive
Caring
Sustainable


The Role

BI Data Analyst at SO ENERGY

Reporting into Nethin Maharaj, our Business Intelligence Manager here at So Energy üëã, we are seeking an experienced and highly skilled BI Data Analyst to join our data analytics team. As a BI Data Analyst at So Energy you will play a pivotal role in leveraging data to drive strategic decisions and solve complex challenges for the business.

We are looking for a candidate with advanced SQL and Python skills who has a track record of successfully delivering analytical insights to the business.

If you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and possess excellent soft skills to engage with stakeholders, we invite you to apply and become a key member of our dynamic team.

As So Energy‚Äôs Business Intelligence Data Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the business in our data-driven focus on growth and efficiency. Within this role, you will be identifying reporting and data opportunities, analysing trends, and presenting back insights with potential solutions to solve some of the key business challenges. Our solutions are primarily built on the Google Cloud stack, of which Looker is our main BI reporting tool. This will require you to be adept to working on Looker with other BI tools being an added advantage.

What you‚Äôll be getting up to:


Gather and document requirements in a way that allows us to design well suited dashboards and reports.
Translate requirements to technical solutions
Analyse data to identify trends and patterns - Interrogate and curate the quality, consistency and completeness of data to ensure that the quality of insights are complete and relevant.
Script data transformation and business rules in SQL.
Research new data sources which will add value into the reporting that you will be delivering.
Support the business in ad-hoc data analysis and data supply covering auditing, marketing campaigns and customer segmentation.
Design reporting tables which facilitate the delivery of dashboards and insights - Build dashboards and reports in Google Looker.
Dashboard design should follow intuitive data flow and presentation for easier end-user consumption and decision making.
Input and guide on new standards to improve the performance of our Looker environment using LookML and improve the landscape of reporting and insights to the business.
Perform data reconciliation tasks to ensure that new reporting outputs are aligned or of better accuracy than existing reports.
Write quality technical documentation of SQL coding as well as dashboards delivered.
Contribute as part of an agile team with sprint planning sessions and daily stand ups.
Communicate status, blockers, and progress in a clear and concise manner.


This role will be a great fit if you have:


You will need to be a detailed orientated individual who has a passion for analysing data.
You will work closely with our Data Engineering team to build reporting friendly structures.
A key attention to detail will be required in the reviewing and validating of data as part of your data delivery process.
You should have experience in end user engagement on requirements elicitation and the ability to identify stakeholder problems that can be solved through data.
Proven hands-on experience with Google Looker including building and maintaining a high performant semantic layer in LookML and creating insightful and actionable dashboards for end users.
You should be comfortable with communicating insights to senior management and across the organisation.
Provide technical support to other teams within the organisation as required - You should have a strong SQL background with a deep understanding of how to use SQL and interrogate data in the context of business objectives.
Be a team player, contributing towards the upliftment of our overall BI capability and supporting junior team members produce higher quality outputs.


Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for a role unless they are 100% qualified. Your experience, skills and passion will set you apart so tell us about your achievements, irrespective of whether they are personal or work-related, tell us about your journey, and about what you learnt.

So, if this role excites you, don‚Äôt let our role description hold you back, get applying!

Hiring Process:


Talent Screen ‚Äì (30 minutes) Rebecca
HM Screening + Stakeholder Management - (60 minutes) Nethin + Holly
Take Home Task (candidate)
Final Stage Leadership ‚Äì Present Take Home (45 minutes) MK + Nethin


Support ‚Äì If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to be at your best ‚Äì please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed.

Our Values

We look for people who share our values and can add to our culture. Values are shared beliefs that guide our decision-making, culture is how we function as a group and how we live our values as individuals.

Clear - The energy industry can be pretty complex so we strive to provide clear communication to our customers and colleagues

Honest - Transparency is key, Whether that's providing clear bills to our customers or trusting our staff to do the right thing.

Ambitious - All of us are ambitious about the future of So Energy and what we can contribute to it.

Inquisitive - We are also questioning the Status Quo to see if there is a better way to do things for our customers

Caring - We care about the work we are doing, our customers and our colleagues

Sustainable - As a renewable energy company we are providing sustainable products but we also care about sustainable careers. That's why learning and continuous development is so important to us.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging

At So Energy, we‚Äôre committed to cultivating an environment that promotes diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging. We are a global community and we believe our unique qualities should be celebrated as they are critical to our innovation. It‚Äôs essential to us that you bring your authentic self to work every single day, no matter your age, ethnicity, religion, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, caring responsibilities, neurodiversity, or otherwise. Inclusion isn‚Äôt just an initiative at So Energy. We strive to embed it not just into our values but throughout our entire culture.

Title: Data Modelling Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Modelling Analyst

Job Position: Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Starting Salary: ¬£27,000 - ¬£35,000

About Us: Evolution HTD is an innovative hire, train, deploy organisation headquartered in Warrington, UK. We specialise in building data capabilities within the insurance sector. Our HTD Programme is a fixed 2-year commitment between Evolution and the data consultant, where customers have the option to hire the consultant permanently at the end of the agreed deployment period.

Why Evolution: üî• Dynamic Data Opportunities: Immerse yourself in hands-on experiences working directly with data projects for one or more organisations within our impressive client portfolio. Tackle challenging data visualisation projects that will enhance your skills, broaden your network, and equip you with the tools to excel in data analysis and deployment.

üìö Ongoing Data Learning: Your journey begins with intensive training in data technologies, but the learning is continuous. Over several years, you will engage in ongoing education, obtaining industry-recognised qualifications tailored to your abilities, including Data Analysis, Data Visualisation, Advanced Analytical Techniques, and more.

üéì Mentoring and Coaching: Thrive under the guidance of our seasoned data experts and Technical Trainers. Leverage their expertise to advance your career path in the data field.

Job Description:

Key Responsibilities


Catastrophe Management:
Run models to quantify the likelihood and severity of natural catastrophes
Process and interpret client exposure data for use in catastrophe models
Conduct sensitivity testing and provide event-response insights to clients
Collaborate with academic and industry partners to innovate solutions
Catastrophe Cyber:
Work with cyber insurance datasets and risk models
Develop and maintain global data sets and analytics offerings
Evaluate and validate cyber models
Manage client relationships and contribute to research efforts
Catastrophe Evaluation/Research:
Provide up-to-date information on natural catastrophes
Evaluate and validate catastrophe models
Test model sensitivities and validate components using third-party data
Analyze claims experience and quantify climate change impacts


Requirements


Experience: 1-3 years in data visualisation and/or business analysis roles, ideally within financial services
Skills and Requirements:
Analytical Skills: Strong logical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail in data processing and analysis
Communication: Good communication skills, able to simplify complex ideas
Self-Starter: Initiative to work independently and collaboratively
Commercial Awareness: Understand and support clients with clarity and confidence
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming (Python or R) is desirable
Project Management: Demonstrated ability to manage projects and coordinate activities across multiple departments
Soft Skills: Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills. Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Education: Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent experience

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

As an AWF Business Intelligence Analyst on the Global Ads Marketing team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Q4 peak season planning. You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.
Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.
Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.
Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.
Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.
Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.
Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.
Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 1 year of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.
Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.
Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.
Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

What We Offer:

A creative and collaborative workplace where your contributions are recognized.
A supportive team that values innovation and data-driven decision-making.

Join us and be a part of shaping the future of advertising during our most exciting time of the year!

Title: Social Data Analyst
Description:
Social Data Analyst role at a fast-growing independent performance / paid social agency.







Salary to ¬£38,000 + bonus. Based Central London (2 days required in office per week).







Summary

This role has huge growth potential ‚Äì potentially to grow the team and manage a small department in years to come
Across a range of clients with a big B2C brand focus
You will ideally have experience with Looker (or similar) and be super-interested in social analytics and presenting data in clear, translatable ways for clients
Focus is paid social but also keen to expand on organic social analytics







As a Data Analyst, you'll contribute to the agencies growth by diving deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape our campaigns.







The business has ambitious growth targets and are looking to organically grow to double in size by 2026. They have an inclusive working environment where team togetherness is promoted, including team lunches and Thursday night social‚Äôs.







Key Responsibilities:




Data Integration - Integrate data from multiple sources using Funnel, ensuring accuracy and accessibility for analysis.
Report Creation - Create and maintain Looker Studio reports for daily decision-making, continuously improving their accuracy and usefulness.
Experimentation - Run structured experiments, identify testing opportunities, implement them, manage rewards, and communicate results.
Data Analysis - Conduct incrementality studies, analyze trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks, and provide detailed insights.
Tracking - Audit tracking setups, build tracking maps, and help clients troubleshoot tracking issues.







What We Need from You:




3+ years‚Äô experience within a social / data analyst role
Proficiency in using spreadsheets for daily tasks.
Strong data analysis skills to surface insights and present them clearly.
Excellent communication skills for presenting findings.
B2C client experience
Attention to detail to ensure accuracy and reliability in data handling.
Knowledge of marketing data and its complexities.
Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python is highly desirable.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and paid media management tools.
Experience running A/B tests and reporting findings.
Interest in AI trends and technologies for measuring metrics in social media.

  • Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and paid media management tools.
  • Experience running A/B tests and reporting findings.
  • Interest in AI trends and technologies for measuring metrics in social media.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title

Data Analyst

Job Description Summary

Job Description

Data Analyst

Location - London

We have a great opportunity for a Database Analyst to join our Global Occupier Services team here in London.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in integrating data from multiple sources into databases, ensuring data consistency and accuracy.
Manage and deliver regular reporting on behalf of Transaction Management team to client on a daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly basis.
Manage and prepare reporting continuously for live dashboards and presentations for QBR meetings.
Interface between the Transaction Management team and the tech team to ensure updates are fit for purpose and most efficient.
Assist in optimizing database schema, queries, and indexing strategies to improve performance and efficiency.
Analyse database performance metrics and recommend optimizations based on trends and patterns.
Monitor database performance and resource utilisation to identify and address inefficiencies or bottlenecks.
Support tech team in any data migration projects by assisting in the planning, execution, and validation of database migrations between environments or platforms.
Respond to client flags on database-related incidents, diagnose root causes, and implement corrective actions in a timely manner.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of database configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.
Keeper of best practice and super user for all databases used by the tech team.
Build and develop and maintain trust by the client in the data.


If you are keen to hear more about this role, then get in touch.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Analytics & Insights/ Performance, Investment Management




London, Hybrid




Duration: FTC 9-12 months




Our client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Analytics & Insights team for a 9-12 month fixed-term contract. In this role, you will be pivotal in collecting, organising, and analysing performance data from a wide range of companies. Your contributions will be essential to key reporting and will support internal performance management, delivering high-quality insights that help shape strategy and portfolio management decisions.




Key Responsibilities:




Collect, structure, and input data from investee companies (including financial metrics, ESG indicators, and impact reports) into the company‚Äôs management information system.
Collaborate closely with various teams to ensure data accuracy, check for anomalies, and liaise with investees to resolve inconsistencies.
Provide Excel-based analysis on impact and performance, contributing to the company‚Äôs annual report and internal tools.
Oversee the migration of legacy impact metrics into a new data management system, ensuring data integrity throughout the process.
Support the team with ongoing improvements to data analysis and reporting processes.




Key Skills:




Data analysis: Strong experience in collecting and analysing data, ensuring accuracy and consistency across multiple sources.
Excel proficiency: Essential, with a preference for experience in automating analysis processes.
Technical know-how: Familiarity with Power BI, Microsoft PowerPoint, and accounting terminology.
Project management: Strong organisational skills to handle large datasets and meet deadlines.
Attention to detail: Critical for managing and analysing data from various reports and systems.




Personal Attributes:




Collaborative: Proven ability to work closely with cross-functional teams.
Detail-oriented: High attention to detail with a focus on data accuracy and quality assurance.
Results-driven: Motivated by achieving high-quality outcomes and continuously improving processes.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

As an AWF Business Intelligence Analyst on the Global Ads Marketing team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Q4 peak season planning. You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.
Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.
Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.
Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.
Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.
Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.
Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.
Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 1 year of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.
Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.
Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.
Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

What We Offer:

A creative and collaborative workplace where your contributions are recognized.
A supportive team that values innovation and data-driven decision-making.

Join us and be a part of shaping the future of advertising during our most exciting time of the year!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Allica bank

Allica is the UK‚Äôs fastest growing company - and the fastest-growing financial technology (fintech) firm ever. Our purpose is to help established SMEs, one of the last major underserved opportunities in fintech. Established SMEs are the backbone of local communities - representing over a third of our economy - yet have been largely neglected both by traditional high street banks and modern fintech providers




Role Description

Data is a key asset to Allica and is deeply embedded in all our teams and products. With data, we assist and work with Finance, Operations, Credit Risk, Lending and management.




We are looking for ambitious and curious people who can help us understand our data better, contribute to facilitating the discussions between engineering and the data stakeholders and have an impact on the business by telling stories around the insights they generate.




You will be an integral part of the lending data squad, and the focus will be scaling up our ability to deliver analytics/insights and managing stakeholder interactions to support ongoing data needs




Principal Accountabilities

Understand our products and processes through the data we have or collect
Work with the Lending Tribe and other stakeholders (Ops, risk, etc) to understand their data needs and provide solutions that address the core need (not just the immediate requests).
Contribute meaningful insights from our data that proactively drive decisions and new lines of inquiry
Build visualizations and reports that enable the Lending business to service their ongoing data needs and measure KPIs
Develop data knowledge base (definitions, working rhythms etc.) within the team that enables us to become an information hub for the business
Helping us implement a data-driven mindset in the company by promoting a metrics-based approach to new initiatives (opportunity sizing prior and success metrics post deployment)




Personal Attributes & Experience

Previous experience working as a data analyst
You prefer to think through how to build an interesting analytics function at a company (rather than fit into existing conventions)
The ability to write queries in SQL with logic to combine multiple data sources
You work well with stakeholders across the business.
You communicate effectively and are comfortable with learning how to translate technical detail into business and commercial language.
You have a solid foundation in Python programming OR a strong desire to learn
Prior experience working in Google Cloud Platform and using Looker is desirable (but not at all necessary)




Don‚Äôt tick every box?

Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt have all the skills or requirements listed on the job description. If you think you‚Äôll be a good fit, we‚Äôd still love to hear from you!




Flexible working

We know the ‚Äò9-to-5‚Äô isn‚Äôt right for everyone. That‚Äôs why Allica Bank is fully committed to flexible and hybrid working. Please let us know what is best for you and, if we can, we will do our best to accommodate.




Diversity

We‚Äôre a diverse bunch here at Allica, with all kinds of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. Our openness and differences make us stronger, and we want everybody to feel comfortable bringing as much of themselves to work with them as they like.




Additional Information

Working at Allica Bank

At Allica Bank we want to ensure our employees have the right tools and environment in which to succeed in their role and in support of our customers.

Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, so our benefits are designed with you in mind:

Full onboarding support and continued development opportunities
Options for flexible working
Regular social activities
25 days holiday ‚Äì with the option to Buy/Sell
Pension contributions
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private health cover (with the option to add family members)
Life assurance
Income Protection
Family friendly policies including enhanced Maternity & Paternity leave
Season ticket loans

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you seeking a new challenge in a dynamic and impactful organization? The Behavioural Insights Team (BIT) is looking for a passionate individual to support data-driven business decisions and operational excellence. This role involves explaining the story behind the numbers and working with various stakeholders to drive commercial performance, aligning with BIT‚Äôs social impact aims and continuous improvement.




About BIT:

The Behavioural Insights Team is a social purpose company that collaborates with governments, businesses, and charities to address major policy issues through simple yet powerful changes. With 250 staff across 8 countries, BIT has completed over 1000 projects, including 700 randomized controlled trials, to improve lives and communities. Acquired by Nesta in 2021, BIT continues to share expertise and build capacity in applying behavioural science for social good




Role and Responsibilities:

This newly created role is in BIT‚Äôs Data team, reporting to the Head of Data Visualisation to support the day-to-day business running of Power BI and the improvement of efficiencies in the business. You will play a crucial role in monitoring data quality, correcting data issues, and supporting the finance team with month-end reporting.




Key responsibilities include:

Data Quality and Maintenance: Monitor reports for data quality, correct data issues, and ensure the main data system is current. Become an expert in using the system and advise users across the business.
Data Integration and Visualization: Use Power BI to connect to various data sources, manipulate data, and display it in an easily digestible format. Perform statistical analysis of data and create understandable reports and visualizations.
Ad-Hoc Data Requests: Handle ad-hoc data requests from around the business, providing support with exports from Power BI or other data systems.
Support Finance Team: Assist with the budgeting process for the finance team using G-Sheets and Power BI, and support month-end reporting by reconciling data between sources.
Stakeholder Engagement: Liaise with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements for reporting, and work to deliver these reports.




Skills and Experience:

Data Analysis: Strong interest in and passion for data analysis. Proficiency in using tools such as Excel/Google Sheets for data extraction and analysis. Extensive experience with Power BI, including connecting to data sources, manipulating data, and creating visualizations.
Process Improvement: Ability to analyze, prioritize, and redesign business processes to simplify, automate, and reduce workload‚Äîexperience in planning, implementing, and communicating changes effectively.
Communication: Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to explain complex topics in simple terms and communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
Time Management: Proven ability to manage deadlines and priorities to produce high-quality work within reasonable timeframes.
Teamwork: Although this role will be mainly independent, experience in collaborating with team members and providing support to ensure successful project outcomes. Ability to manage workload effectively and care about the success and well-being of others.
Ability to work independently: Ability to carry out all the above skills independently as this will be a self-sufficient role.




Qualifications:

A bachelor's degree (or equivalent qualification) in a relevant field, such as Data Science, Statistics, Finance, or a related discipline.
1-3 years of experience in a data analyst role, focusing on using Power BI (with both M-Query and DAX) for data visualization and analysis.




Ideal Candidates Will Also Have:

Experience working with overseas subsidiaries.
Experience in professional services or consultancy businesses.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Pinnacle Group are seeking a motivated Junior Data Analyst to support our dynamic Data Analytics Team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our Data Engineer and Data Analytics Manager to gather, clean, and analyse data. This position offers a fantastic opportunity to learn and apply various data analysis techniques and tools.

Our Data Analytics Team operates remotely, with monthly meetings held in Holborn. The team provides valuable insights and key performance indicators (KPIs) through the use of Power BI that enhance operational understanding of business performance and inform strategic decision-making.

This is a remote based role with monthly meetings at our Head Office in Holborn, the role is full time working Monday to Friday.

Who We Are

Pinnacle Group is a leading UK private sector provider of housing and neighbourhood services, managing and maintaining communities where people live, learn, work and play.

We‚Äôre a people-first organisation with a values driven culture that has remained consistent for thirty years; living through how we treat our employees and our customers.

Who We‚Äôre Looking For

We‚Äôre looking for someone who, alongside the key criteria below, will sign up to our values of Trust, Respect, Involve, Challenge and Deliver Excellence and will be determined to maintain the confidence of our clients and communities.

Key Responsibilities Will Include


Actively support the collection of accurate data within critical timelines
Supporting maintenance of Power BI dashboards. (No experience required)
Supporting Carbon Footprint Data Collection
Ensure that data is obtained and processed in a timely fashion
Data Analytics Admin
Providing support for dashboard users
Supporting Data Analytics Manager and other team members


Key Requirements


Intermediate knowledge of Excel
An aptitude towards data analysis and administration
Willingness to learn
Enthusiastic and self-motivated.
Good written and spoken communication skills


Our Offer

The more diverse our workforce, the better we can adapt to and reflect the needs of our customers.

We welcome applications from all backgrounds - particularly from those who represent the communities we serve including ex-armed forces personnel and their families.

As a colleague, you will become part of an inclusive culture, where you will have the opportunity to achieve your full potential and enhance your career through learning and development.

We offer a wide range of benefits at Pinnacle Group, dependant on your role or business area, these range from additional leave packages to pension plans and discounts at your favourite retailers.


Maternity/paternity packages
Flexible Working Arrangements
Life Assurance
Enhanced Pension Scheme
Additional Annual Leave
Private Medical Insurance
Cycle to Work Scheme
Employee Assistance Programme
Retail Discounts
Childcare Assistance
Season Ticket Loans
Sick Pay Schemes
Personal Development Plans
Company Car/Car Allowance
Electric Vehicle Scheme

Title: Social Data Analyst
Description:
Social Data Analyst role at a fast-growing independent performance / paid social agency.







Salary to ¬£38,000 + bonus. Based Central London (2 days required in office per week).







Summary

This role has huge growth potential ‚Äì potentially to grow the team and manage a small department in years to come
Across a range of clients with a big B2C brand focus
You will ideally have experience with Looker (or similar) and be super-interested in social analytics and presenting data in clear, translatable ways for clients
Focus is paid social but also keen to expand on organic social analytics







As a Data Analyst, you'll contribute to the agencies growth by diving deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape our campaigns.







The business has ambitious growth targets and are looking to organically grow to double in size by 2026. They have an inclusive working environment where team togetherness is promoted, including team lunches and Thursday night social‚Äôs.







Key Responsibilities:




Data Integration - Integrate data from multiple sources using Funnel, ensuring accuracy and accessibility for analysis.
Report Creation - Create and maintain Looker Studio reports for daily decision-making, continuously improving their accuracy and usefulness.
Experimentation - Run structured experiments, identify testing opportunities, implement them, manage rewards, and communicate results.
Data Analysis - Conduct incrementality studies, analyze trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks, and provide detailed insights.
Tracking - Audit tracking setups, build tracking maps, and help clients troubleshoot tracking issues.







What We Need from You:




3+ years‚Äô experience within a social / data analyst role
Proficiency in using spreadsheets for daily tasks.
Strong data analysis skills to surface insights and present them clearly.
Excellent communication skills for presenting findings.
B2C client experience
Attention to detail to ensure accuracy and reliability in data handling.
Knowledge of marketing data and its complexities.
Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python is highly desirable.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and paid media management tools.
Experience running A/B tests and reporting findings.
Interest in AI trends and technologies for measuring metrics in social media.

  • You will ideally have experience with Looker (or similar) and be super-interested in social analytics and presenting data in clear, translatable ways for clients
  • Focus is paid social but also keen to expand on organic social analytics



As a Data Analyst, you'll contribute to the agencies growth by diving deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape our campaigns.



The business has ambitious growth targets and are looking to organically grow to double in size by 2026. They have an inclusive working environment where team togetherness is promoted, including team lunches and Thursday night social‚Äôs.



Key Responsibilities:


  • Data Integration - Integrate data from multiple sources using Funnel, ensuring accuracy and accessibility for analysis.
  • Report Creation - Create and maintain Looker Studio reports for daily decision-making, continuously improving their accuracy and usefulness.
  • Experimentation - Run structured experiments, identify testing opportunities, implement them, manage rewards, and communicate results.
  • Data Analysis - Conduct incrementality studies, analyze trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks, and provide detailed insights.
  • Tracking - Audit tracking setups, build tracking maps, and help clients troubleshoot tracking issues.



What We Need from You:


  • 3+ years‚Äô experience within a social / data analyst role
  • Proficiency in using spreadsheets for daily tasks.
  • Strong data analysis skills to surface insights and present them clearly.
  • Excellent communication skills for presenting findings.
  • B2C client experience
  • Attention to detail to ensure accuracy and reliability in data handling.
  • Knowledge of marketing data and its complexities.
  • Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python is highly desirable.
  • Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and paid media management tools.
  • Experience running A/B tests and reporting findings.
  • Interest in AI trends and technologies for measuring metrics in social media.

Title: Data Modelling Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Modelling Analyst

Job Position: Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Starting Salary: ¬£27,000 - ¬£35,000

About Us: Evolution HTD is an innovative hire, train, deploy organisation headquartered in Warrington, UK. We specialise in building data capabilities within the insurance sector. Our HTD Programme is a fixed 2-year commitment between Evolution and the data consultant, where customers have the option to hire the consultant permanently at the end of the agreed deployment period.

Why Evolution: üî• Dynamic Data Opportunities: Immerse yourself in hands-on experiences working directly with data projects for one or more organisations within our impressive client portfolio. Tackle challenging data visualisation projects that will enhance your skills, broaden your network, and equip you with the tools to excel in data analysis and deployment.

üìö Ongoing Data Learning: Your journey begins with intensive training in data technologies, but the learning is continuous. Over several years, you will engage in ongoing education, obtaining industry-recognised qualifications tailored to your abilities, including Data Analysis, Data Visualisation, Advanced Analytical Techniques, and more.

üéì Mentoring and Coaching: Thrive under the guidance of our seasoned data experts and Technical Trainers. Leverage their expertise to advance your career path in the data field.

Job Description:

Key Responsibilities


Catastrophe Management:
Run models to quantify the likelihood and severity of natural catastrophes
Process and interpret client exposure data for use in catastrophe models
Conduct sensitivity testing and provide event-response insights to clients
Collaborate with academic and industry partners to innovate solutions
Catastrophe Cyber:
Work with cyber insurance datasets and risk models
Develop and maintain global data sets and analytics offerings
Evaluate and validate cyber models
Manage client relationships and contribute to research efforts
Catastrophe Evaluation/Research:
Provide up-to-date information on natural catastrophes
Evaluate and validate catastrophe models
Test model sensitivities and validate components using third-party data
Analyze claims experience and quantify climate change impacts


Requirements


Experience: 1-3 years in data visualisation and/or business analysis roles, ideally within financial services
Skills and Requirements:
Analytical Skills: Strong logical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail in data processing and analysis
Communication: Good communication skills, able to simplify complex ideas
Self-Starter: Initiative to work independently and collaboratively
Commercial Awareness: Understand and support clients with clarity and confidence
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming (Python or R) is desirable
Project Management: Demonstrated ability to manage projects and coordinate activities across multiple departments
Soft Skills: Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills. Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Education: Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Enna is a specialised recruitment agency for neurodivergent job seekers - we support candidates who identify as neurodivergent - autistic, ADHD, dyslexia, dyspraxia etc.

About The Role

OmniGov‚Äôs Communication‚Äôs Intelligence team are searching for a Data Analyst to join the team and help provide best in class data analysis and marketing effectiveness solutions for Omnigov, private sector clients and media agencies within OMG. Uniquely in OmniGOV, the strategic analytics team within the wider communications intelligence group runs consultancy and MMM projects with commercial clients, as well as delivering cross-government campaign analysis to OmniGOV and HM Government.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our ongoing quest for understanding and insights. You‚Äôll contribute to building and maintaining our essential Government benchmark database and knowledge system. Your responsibilities will include sophisticated data analysis, methodology evolution, and generating reports for key categories and brands. Additionally, you‚Äôll create visualisations and automate processes related to Government files and databases.

The role is varied, interesting and provides excellent opportunities to work with a wide range of people, techniques and solutions, within OmniGOV and the wider agency group.

The Communications Intelligence team are a team of 16 people based in Omnicom‚Äôs impressive offices in Bankside. We are passionate about data, all types of analysis but especially strategic analysis and leading the provision of marketing effectiveness solutions for all our stakeholders.

Role Requirements

Government Benchmark Database Maintenance:


Collaborate with a Manager to add new data to the Government benchmark databases managed by Omnigov and the Benchmarking team.
Quality checks and data loading using tools like R, Python, and Power BI.


Support the wider Communications Intelligence Team


Support and mentor Junior Analysts to ensure high-quality work and a commitment to growth and development.
Engage in the wider Communications Intelligence Strategic goals to drive higher quality work for our clients.
Feed into our wider vision and strategy as a team


Agency Relationships


Support and coach Junior Data Analysts
Cultivate day-to-day relationships with users of the knowledge system within agencies and OmniGOV‚Äôs Government databases
Provide excellent service levels to agencies working with analysts and managers


Client Relationships


Support the team in consultancy engagements with Government clients
Update and build comprehensive datasets for agency pitch analysis from the knowledge database content
Deliver high-quality visualisations and effectively communicate data insights to agency clients
Use advanced analytical approaches to analyse data to establish norms and averages, interpreting findings


Skills Required


Experience in a Marketing Analytics role (MMM or similar)
Understanding of the role of media
Experience in developing analytic models
Coding proficiency (R or Python preference)
Expertise in Excel
Interested in Government marketing and media
Strong attention to detail
Good written and communication skills
Highly organised & Strong critical thinking
Willingness to Learn, energetic, determined, proactive and curious


Nice To Haves


English and maths GCSEs at grade C (4) or above or equivalents.
Degree in an analytical subject 2:1 Or higher


About The Agency

OmniGov is a specialist division created to handle UK Government media buying, the largest advertiser in the UK, and a top 10 UK agency in its own right, handling over 80 very different government departments. We were originally awarded the four year contract in 2018 and late 2021 we became the first agency ever to retain the business for the next 4 years.

Our ambition is to be the best Government Media Buying service in the world, intelligently using media to deliver public services. In doing so we want to lead the industry in the UK and be one of the best places to work and learn in the media sector. In fact, we have been Campaign‚Äôs Agency Team of the Year for the last 3 years.

Our team of c.150 people are passionate about delivering better outcomes for the public sector. Why? This is taxpayers‚Äô money we are dealing with, and the outcomes of these campaigns really do matter. Effectiveness is the driving factor. You will work on campaigns that can represent the most profoundly challenging issues in our society aiming to help, improve or save lives. At other times they simply aim to inform the public. But at all times they matter. To people across the UK and beyond, to us, our families and our own communities.

We are organised across different client hubs themed by government priority nationally, regionally and internationally.

Our core teams and expertise encompass Account Management, Effectiveness & Evaluation, Implementation Planning and Media Activation across all channels. We also have specialist services such as Strategic partnerships, Innovation, Behavioural Planning, Communications Intelligence including Data Engineering, Reporting/Visualisation, Data Science, Strategic Analytics, Brand Safety and Data Ethics.

OmniGOV draws from the best of Omnicom Group UK and sits as a unit within MG OMD, Campaigns Media Agency of the year 2021 and 2024, the largest agency within OMG UK and the most awarded media agency ever for IPA Effectiveness.

Working for OmniGOV is different to other jobs in the media agency sector. Working with government can be challenging, dynamic and demands the highest standards, but above all it is important work and rewarding. We believe there is no better place to learn and grow in the industry.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of ¬£50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - ¬£30,000
Data Analyst - ¬£50,000
Business Data Analyst - ¬£67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - ¬£80,000
Business Analysts - ¬£60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.
Show more
HTML:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of ¬£50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:

  • Junior Data Analyst - ¬£30,000
  • Data Analyst - ¬£50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - ¬£67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - ¬£80,000
  • Business Analysts - ¬£60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Introduction

BI Analyst (Tableau)

The Economist is a leading source of analysis on international business and world affairs, published weekly in print and digital editions, and daily through our Espresso app and Economist.com. We deliver our information through a range of formats, from newspapers and magazines to conferences, films and digital editions. What ties us together is the objectivity of our opinion, the originality of our insight and our advocacy of economic and political freedom around the world.

This is an exciting time to join the Data & Insights team at The Economist Group. Under our newly appointed Chief Data Officer we are creating a centre of excellence spanning research, analytics and data science partnering with the whole group, including our core subscription business, our Economist Intelligence, Economist Impact and Executive Education and Events businesses. Our purpose is to better understand and affect the drivers of our business through data analytics and research, with a focus on our users, B2C customers and B2B clients. We are value-focused and outcome-driven: we help drive growth and agility at every level, whether through informing strategic alignment and decisions, providing quick feedback loops to operators or creating machine learning models to be integrated into our products and marketing communications.

In this role, you will contribute key deliverables to help us to bring data to a wide audience of stakeholders around the business. You will translate requirements into Tableau dashboards, using best practice data visualisation guidelines, ensuring content can be consumed with the minimum effort possible. Our goal is to drive up dashboard usage to facilitate more data-driven decisions, and to enable self-service BI across all verticals at the Economist. This role will work closely with the B2C Retention team, aiming to better engage and retain the subscribers we currently have.

Accountabilities

In the role you would be expected to:


Deliver regular reporting using data visualisations in Tableau
Create impactful data visualisations that drive action in Tableau
Build using a template to ensure consistent look and feel for the end user
Present your findings to stakeholders and iterate on dashboards to keep them relevant
Identify ways to automate currently manual processes, using Tableau to visualise
Provide end-user training in Tableau in an engaging way
Share your Tableau knowledge with others across the team and company to help build a Tableau community
Help to ensure best practice visualisation standards are employed in the team‚Äôs Tableau content
Build the right Tableau published data sources to enable self-service BI
Gather new business requirements and collaborate closely with our users


Indicators used to measure success in this role include:


Increasing the number of users of Tableau dashboards, compared to current usage
Improved ability for our users to make business decisions using data visualisations
Measurable increase in the quality of data across BI applications
Reduction in ad-hoc reporting / data requests through self-service BI
Optimised BI solutions delivered within time, quality and budget constraints


Experience, Skills And Professional Attributes

To succeed in the role, you must have:


Experience building and enhancing Tableau workbooks
Analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
High levels of energy, enthusiasm and passion to succeed in a dynamic environment
Hands-on experience working with Tableau Online or Tableau Server
Knowledge of best practice data visualisation techniques


It would also be desirable if you have:


Experience working with subscription-based data sets and related metrics
Tableau certification
Experience using Snowflake or SQL Server
Tableau Public profile
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
BI Consulting Analyst - Financial Services ‚Äì SQL / Python / Spark




Overview:

We‚Äôre currently partnered with a leading global Supply Chain business who possess over 150 years of experience in commodity trading. They are looking for a BI Consulting Analyst to join the business and take ownership in helping key clients reduce costs and carbon emissions by utilising advanced tech and AI to help solve complex optimisation issues throughout the supply chain. This includes warehouse allocation, optimal routing and manufacturing inputs (ingredients).




Role & Responsibilities:

Collaborate with clients to understand their business objectives and BI requirements.
Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Analyse complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Create and deliver compelling data visualizations and reports that facilitate strategic decision-making.
Provide training and support to clients on BI tools and best practices.
Conduct data validation and ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Stay updated with the latest BI trends and technologies to provide innovative solutions.
Assist in the development of BI strategies and roadmaps for clients.
Use AI to enhance processes and drive value across the business.




Essential Skills & Experience:

2+ years of experience in BI, data analytics, or a related role.
Previous experience or a genuine interest in supply chain consulting or optimisation problems.
Confident using Python, Spark & SQL.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Strong SQL skills and experience with database management.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




Package:

Competitive salary

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title

Data Analyst

Job Description Summary

Job Description

Data Analyst

Location - London

We have a great opportunity for a Database Analyst to join our Global Occupier Services team here in London.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in integrating data from multiple sources into databases, ensuring data consistency and accuracy.
Manage and deliver regular reporting on behalf of Transaction Management team to client on a daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly basis.
Manage and prepare reporting continuously for live dashboards and presentations for QBR meetings.
Interface between the Transaction Management team and the tech team to ensure updates are fit for purpose and most efficient.
Assist in optimizing database schema, queries, and indexing strategies to improve performance and efficiency.
Analyse database performance metrics and recommend optimizations based on trends and patterns.
Monitor database performance and resource utilisation to identify and address inefficiencies or bottlenecks.
Support tech team in any data migration projects by assisting in the planning, execution, and validation of database migrations between environments or platforms.
Respond to client flags on database-related incidents, diagnose root causes, and implement corrective actions in a timely manner.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of database configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.
Keeper of best practice and super user for all databases used by the tech team.
Build and develop and maintain trust by the client in the data.


If you are keen to hear more about this role, then get in touch.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe‚Äôs most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$128,700 - C$174,100. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings (‚ÄúOTE‚Äù) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant‚Äôs location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Genpact (NYSE: G) is a global professional services and solutions firm delivering outcomes that shape the future. Our 125,000+ people across 30+ countries are driven by our innate curiosity, entrepreneurial agility, and desire to create lasting value for clients. Powered by our purpose - the relentless pursuit of a world that works better for people - we serve and transform leading enterprises, including the Fortune Global 500, with our deep business and industry knowledge, digital operations services, and expertise in data, technology, and AI.




Inviting applications for the role of Business Data Analyst

Location: Toronto Canada ( 3 days onsite/week)




Skills:

Data centric project (retail banking/fraud/AML) / work packages for Tier 2-4, low to moderate risk and regulatory projects with multiple stakeholders and across multiple LoB
Advanced to expert knowledge of capital markets products, regulatory reporting, business systems analysis, project delivery practices and standards across the project life-cycle
Data profiling of large datasets using tools like Python notebooks, SQL, MS Excel is a major plus.
Gain/acquire sound to advanced understanding of business and user interaction with technology throughout project delivery
Works independently as the senior or lead business analyst and coaches and guides members within area of expertise
Identifies and leads problem resolution for complex issues at all levels
Contributes to the communication and change management activities across multiple stakeholders
Undergraduate degree (technical or finance discipline)
Azure certification is an asset
Basic python knowledge (data analysis/profiling) is an asset.
5-7 years related business analysis experience
