Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Location Address: Hybrid (once a week preferred; as required for town halls and group events) ‚Äì Downtown, Toronto

Contract role




Typical Day in Role:

‚Ä¢ Experience working in data management and can provide hands-on support on the implementation according to Data Office playbooks, guidelines, standards, and policies (e.g., documenting initiatives, use cases, data tiering and classification, critical data elements and business data elements)

‚Ä¢ Performs any necessary data mapping and data lineage activities and documents information flows to support specific business requirements

‚Ä¢ Performs data profiling, analyzes and communicates results in support of data quality processes

‚Ä¢ Builds the metadata model and business glossary by gathering information from multiple sources: business users, existing data sources, databases and other relevant documents and systems

‚Ä¢ Participates in knowledge transfer within the team, business units and provide recommendation opportunities to enhance productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency of the business unit and/or team

‚Ä¢ Monitors project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports and recommending actions.

‚Ä¢ Work in an Agile mindset to accelerate the delivery of the project

‚Ä¢ Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends

‚Ä¢ Assesses, researches, analyzes, and documents project needs and outcomes by selecting the appropriate information gathering and/or modelling technique to elicit requirements




Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:

‚Ä¢ 8+ years of experience working on business analysis processes, frameworks with documenting processes and data flows

‚Ä¢ 5+ Years of experience working with SQL.

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience working with data concepts (metadata, data mapping, data quality, data modeling, data governance)

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience working with agile project methodology

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience working with data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules.

‚Ä¢ Familiar with Data Management Tool such as Colibra or Talend or any other.




Nice-To-Have Skills:

‚Ä¢ Knowledge on Python

‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of data flows within a large enterprise.

‚Ä¢ Understanding of Cloud platforms and related data services knowledge (e.g., Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services)

Title: Employer Data Analyst
Description:
Employer Data Analyst (Pensions)

Client Services ‚Äì Employer Services & Data Management




The Ontario Pension Board (OPB) administers the Public Service Pension Plan (the PSPP), a major defined benefit pension plan sponsored by the Government of Ontario. With 100,000 members and $31 billion in assets, the PSPP is one of Canada‚Äôs largest pension plans. It is also one of the country‚Äôs oldest, successfully delivering the pension promise since the early 1920s. Learn more about OPB.




We have an exciting opportunity for an Employer Data Analyst who is client focused with strong analytical and problem-solving skills who can expertly reconcile employment history and financial data.




Key Responsibilities:




‚Ä¢ Analyze, investigate and complete corrections to all rejected transactions received from Employer interfaces.

‚Ä¢ Determine information/data needed to correct member‚Äôs records.

‚Ä¢ Validate information using detailed/practical knowledge of pension administration requirements, human resources policies and Employer‚Äôs payroll procedures.

‚Ä¢ Validate information for the enrolments received from the Employer Portal.

‚Ä¢ Validate corresponding contributions and ensure it is received in a timely manner.

‚Ä¢ Identify any discrepancies and work with Employers to resolve them; conduct follow-ups by phone and portal messages on a timely basis.

‚Ä¢ Resolve any data clean up identified by the automated processes for leaves, immediate pensions and pre-retirement termination cases.

‚Ä¢ Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal business partners and designated Employer contacts.

‚Ä¢ Provide on-going advocacy, information and education to Employers of our plan.

‚Ä¢ Follow established criteria to ensure the quality and integrity of the information used by Client Services, identify issues and trends, and make recommendations to improve efficiency and service.

‚Ä¢ Working within a team, aim to meet or exceed client service expectations and provide data management support as needed.




Key Qualifications:




‚Ä¢ Working knowledge with federal tax legislation, the Pension Benefits Act, Public Service Pension Plan Act and have a general understanding of the pensions industry.

‚Ä¢ Your background will include processing client transactions in accordance with established best practices/policies and explaining complex issues through a variety of channels.

‚Ä¢ You have strong knowledge and proficiency with MS Excel, Word and Outlook.

‚Ä¢ You have strong mathematical, analytical, and problem-solving skills and initiative.

‚Ä¢ You are someone with excellent time management, strong communication, and interpersonal skills that embrace teamwork with the ability to meet established timelines and to process large volumes of detailed information with minimal errors.

‚Ä¢ You are self-directed but recognize the importance of relationship building with your team as well as with those across the organization.







Please submit your resume if you are interested in this exciting opportunity. The competition will remain open until a successful candidate is selected or until the competition is closed.




This competition is open to all employees of OPB and has been posted on LinkedIn. OPB is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities in its recruitment process. Please advise OPB if you require an accommodation, and we will work with you to meet your needs. OPB is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity and inclusiveness that reflects the diverse communities we serve. We welcome and encourage applications from those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. Candidates being considered for this position will be required to submit to a background screening. We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company: CGL

Department: IT

Employment Type: Regular Full-Time

Work Model: Hybrid

Language: This role operates in English.

The Opportunity

We are a leading Canadian financial services Co-operative committed to being a catalyst for a sustainable and resilient society and our team is essential to deliver on this strategy. That‚Äôs why we prioritize our people, to ensure we provide a strong culture and development opportunities which enables our team to thrive and to live our purpose. The best part is that you will work with people that care passionately about you, our clients, and our communities.

Our Information Technology team aspires to be a leader in applying technology to power business strategies. We connect concepts with solutions to create value and efficiencies for our clients, employees, and communities. Our success is driven by our skilled and diverse team

As the Data Analyst, you will design and implement the data related-elements of technology solutions, including data models, physical database designs, and meta-data management. You will analyze abstract, complex problems and effectively communicate with the business and Information Technology (IT) regarding data design, usage, and management to provide project and operations support. You will focus on business intelligence solutions and provide input into the strategic elements of an overall Enterprise Data Management (EDM) strategy.

How You Will Create Impact


Building logical and physical data models and collaborating with business partners to meet data requirements.
Validating data flow through implemented data models from source to target and ensuring all data requirements are delivered.
Performing root cause analysis to determine cause of data defects and recommending solutions for resolution.
Collaborating with the Senior Manager to create, maintain, and manage meta-data for an entity.
Capturing and documenting business definitions and terms using the appropriate tools and methods.
Contributing to the development and maintenance of the enterprise architecture for information and data, and EDM strategy.



How You Will Succeed


You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
You use critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions and proactively propose solutions.
You have strong communication skills to clearly convey messages and explore diverse points of view.‚ÄØ
You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of colleagues.



To Join Our Team


You have three years of experience working in database systems or a related field, and have significant experience in complex relational data modeling, database design, database platforms, and modeling tools.
You have a post-secondary degree in Commerce, Information Technology or Computer Science.
You have working knowledge of Extract, Transform and Loading (ETL) processes, as well as data warehouse and data mart principles and best practices.
Having dimensional data modelling experience is an asset.
Data visualization is an asset.



What You Need To Know


You will be subject to a Background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate.



What‚Äôs in it for you?


Training and development opportunities to grow your career.
Flexible work options and paid time off to support your personal and family needs.
A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture.
Paid volunteer days to give back to your community.
In addition to our competitive salary and incentive programs, eligible employees also benefit from a comprehensive total rewards package including group retirement savings plans, pension and benefits (e.g., health and wellness, dental, disability and life coverage), mental health support and an employee assistance program.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission is to provide a secure, valuable, and sustainable workplace retirement solutions for Canadians. At CAAT, we live our values of integrity, impact, and teamwork every day.




The Senior Data Analyst is integral to the success of the Business Development Research & Data team, and to CAAT‚Äôs guiding mission and growth strategy.




This role‚Äôs primary focus will be data management and reporting to assist the Pension Solutions team in proactively managing relationships with external organizations and reporting on activities. The role provides additional support in performing research and documenting processes as required.




The role works closely with the Manager, Business Development Research & Data and guides the team‚Äôs other analysts and co-op students in a fast-paced environment with concurrent deliverables.




We are looking for someone with:

A degree or diploma in data management, data analytics, statistics, or a related field.
At least five (5) years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the pension or finance sectors.
Experience with Salesforce and either holding or working towards Salesforce certification.
Proven ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently, set priorities, and oversee team projects independently.
Familiarity with CRM tools and/or Power BI is a plus.
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced Excel skills.
A knack for innovative thinking and problem-solving.
Knowledge of pension plans, group benefits, or labor relations is advantageous.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.




The successful candidate will demonstrate:

Excellent organizational skills with a proactive and solution-oriented approach to task and project management.
Effective communication and training skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
A strategic mindset and resourcefulness in addressing challenges and improving processes.
Dedication to CAAT‚Äôs values and organizational culture, including integrity, teamwork, respect, and optimism.




Once here you will:

Guide the team in maintaining, processing, and analyzing stakeholder data, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail.
Train and support new team members and internal stakeholders on tools and processes, providing clear documentation and updates.
Analyze and report on key performance indicators to support strategic initiatives and inform decision-making.
Investigate and implement improvements in Salesforce, working with relevant teams to develop and test new features.
Develop and apply best practices to enhance department efficiency and effectiveness, contributing to process improvements.
Coordinate with internal teams on various projects, initiatives, and training efforts, ensuring effective communication and documentation.
Review and provide feedback on the work of data analysts and co-op students, ensuring high-quality outputs.
Conduct research to address data gaps and support organizational needs, contributing to a comprehensive understanding of data requirements.




Step into CAAT - where your work is both rewarding and meaningful, growth is a constant, fun is the way we roll, and your impact is real! If you meet most of the criteria above, we would love to connect with you.




Our commitment to you as a CAATster:




We‚Äôre about growing together and creating impact in a collaborative and caring environment!




Comprehensive & Holistic Care: Your dedication deserves appreciation! At CAAT, we celebrate the complete you, prioritizing your well-being above all. Our all-encompassing employee programs are designed to cater to every aspect of your life and well-being, ensuring you feel cherished and valued. We provide a competitive Total Rewards program based around your physical, mental, and financial wellness. This includes, but is not limited to, your compensation, paid time off, health and dental benefits, wellness programs, wellness incentives, and (of course) a defined benefit pension plan.




Growth Opportunities: Embrace a vibrant, ever-evolving environment at CAAT, where growth is not just a goal, but our way of life! We're expanding and transforming constantly, which means endless opportunities for you to adapt, innovate, and learn. As we grow, so do you. Let‚Äôs make a difference together!




A Culture of Collaboration and Fun: We're a team that works, grows, and celebrates together. At CAAT, you belong to a collaborative, inclusive and lively environment that sparks creativity and fosters open communication.




Making a Difference, Together: We're on a mission to secure a better future for Canadians. Your meaningful contributions go beyond the workplace, touching lives and making a significant societal impact. Work that truly counts!




But don't just take our word for it! We‚Äôve consistently been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers, and one of the Best Places to Work.

Learn more about us by visiting www.caatpension.ca/careers

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging:

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) at CAAT means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities, backgrounds, and perspectives as key elements of our culture. Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their best, professional, authentic, selves to work.




CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer, and we will accommodate any needs under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000for assistance.

HTML:
Our mission is to provide a secure, valuable, and sustainable workplace retirement solutions for Canadians. At CAAT, we live our values of integrity, impact, and teamwork every day.


The Senior Data Analyst is integral to the success of the Business Development Research & Data team, and to CAAT‚Äôs guiding mission and growth strategy.


This role‚Äôs primary focus will be data management and reporting to assist the Pension Solutions team in proactively managing relationships with external organizations and reporting on activities. The role provides additional support in performing research and documenting processes as required.


The role works closely with the Manager, Business Development Research & Data and guides the team‚Äôs other analysts and co-op students in a fast-paced environment with concurrent deliverables.


We are looking for someone with:

  • A degree or diploma in data management, data analytics, statistics, or a related field.
  • At least five (5) years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the pension or finance sectors.
  • Experience with Salesforce and either holding or working towards Salesforce certification.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently, set priorities, and oversee team projects independently.
  • Familiarity with CRM tools and/or Power BI is a plus.
  • Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced Excel skills.
  • A knack for innovative thinking and problem-solving.
  • Knowledge of pension plans, group benefits, or labor relations is advantageous.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.


The successful candidate will demonstrate:

  • Excellent organizational skills with a proactive and solution-oriented approach to task and project management.
  • Effective communication and training skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
  • A strategic mindset and resourcefulness in addressing challenges and improving processes.
  • Dedication to CAAT‚Äôs values and organizational culture, including integrity, teamwork, respect, and optimism.


Once here you will:

  • Guide the team in maintaining, processing, and analyzing stakeholder data, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Train and support new team members and internal stakeholders on tools and processes, providing clear documentation and updates.
  • Analyze and report on key performance indicators to support strategic initiatives and inform decision-making.
  • Investigate and implement improvements in Salesforce, working with relevant teams to develop and test new features.
  • Develop and apply best practices to enhance department efficiency and effectiveness, contributing to process improvements.
  • Coordinate with internal teams on various projects, initiatives, and training efforts, ensuring effective communication and documentation.
  • Review and provide feedback on the work of data analysts and co-op students, ensuring high-quality outputs.
  • Conduct research to address data gaps and support organizational needs, contributing to a comprehensive understanding of data requirements.


Step into CAAT - where your work is both rewarding and meaningful, growth is a constant, fun is the way we roll, and your impact is real! If you meet most of the criteria above, we would love to connect with you.


Our commitment to you as a CAATster:


We‚Äôre about growing together and creating impact in a collaborative and caring environment!


Comprehensive & Holistic Care: Your dedication deserves appreciation! At CAAT, we celebrate the complete you, prioritizing your well-being above all. Our all-encompassing employee programs are designed to cater to every aspect of your life and well-being, ensuring you feel cherished and valued. We provide a competitive Total Rewards program based around your physical, mental, and financial wellness. This includes, but is not limited to, your compensation, paid time off, health and dental benefits, wellness programs, wellness incentives, and (of course) a defined benefit pension plan.


Growth Opportunities: Embrace a vibrant, ever-evolving environment at CAAT, where growth is not just a goal, but our way of life! We're expanding and transforming constantly, which means endless opportunities for you to adapt, innovate, and learn. As we grow, so do you. Let‚Äôs make a difference together!


A Culture of Collaboration and Fun: We're a team that works, grows, and celebrates together. At CAAT, you belong to a collaborative, inclusive and lively environment that sparks creativity and fosters open communication.


Making a Difference, Together: We're on a mission to secure a better future for Canadians. Your meaningful contributions go beyond the workplace, touching lives and making a significant societal impact. Work that truly counts!


But don't just take our word for it! We‚Äôve consistently been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers, and one of the Best Places to Work.

Learn more about us by visiting www.caatpension.ca/careers

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging:

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) at CAAT means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities, backgrounds, and perspectives as key elements of our culture. Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their best, professional, authentic, selves to work.


CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer, and we will accommodate any needs under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000for assistance.

Title: Canada - Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst looking for a new opportunity?

Are you looking for a new contract opportunity?

We are pleased to offer you a new contract opportunity for you to consider: Data Analyst


Start: ASAP
Estimated length: 6 months
Location: Mississauga
Onsite role


Actively seeking for candidates with below requirements.

Advantages

You will have an opportunity to work with a leading employer in the local market.

Responsibilities


Coordinate data conversations with stakeholders, data sources
Explore and analyze complex datasets to identify patterns and anomalies (SQL, Python)
Develop and deploy machine learning models
Work with business to understand logic
Lead data analytics process with the product team to gather insights and identify solutions
Collect, organize, analyze, and present insights.
Organize project steps and document questions, findings, processes (confluence, JIRA)


Qualifications


Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related technical field
2+ years of experience as a data analyst
Experience with SQL, Python, Confluence, Jira
Strong communication skills
Must be able to work effectively both on teams as well as be self-motivated, task oriented and organized.
Strong customer focus and obsession with quality
Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment
Ability to gather & document details / requirements /user stories from stakeholders for a data request
Able to identify source systems and data steward
Able to write and run SQL queries from Data Lake, Big Query, and Vendor Master as required
Validate query results to ensure it meets criteria/requirements
Stakeholder management
Experienced in JIRA , scrum ceremonies, and Agile Methodology
Strong SQL skills and experience working with large datasets
Familiarity with anomaly detection and a variety of ML models and algorithms
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Curiosity and a passion for exploring and understanding complex datasets,As an integral member of our organization, the Data Analyst will work with a team of Data Scientists, Product management and Business teams to collect project requirements, identify data, build queries, develop ML models and present findings.


Summary

Do you have this experience? If you answer YES, then please apply IMMEDIATELY to so we can then discuss your experience and interest in this opportunity!

Randstad Technologies Group

Canada's largest provider of IT Staffing Solutions, offering hundreds of permanent and contract opportunities across all roles, levels and platforms. Our Web-based tools help you see and apply for jobs matched automatically to your skills and preferences. When you're ready to interview we meet with you in person to help you build the technology career path you've always wanted. Visit www.randstad.ca to get started!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

Title: Data Analyst - Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative
Description:
Specialisterne is Recruiting!

Specialisterne connects qualified neurodivergent candidates to employment opportunities in numerous industries and sectors in Canada and the US.

To be eligible to apply, you must have experienced barriers getting and/ or maintaining meaningful employment and you identify with one of the following:


Autism (including Asperger‚Äôs and PDD-NOS)
Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) or Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD)
Learning Disability (e.g., dyslexia, dyscalculia, dysgraphia)
Intellectual Disability
Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
Tourette Syndrome


Employees hired through Specialisterne will be supported by a Specialisterne Workplace Support Specialist for their first twelve weeks on the job.

Specialisterne is proud to partner with CIBC on a Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative.

CIBC is a leading North American financial institution. From Personal, Business and Commercial Banking to Wealth Management and Capital Markets businesses, their 44,000 employees provide a full range of financial products and services to 10 million clients in Canada, the United States and around the world.

CIBC places a high value on diversity in its workforce, recognizes the business benefits that accrue from responding to challenges from multiple perspectives, and is exercising a leadership position in the hiring of people with disabilities.

Applications must be submitted in full no later than September 3rd, 2024

Summary:

Title: Data Analyst

Employment Type: Full-Time

Hours: 8:30am-5pm

Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid, in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday)

Target Start Date: September 2024

About this Role:

You will be joining CIBC‚Äôs Optimization and Process Engineering team and be at the centre of an innovative team that develops process improvements to make the bank more efficient. As a Data Analyst you will be involved in supporting the Process Engineering and Optimization team in the identification and implementation of process improvements to enhance client experience, reduce risk and increase profitability. You will use direct client feedback as well as analysis of system data to understand the challenges of the business, improve the quality of key processes, eliminate redundant tasks and make our bank more efficient. You will work with your team to assist in opportunity identification and solution development in order to bring the bank into the future.

Essential Tasks - In this job, you will:


Support ongoing process reviews to identify issues early on and recommend solutions to business challenges
Stay on top of best practices and industry knowledge to identify process improvements that will create a best-in-class client experience
Enter and manipulate data in order to prepare it for manual or automated analysis
Learn how to utilize tools such as Excel and Alteryx to swiftly cleanse data for use in automated tools such as Blue Prism
You will support the optimization team through review and summary of large data sets in order to identify areas of opportunity for the optimization team
You will develop static data visualizations based on your analysis to summarize insights to highlight key findings for inclusion in presentations


General Skills and Abilities:


Attention to detail and critical thinking skills
Willingness to learn and adapt new processes
Effective written and visual communication skills
Goal oriented
Ability to work in a team environment
Communication and conflict resolution


Digital/Technical Skills & Tools - You are:


Intermediate skill level with Microsoft Excel
Intermediate skill level with SQL
Intermediate skill level with Python or R
Basic skill level with Tableau or Power BI
Statistical and Database Knowledge


Required skill level*


Basic - e.g., I can do this in simple situations with close or extensive guidance
Basic to Intermediate
Intermediate - e.g., I can do this in most situations, with occasional guidance
Intermediate to expert
Expert - e.g., I can do this in exceptionally difficult situations with no guidance and I can be a key resource for others


Education/Knowledge - You:


Bachelors degree in either Computer Science, Statistics, Information Security, Business or Engineering
Nice to have (but not required):
PMP Certification work in project based environments

Experience (Professional, Academic, Personal) - You:


Nice to have (but not required):
Work experience in data analytics

Additional Information:

Here‚Äôs how frequently the following types of communication and interaction are required to perform the job:


Oral communication: Daily
Email communication: Daily
Instant messaging: Daily
Telephone Communication: Daily
Video communication: Daily (Camera encouraged but optional)
Interacting with supervisors: Daily
Interacting with peers: Daily
Interacting with customers: Weekly
Selling or influencing others: Weekly
Training or teaching others: N/A


Here‚Äôs what can employees find stressful about this job:


Meeting short deadlines and being asked to turn around findings within a reduced period of time


Here‚Äôs what employees tend to find motivating/rewarding about this job:


Using data to provide clarity to our supporting partners to help make informed decisions


Workplace Support:


Specialisterne and our employer partners are committed to providing inclusive onboarding experiences and supporting new employees as they learn on the job
All new hires continue to liaise with a Specialisterne Workplace Support Specialist for their first twelve weeks on the job


The Recruitment Process

To be considered for this position, you will:


Complete a job application
Join our talent pool (if you haven‚Äôt already) by completing an additional questionnaire and a pre-employment assessment


Next Steps


Successful applicants will create a job-specific Candidate Profile to answer job specific questions and/or complete a work sample exercise to showcase your skills for this role
Employers use Candidate Profiles to anonymously* shortlist candidates
Candidates and employers will meet to discuss the role in more detail
whenever possible

other duties as required.

Title: Admin & Data Analyst
Description:
Aventas is a sales and marketing company located in Etobicoke, ON. Our mission is to help brands unleash their unique point of view and share it with the world in a way that builds lasting relationships with customers. We believe that building relationships is the most effective marketing strategy, and we strive to stay ahead of the constantly changing marketing landscape.




The ideal candidate will be someone who is a motivated self-starter, who wants to grow their career in data/administration.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for a Data Analyst and Admin at Aventas. The Data Analyst and Admin will be responsible for conducting data analysis, implementing statistical models, and communicating insights to the team. They will also be responsible for data modeling and providing administrative support to the team.




20$/Hour during 90 day probationary period
$45k Salary + Bonuses after probationary period
Quarterly incentives
Opportunities to grow into management roles
Travel opportunities - if qualified (Mexico in Oct, Bahamas in Nov)




Take a look at us on our website or social media!




Responsibilities

Manage CRM
Understand and utilize different systems to construct and visualize data
Coordinating between different departments
Onboarding new hires
Data entry
Completing background checks
Administrative tasks
Assist in Payroll
Manage supplies
Assist in day-to-day operations of the office
Joining calls to learn and develop themselves in the roll




HAVE FUN while doing the above !




Desired Skills and Experience

Must be extremely organized !
Strong interpersonal skills, outstanding work ethic
impressive and professional image and demeanor
Intermediate/Advanced MS Excel skills
Participate in extra-curricular team events (company paid for)
Self-starter who is career driven




Priority will be given to candidates who have the following:

Bachelor's degree in relevant field
Customer service/sales experience
Other complimentary skills such as but not exclusive to: Event planning, Website development, HR, Recruiting.




Before applying check us out online to see what our culture is like !




www.aventasinc.ca

www.instagram.com/aventasinc




If you are an ambitious and driven individual who is willing to learn and grow with the company long term, please reply to this ad with a copy of your most recent resume.




Local candidates only. International candidates who reside out of the country will not be contacted. Please refrain from applying if you do not meet all of the mandatory qualifications. Due to a large volume of responses, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Title: Manufacturing Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Litens?

We are a diverse group of talented people committed to creating solutions to problems and making the world a better place. We enhance and deliver both mechanical and electrified solutions that bring efficiency and sustainability to new heights. Founded in 1979, Litens has a proud history of being an innovative and highly respected company specializing in powertrain system engineering and component supply. Our history includes numerous achievements, many of which have been recognized through prestigious awards from our customers.

Experience a fulfilling and supportive environment where ingenuity is rewarded, collaboration is encouraged, and opportunities are readily available.




Why Join Litens?

Join the Litens Manufacturing Operations Team as a Manufacturing Improvement Analyst. At Litens, you can make an impact. We‚Äôve purposefully cultivated a supportive and flexible environment that gives everyone the opportunity to succeed. Litens offers a competitive and people-first approach to compensation and benefits, and we are committed to provide balanced employment and advancement opportunities for everyone.

Our diversity is our source of strength. At Litens, we are committed to equal employment opportunity, and we value and welcome diversity. We respect employees‚Äô rights for a safe and respectful workplace. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.




What will you do?

Gather and diagnose historical Manufacturing data from various sources related to Process, Materials, Labour, or Overhead and present opportunities for improvement.
Maintain status of labour, NVA, and scrap costs for monthly reconciliation with accounting
Monitor Shoplogix MES data and work with Business Systems/IT/Production to maintain accuracy and integrity
Balance support towards evaluation, research, and analysis between shop floor and office processes
Benchmark current business practices against World Class processes and present opportunities to management for improvement
Monitor Work Center performance to expected standards and communicate any variances to production leadership and Lean Manager
Participate and support CI related activities (kaizen, VSM, Materials PFEP, CI projects) by supplying performance data and hands on practical assistance.
Leverage your expert Excel skills for analysis of Manufacturing Operations data and potential improvement
Provides performance data for bench marking exercises within Litens global facilities.
Manage and maintain annual changes to Litens Production System Assessment (LPSA)
Work with Maintenance and Setup teams and leaders to facilitate administrative machine related Preventative Maintenance improvements




What will you bring?

University degree in Business or Engineering
4 years automotive/manufacturing experience
Proven ability to navigate, gather and analyze data through various business systems such as MS D365 Finance and Operations, and others, with a high degree of competence
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, intermediate skills with Word and Power Point
Proven ability to diagnose manufacturing data for the purpose of identifying and quantifying business opportunities and propose alternative improvement solutions
Requirement to maintain confidentiality is critical to this role
Experience with Lean Manufacturing principles and concepts
Flexible to work between local plants if necessary

Who is Litens?

We are a diverse group of talented people committed to creating solutions to problems and making the world a better place. We enhance and deliver both mechanical and electrified solutions that bring efficiency and sustainability to new heights. Founded in 1979, Litens has a proud history of being an innovative and highly respected company specializing in powertrain system engineering and component supply. Our history includes numerous achievements, many of which have been recognized through prestigious awards from our customers.

Experience a fulfilling and supportive environment where ingenuity is rewarded, collaboration is encouraged, and opportunities are readily available.


Why Join Litens?

Join the Litens Manufacturing Operations Team as a Manufacturing Improvement Analyst. At Litens, you can make an impact. We‚Äôve purposefully cultivated a supportive and flexible environment that gives everyone the opportunity to succeed. Litens offers a competitive and people-first approach to compensation and benefits, and we are committed to provide balanced employment and advancement opportunities for everyone.

Our diversity is our source of strength. At Litens, we are committed to equal employment opportunity, and we value and welcome diversity. We respect employees‚Äô rights for a safe and respectful workplace. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.


What will you do?

  • Gather and diagnose historical Manufacturing data from various sources related to Process, Materials, Labour, or Overhead and present opportunities for improvement.

  • Balance support towards evaluation, research, and analysis between shop floor and office processes

  • Provides performance data for bench marking exercises within Litens global facilities.

  • Work with Maintenance and Setup teams and leaders to facilitate administrative machine related Preventative Maintenance improvements

  • Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, intermediate skills with Word and Power Point
  • Proven ability to diagnose manufacturing data for the purpose of identifying and quantifying business opportunities and propose alternative improvement solutions
  • Requirement to maintain confidentiality is critical to this role

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Location Address: Hybrid (minimum once a week) ‚Äì 44 King Street W 23rd Floor

Contract Duration: ASAP until October 31, 2024

Extension Opportunity: Yes

Scheduled Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:30 am-5 pm




Story Behind the Need:

The Data Analyst, Data Remediation Audit Program contributes to the overall success of the Group Treasury Data Office in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans and initiatives are executed/delivered in support of the team‚Äôs business strategies and objectives.




The main function of the Data Analyst role is to support the investigation, development, testing and operationalization of data solutions related to the strategic goals of the Group Treasury Data Office. This role ensures all activities are conducted in compliance with enterprise data standards, policies and procedures. This project entails a three-year road map from 2024 to 2026, an extension opportunity is available for the candidates.




Candidate Value Proposition:

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work within the Bank. We are data partners that support technology and business around the world. You will get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology.




Typical Day in Role:

Support the Senior Manager on strategic data and innovation initiatives, presentations, and analysis with executive-level visibility for the Treasury Management team.
Experience working in data management and can provide hands-on support on the implementation according to Data Office playbooks, guidelines, standards, and policies (e.g., documenting initiatives, use cases, data tiering and classification, critical data elements, and business data elements).
Performs necessary data mapping and lineage activities and documents information flows to support specific business requirements.
Performs data quality rule creation, and analyzes and communicates results supporting data quality processes.
Builds the metadata model and business glossary by gathering information from multiple sources: business users, existing data sources, databases and other relevant documents and systems.




Candidate Requirements/Must-Have Skills:

1. 10+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst with a strong understanding of data concepts (metadata, data mapping, data quality, data modeling, data governance).

2. Hands-on experience working within Data Management and Operations, including proficiency in Data Management Tools (Collibra and IGC preferred) and understanding of data flows within a large enterprise.

3. Working knowledge of Data Management framework and can trace data elements at origination and as they move between systems including any transformations.

4. Working knowledge of data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules using IGC (Information Governance Console) and universal catalogue.

5. Hands-on experience with developing dashboards in PowerBI and Tableau.




Nice-To-Have Skills:

Strong business acumen, data analysis, metadata documentation, and data quality controls skills specifically with respect to analyzing business process controls, sourcing, and provisioning of lineage, identifying data quality issues and proposing remediation steps.
Understanding of Bank‚Äôs systems i.e. ALM6, IGC, GC.
Demonstrated ability to provide evidence to 2nd and 3rd line.
Understanding or experience with Treasury.
Cloud platforms and related data services knowledge (e.g., Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services).




Best vs. Average Candidate:

An average candidate will only have experience with data governance, whereas the ideal candidate will have expertise in both data governance and data analytics.
Extensive experience with Power BI and Tableau.
Detail-oriented and ability to work independently.




Education:

Strong technical education background, majoring in fields that require a high degree of analytical skills, such as Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, Statistics, Accounting or related field.

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM!

At Circle K, our mission is simple: to make our customer‚Äôs lives a little easier everyday. You may have already stopped for coffee, refueling your car, or eating something on the go. Then, you know what Couche-Tard/Circle K is. We have grown into a successful global company with over 16,000 stores in 29 countries, serving almost 9 million customers every day. In total, more than 150,000 people work in our stores and offices. We make journeys easier by offering fast and friendly service. We care about our people and our communities, and we look for ways to uplift people first. Wherever your journey‚Äôs going, we can help you get there.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Are you ready to grow your career? Let's grow together!

Associate Data Scientist

_________________________________________________________________________________

Department: Global Data & Analytics

Location: Toronto, ON (305 Milner Ave, Suite 400, M1B 3V4)

Hybrid work: 3 days at the office and 2 days remotely

Type of employment: Permanent, Full Time (40 hours)

_________________________________________________________________________________

THE ROLE

As a member of the Enterprise Data & Analytics Team, the Data Scientist is an everyday partner with multiple departments, including Global Marketing, Category Management, Shared Services & Finance, Global Technology, and Business Unit Leadership. This is a unique opportunity to work on a new, growing team within a large organization.

The Data Scientist is responsible for delivering advanced analytics projects that drive business results. The ideal candidate should possess the ability to contribute to all aspects of project work, including interpreting business questions and desired outcomes, selecting the appropriate methodology, data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, model building, and creation of polished deliverables that are suitable for internal and external presentation.

We are looking for an individual who is a proven problem solver with exceptional critical thinking ability. The candidate should have a high sense of curiosity and be comfortable with ambiguity when faced with a difficult challenge. Additionally, the candidate should possess the abilities to collaborate with others and simply and effectively communicate complex concepts with a non-technical audience.

What You‚Äôll Do

Excited to embark on a journey with us? Here's a breakdown of the key responsibilities in this role:


Develop advanced analytics and predictive models from design through implementation in the areas of pricing and promotion, marketing, merchandising, and other areas of the business as needed
Participate in the research of analytical methods to find or advance solutions to business problems
Clearly and concisely explain complex analytical findings to non-analytical peers and business leaders
Create analytic datasets in collaboration with data engineering teams that involves data querying, cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering. Define requirements and test cases for Data validation and monitoring
Author programming code (e.g., SQL, Python, R, spark) to assemble and analyze data, following/establishing/enhancing organizational standards and coding practices including code management (i.e. Documentation, use of Git Hub). Lead and participate in peer code reviews for QA/QC/standards compliance.
Train/Mentor other team members, provide developmental support where necessary
Follow defined project management processes. Actively participate in project plan development and agile ceremonies (development of backlog, sprint planning, daily standups, retros/reviews) and documentation.


What You‚Äôll Need

We want you to join our team! Here's what we're looking for:

Knowledge And Skills


Demonstrated knowledge of SQL, R and Python;
Experience querying large datasets using SparkSQL or PySpark;
Experience with ML frameworks such as scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch, etc.;
Exposure with software development practices, object-oriented principles and test automation;
Exposure to version control systems such as Git ‚Äì experience preferred
Experience with cloud-based analytics environments (Azure, AWS or GCP);
Experience applying operational research, statistical and machine learning techniques such as regression, time series forecasting, clustering, optimization, etc.;
Exposure to agile methodologies using project planning and tracking management tools e.g., JIRA; experience preferred
Strong problem-solving skills including problem spotting and problem scoping;
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate the business benefits of analytics;
Availability to travel up to 10% of the time


Education


Bachelor‚Äôs degree required, preferably with a quantitative focus (Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Math, Economics, etc.)
Master‚Äôs degree preferred
Internships / experience in data science or related roles preferred
Masters degree / Bachelors + internship experience in a data science/advanced analytics role, or demonstrated ability to perform job functions via academic project/internship experience


Why You Should Work Here

At Couche-Tard/Circle K, we believe that our team members are the heart and soul of our business. When you join us, you're not just getting a job ‚Äì you're becoming part of a vibrant community where your talents are valued, your growth is nurtured, and your contributions make a real difference. Here's why you'll love working with us:

Benefits Package


Group Insurance Program: Stay healthy and happy! Our plan provides you with the flexibility to choose coverage that best meets your needs and add optional insurance (health and dental care, long-term disability, life insurance, health spending account)
Pension Plan: Plan for your future and retire with peace of mind with our pension plan, helping you build a secure financial future.
Share Purchase Plan: Invest in your future and share in our success with our employee stock purchase plan, allowing you to become a shareholder of Circle K.
Paid Time Off: Recharge and rejuvenate with paid time off, including vacation days, sick days, and personal days to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.


Additional Perks


Training and Development: Grow your skills and advance your career with access to ongoing training and development opportunities, including workshops, seminars, and online courses.
Recognition and Rewards: We celebrate our team's achievements and milestones with a range of recognition programs, rewards, and incentives to show our appreciation for your hard work and dedication.
Mentorship Program: Take your career to new heights with our mentorship program, where seasoned professionals provide guidance, support, and valuable insights to help you reach your full potential.
Scholarship Program: Invest in your education and future success with our scholarship program, available not only to our employees but also to their children. We're committed to supporting your lifelong learning journey and empowering you to achieve your academic and career goals.


INTERESTED? You are only a few clicks away from joining an exceptional company! Visit our careers page at https://workwithus.circlek.com/ca/en to submit your application. We can't wait to hear from you!

At Circle K, we're committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is treated with respect and dignity. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life to join our team and contribute their unique perspectives and talents.

We thank all candidates for their interest in this position. Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted for further steps in the hiring process.

Circle K values diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from the following designated groups: women, aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
About TCS:




TCS operates on a global scale, with a diverse talent base of more than 600,000 associates representing 153 nationalities across 55 countries. TCS has been recognized as a Global Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute - one of only eight companies worldwide to have achieved this status. Our organizational structure is domain-led and designed to offer businesses a single window into industry-specific solutions. Our agile industry units have embedded capabilities to enable rapid responses that provide a competitive edge to our customers. This, coupled with a unique Global Network Delivery Model‚Ñ¢ (GNDM‚Ñ¢), is recognized as the current benchmark of excellence in technology deployment. We have made significant investments in digital technology, horizontal, and vertical platforms, allowing us to successfully serve our clients for over 50 years.




Skills and Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢Understanding of data governance principles.

‚Ä¢Attention to detail.

‚Ä¢Time management

‚Ä¢Handling ambiguous information.

‚Ä¢Analyzing and problem solving,

‚Ä¢Metadata analysis and tagging, workflows, connectors, data vocabulary/business glossary

‚Ä¢Microsoft products excel, Purview and using minimal SQL coding via Databricks to assist with developing regular expressions.

‚Ä¢Utilizing Collibra or other data governance toolset

‚Ä¢Presentation skills and ability to communicate technical details to a business user

‚Ä¢Monitoring and testing functionalities and environments

‚Ä¢Data governance and stewardship experience

‚Ä¢Data controls and risk

‚Ä¢Knowledge and experience in data cataloging using Collibra and Purview

‚Ä¢Reporting skills and monitoring, vision diagrams, etc.

‚Ä¢Writing skills for procedures, documentations, etc.

Roles and Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢Using Microsoft Purview Data Catalog Portal, work with the team to create a POC that aligns to the metadata strategy and establishing the cataloging/business glossary, tagging, metadata, necessary to meet the standard by working with the business stakeholders.

‚Ä¢Cataloging activities include reviewing applied classifications to a data element within Purview Data Catalog, applies sensitivity labels to a data element or data asset to adhere to Canada Life

‚Ä¢Data Policy, Information classification and handling standard, and Privacy guidelines. Align the data elements to Canada Life

‚Ä¢Information Model for personal information. o Expansion of business glossary in publication

‚Ä¢Tagging Sensitivity levels as applicable Privacy guidelines, (example, Personal information sensitivity) Data classification as applicable by Information Data elements criticality

‚Ä¢Metadata Technical metadata Business metadata Operational metadata Deliverables: Project support.

‚Ä¢Initiatives to support: Project supporting data migration: CDP across CL Lobs. Data Governance Controls documentation, reporting, process improvement. CDP work from Metadata PoC. New team to support operations new AU work). The current team is currently assigned to a project (process control etc.). The new team must support data access, data controls, consultation etc.




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resource.




Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Junior HDO Data Engineer
Description:
Hi,

Hope you are doing Great!!!

This side Priya Rajput from Zortech Solutions trying to reach you for an exciting job opening, kindly have a look to job description and revert me with your positive feedback. My mail ID is priya@zortechsolutions.ca or call me on +1 (437) 370-7612.

Role: Junior HDO Data Engineer

Location: Toronto, ON-Need to go to the office when asked.

Duration: 6-12+ Months Contract

Note: Position: team members based in Toronto? We may have to call them into the office for the interview.

Job Description

However, this candidate needs to be able to read and write in French; speaking Spanish would be a bonus.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize quick win opportunities for


data-driven insights and improvements.


Design, develop, and maintain ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from

Title: Junior Analytics Developer
Description:
VERB is a digital marketing and technology agency located in downtown Halifax, Nova Scotia. Our global clients offer the opportunity to work and collaborate with some of the world's biggest destinations, resorts, and travel brands‚Äîand with our employee travel credit, it's easy to experience them for yourself. We take a balanced approach to work/life and have fun at the office- or wherever we happen to be working. We are passionate about exceeding expectations and we thrive on jobs other agencies might find too big, or too difficult, or too fast

Sound good? Great, here's who we're looking for...

The Junior Analytics Developer supports the implementation of web tracking strategies for client websites, while supporting their team with ad hoc bug fixes.

What You Will Do


Set up complete analytics tracking (Page Data, eCommerce, UX) with Google Analytics
Work with DOM elements, dataLayer events and A/B testing platforms to monitor and track events
Communicate issues/ticket updates to Analytics team and other internal stakeholders
Integrate third-party APIs and libraries
Stay on top of maintenance and bug fixes for existing interactions in the browser, session, and DOM across various platforms (marketing, ecommerce, etc.)



Requirements


0-3 years of JavaScript experience with knowledge of concepts such as, asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES5/ES6
Post-secondary education with a focus in IT Web Programming, Computer Science, or equivalent experience
Knowledge of Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, DoubleClick for Publishers, Adobe Analytics is an asset
Knowledge of code versioning (Git) and CI/CD process
Up-to-date on current web trends and standards
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication
Highly organized with the ability to function in a fast-paced business environment



Benefits

Our benefits are anything but basic, with vacation time available on day one (not to mention an extra bonus week during the holidays), an annual travel credit (for non-work related travel), and free office snacks and drinks to keep you energized when you're around.

In addition, we offer the following and are consistently looking for new ways to enhance the benefits we offer to our team:


100% premium share option for Group Health Insurance (medical, dental, vision), with a health spending account to top up your claims
A wellness spending account
Company matching RRSP program
Top up for Parental/Pregnancy leave
Remote and flexible work arrangements
Transit and fitness discounts
Recreational sports teams
Learning and development opportunities with a multitude of resources
Internal recognition programs
Show more

Title: Data Insights Analyst
Description:
Work location:

Home Office 1303 Yonge St

City:

Toronto

What you will do:

Data Insights Analyst

Hybrid position working from the Cineplex corporate office at 1303 Yonge Street, Toronto (Yonge, south of St. Clair) 3 days per week.

The Data Insights Analyst will join the Data Science & Insights team that empowers the Cineplex organization to optimize and delight the customer experience with data-informed insights and capabilities.

The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in evolving Cineplex‚Äôs ability to extract and present actionable data insights to key stakeholders in order to better understand and improve the end-to-end customer experience across Cineplex‚Äôs digital and offline channels. The Analyst is responsible for collaborating with product and design teams to support their KPIs and dashboard requirements, and communicating actionable insights to key stakeholders in order to improve the customer experience.

Key Responsibilities:

Technical & Business Expertise


Provide analytical expertise of the customer and digital data ecosystem with a strong command of data analysis techniques and data collection processes
Develop and maintain user-friendly dashboards, scorecards, and presentations that clearly highlight the actionable insights and opportunities
Understand the ‚Äúbig picture‚Äù and how customer and market insights tie back to business priorities


Inspiring & Influencing


Be the subject matter expert to represent the customer data and digital analytics function on cross-functional product teams
Influence and use data insights to tell stories through distilling complex concepts into simple themes that are relevant to key stakeholders, teams, and executives


Teamwork & Collaboration


Collaborate closely with a variety of product development teams to define their business and data requirements to better understand the performance and effectiveness of various strategic priorities
Gather and prioritize net new data requests from key stakeholders to the data engineering and data science teams based on business value


Education and Certification:


Bachelor‚Äôs or equivalent degrees in economics, computer science, engineering, or similar fields with a quantitative focus


Experience Needed:


3-5 years‚Äô experience with building data models, querying/organizing large datasets, and visualizing data into dashboards (i.e. SQL/databases, Power BI, Tableau, Excel, etc.) is required.
3-5 years‚Äô experience working with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics is required.
3-5 years‚Äô experience with interpreting and presenting insights to a variety of stakeholders with varying data competencies, including executives
Experience with other Adobe products is considered an asset (i.e. Target, Launch, Experience Platform)


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


High proficiency in data storytelling and presentation, written, and verbal communication skills to executives and multiple stakeholder teams
Strong planning and organizational skills with the ability to perform effectively in an environment with many competing demands
Deep understanding of market research and analytics to ensure our analytics and insights practice is the gold standard in the industry
Familiar with agile methodology and practices
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Comfortable to challenge the status quo enabling effective decision making


Inclusion & Diversity

Cineplex, its subsidiaries, and affiliates are equal opportunity employers with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable.

Accessibility

We are committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit, or restrict their access to employment oporunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us at 416-323-6600 or via email at jobs@cineplex.com.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Tripstack

We are travel tech entrepreneurs, changing the way millions of people travel.

Our proprietary Virtual Interlining (VI) technology provides access to billions of travel itineraries by combining flights from different airline carriers that don't traditionally work together. We take our customers from destination A to B via C, at the lowest possible price. We are impacting the way people travel globally and provide higher margin opportunities to our partners that are some of the largest in the travel industry.

We pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we have created for our teams to prosper and excel in. We come to work ready, to challenge and be challenged. We're big enough to give our teams support but small enough that every person makes a difference. There are plenty of challenges to champion.

The role:

We're looking for a driven and self-starting Senior Data Analyst to join our Data team. You will contribute to our mission by leveraging analytics capabilities to improve visibility, identify opportunities for accelerating revenue growth and to drive efficiency. You will be a key member of a cross-functional Data team at Tripstack.

Requirements

Responsibilities:


Extract Insights from Large Data Sets: Analyze extensive datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business decisions and optimize operational performance
Market Trend Analysis: Conduct thorough analyses of market trends to identify emerging opportunities for business growth and competitive advantages
KPI Development and Monitoring: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and monitor both new and existing key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with organizational goals
Data-Driven Partnership Strategies: Work closely with business development teams to apply data-driven methodologies in establishing and enhancing strategic partnerships, ensuring alignment with business objectives
Support Design and Deployment of A/B Tests: Work closely with product and data science functions to design experiments around hypotheses and implement measurement and reporting pipelines
Mentor Junior Analysts: You will provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts in the team to help them develop their analytical skills and industry knowledge. Your responsibilities will include offering constructive feedback on their work, facilitating their professional growth through training and development opportunities, and ensuring they adhere to best practices and project requirements


Desired Skills and Experience:


5+ years of experience in data analytics in travel, tech or e-commerce
Bachelor's Degree in computer science, economics, mathematics, engineering or related discipline
Demonstrated ability to work with large datasets independently
Experience in building queries in SQL, automating reporting and building analytics ETL pipelines in PySpark or related languages
Experience programming in Python, R, or related languages
Experience building self service dashboards in Looker, Power BI or other BI tools
Proven interpersonal communication skills
Proven organizational skills and experience working independently
Demonstrated willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges


Nice to have:


2+ years experience with a Master's Degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or related discipline
Desire to learn and understand business concepts / new ideas
Knowledge of statistical techniques for experimentation & hypothesis testing, regression and statistical tests
Experience working effectively with data engineering and science teams



Benefits

What it takes to succeed here

Ambition and dedication to make a difference and change the way people travel; Where we always play to each other's strength in a high performing team reaching for our common goal. We hold ourselves to the highest expectations, and move with a sense of urgency and hold ourselves accountable and win by staying true to what we believe in.

Learn more about our values here

What we offer

We offer an opportunity to work with a young, dynamic, and a growing team composed of high-caliber professionals. We value professionalism and promote a culture where individuals are encouraged to do more and be more. If you feel you share our passion for excellence, and growth, then look no further. We have an ambitious mission, and we need a world-class team to make it a reality. Upgrade to a First Class team!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative
Description:
Specialisterne is Recruiting!

Specialisterne connects qualified neurodivergent candidates to employment opportunities in numerous industries and sectors in Canada and the US.

To be eligible to apply, you must have experienced barriers getting and/ or maintaining meaningful employment and you identify with one of the following:


Autism (including Asperger‚Äôs and PDD-NOS)
Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) or Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD)
Learning Disability (e.g., dyslexia, dyscalculia, dysgraphia)
Intellectual Disability
Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
Tourette Syndrome


Employees hired through Specialisterne will be supported by a Specialisterne Workplace Support Specialist for their first twelve weeks on the job.

Specialisterne is proud to partner with CIBC on a Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative.

CIBC is a leading North American financial institution. From Personal, Business and Commercial Banking to Wealth Management and Capital Markets businesses, their 44,000 employees provide a full range of financial products and services to 10 million clients in Canada, the United States and around the world.

CIBC places a high value on diversity in its workforce, recognizes the business benefits that accrue from responding to challenges from multiple perspectives, and is exercising a leadership position in the hiring of people with disabilities.

Applications must be submitted in full no later than September 3rd, 2024

Summary:

Title: Data Analyst

Employment Type: Full-Time

Hours: 8:30am-5pm

Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid, in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday)

Target Start Date: September 2024

About this Role:

You will be joining CIBC‚Äôs Optimization and Process Engineering team and be at the centre of an innovative team that develops process improvements to make the bank more efficient. As a Data Analyst you will be involved in supporting the Process Engineering and Optimization team in the identification and implementation of process improvements to enhance client experience, reduce risk and increase profitability. You will use direct client feedback as well as analysis of system data to understand the challenges of the business, improve the quality of key processes, eliminate redundant tasks and make our bank more efficient. You will work with your team to assist in opportunity identification and solution development in order to bring the bank into the future.

Essential Tasks - In this job, you will:


Support ongoing process reviews to identify issues early on and recommend solutions to business challenges
Stay on top of best practices and industry knowledge to identify process improvements that will create a best-in-class client experience
Enter and manipulate data in order to prepare it for manual or automated analysis
Learn how to utilize tools such as Excel and Alteryx to swiftly cleanse data for use in automated tools such as Blue Prism
You will support the optimization team through review and summary of large data sets in order to identify areas of opportunity for the optimization team
You will develop static data visualizations based on your analysis to summarize insights to highlight key findings for inclusion in presentations


General Skills and Abilities:


Attention to detail and critical thinking skills
Willingness to learn and adapt new processes
Effective written and visual communication skills
Goal oriented
Ability to work in a team environment
Communication and conflict resolution


Digital/Technical Skills & Tools - You are:


Intermediate skill level with Microsoft Excel
Intermediate skill level with SQL
Intermediate skill level with Python or R
Basic skill level with Tableau or Power BI
Statistical and Database Knowledge


Required skill level*


Basic - e.g., I can do this in simple situations with close or extensive guidance
Basic to Intermediate
Intermediate - e.g., I can do this in most situations, with occasional guidance
Intermediate to expert
Expert - e.g., I can do this in exceptionally difficult situations with no guidance and I can be a key resource for others


Education/Knowledge - You:


Bachelors degree in either Computer Science, Statistics, Information Security, Business or Engineering
Nice to have (but not required):
PMP Certification work in project based environments

Experience (Professional, Academic, Personal) - You:


Nice to have (but not required):
Work experience in data analytics

Additional Information:

Here‚Äôs how frequently the following types of communication and interaction are required to perform the job:


Oral communication: Daily
Email communication: Daily
Instant messaging: Daily
Telephone Communication: Daily
Video communication: Daily (Camera encouraged but optional)
Interacting with supervisors: Daily
Interacting with peers: Daily
Interacting with customers: Weekly
Selling or influencing others: Weekly
Training or teaching others: N/A


Here‚Äôs what can employees find stressful about this job:


Meeting short deadlines and being asked to turn around findings within a reduced period of time


Here‚Äôs what employees tend to find motivating/rewarding about this job:


Using data to provide clarity to our supporting partners to help make informed decisions


Workplace Support:


Specialisterne and our employer partners are committed to providing inclusive onboarding experiences and supporting new employees as they learn on the job
All new hires continue to liaise with a Specialisterne Workplace Support Specialist for their first twelve weeks on the job


The Recruitment Process

To be considered for this position, you will:


Complete a job application
Join our talent pool (if you haven‚Äôt already) by completing an additional questionnaire and a pre-employment assessment


Next Steps


Successful applicants will create a job-specific Candidate Profile to answer job specific questions and/or complete a work sample exercise to showcase your skills for this role
Employers use Candidate Profiles to anonymously* shortlist candidates
Candidates and employers will meet to discuss the role in more detail
whenever possible

Specialisterne is Recruiting!

Specialisterne connects qualified neurodivergent candidates to employment opportunities in numerous industries and sectors in Canada and the US.

To be eligible to apply, you must have experienced barriers getting and/ or maintaining meaningful employment and you identify with one of the following:

  • Autism (including Asperger‚Äôs and PDD-NOS)
  • Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) or Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD)
  • Learning Disability (e.g., dyslexia, dyscalculia, dysgraphia)
  • Intellectual Disability
  • Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
  • Tourette Syndrome

Employees hired through Specialisterne will be supported by a Specialisterne Workplace Support Specialist for their first twelve weeks on the job.

Specialisterne is proud to partner with CIBC on a Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative.

CIBC is a leading North American financial institution. From Personal, Business and Commercial Banking to Wealth Management and Capital Markets businesses, their 44,000 employees provide a full range of financial products and services to 10 million clients in Canada, the United States and around the world.

CIBC places a high value on diversity in its workforce, recognizes the business benefits that accrue from responding to challenges from multiple perspectives, and is exercising a leadership position in the hiring of people with disabilities.

Applications must be submitted in full no later than September 3rd, 2024
