Title: Manufacturing Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Litens?

We are a diverse group of talented people committed to creating solutions to problems and making the world a better place. We enhance and deliver both mechanical and electrified solutions that bring efficiency and sustainability to new heights. Founded in 1979, Litens has a proud history of being an innovative and highly respected company specializing in powertrain system engineering and component supply. Our history includes numerous achievements, many of which have been recognized through prestigious awards from our customers.

Experience a fulfilling and supportive environment where ingenuity is rewarded, collaboration is encouraged, and opportunities are readily available.




Why Join Litens?

Join the Litens Manufacturing Operations Team as a Manufacturing Improvement Analyst. At Litens, you can make an impact. We‚Äôve purposefully cultivated a supportive and flexible environment that gives everyone the opportunity to succeed. Litens offers a competitive and people-first approach to compensation and benefits, and we are committed to provide balanced employment and advancement opportunities for everyone.

Our diversity is our source of strength. At Litens, we are committed to equal employment opportunity, and we value and welcome diversity. We respect employees‚Äô rights for a safe and respectful workplace. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.




What will you do?

Gather and diagnose historical Manufacturing data from various sources related to Process, Materials, Labour, or Overhead and present opportunities for improvement.
Maintain status of labour, NVA, and scrap costs for monthly reconciliation with accounting
Monitor Shoplogix MES data and work with Business Systems/IT/Production to maintain accuracy and integrity
Balance support towards evaluation, research, and analysis between shop floor and office processes
Benchmark current business practices against World Class processes and present opportunities to management for improvement
Monitor Work Center performance to expected standards and communicate any variances to production leadership and Lean Manager
Participate and support CI related activities (kaizen, VSM, Materials PFEP, CI projects) by supplying performance data and hands on practical assistance.
Leverage your expert Excel skills for analysis of Manufacturing Operations data and potential improvement
Provides performance data for bench marking exercises within Litens global facilities.
Manage and maintain annual changes to Litens Production System Assessment (LPSA)
Work with Maintenance and Setup teams and leaders to facilitate administrative machine related Preventative Maintenance improvements




What will you bring?

University degree in Business or Engineering
4 years automotive/manufacturing experience
Proven ability to navigate, gather and analyze data through various business systems such as MS D365 Finance and Operations, and others, with a high degree of competence
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, intermediate skills with Word and Power Point
Proven ability to diagnose manufacturing data for the purpose of identifying and quantifying business opportunities and propose alternative improvement solutions
Requirement to maintain confidentiality is critical to this role
Experience with Lean Manufacturing principles and concepts
Flexible to work between local plants if necessary

other duties as required.

Title: Specialist, Analytics and Planning
Description:
Req Id: 419757

At Bell, our purpose is to advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world. We achieve this by providing consumers and businesses with the best network technologies in the world, innovative digital solutions and seamless customer experiences. It‚Äôs all developed and delivered by the members of #TeamBell and we‚Äôre always on the lookout for people with great skills and experiences.

We value diversity and provide a supportive, inclusive community where all team members can succeed. And through our commitment to environmental, social and governance initiatives, you will feel good about the greater impact you will have ‚Äì making every day better for people as they connect, work, learn and play.

Join us. You belong at Bell.

On the Consumer and Small business team you‚Äôll work across a portfolio of brands and solutions. From Bell‚Äôs best networks for the home, the office and on the go to the member benefits at Virgin Plus to the cheap and cheerful plans at Lucky Mobile we meet the connectivity needs of all customer segments in Canada.

And it‚Äôs not just the options we provide, it‚Äôs how we provide them. On this team you‚Äôll be a part of a focus to continuously improve the customer experience, making it more seamless, intuitive and responsive.

Summary

The Flanker Marketing team manages the acquisition strategy across Virgin Plus and Prepaid carriers including Lucky Mobile, Bell and Virgin Prepaid, PC mobile and No Name mobile.

Our team is looking for a driven, results-oriented and analytical team player to lead programs supporting the growth of our Wireless business. In this role, you will help dictate Bell‚Äôs long-term flanker strategy & priorities!

Key Responsibilities


Conduct in-depth analyses to identify new market opportunities and recommend strategic shifts
Be able to adapt quickly and work in a fast paced environment
Have strong cross-functional collaboration while working cross-functionally with internal teams & external partners
Monitor competitive landscape as it relates to product, pricing, and new marketing activity and trends
Leading and driving the overall marketing planning cycle
Bring 1-3 years‚Äô previous experience in market insights, analysis, strategy or segmentation in a data-driven environment leveraging Statistical Analysis System, MicroStrategy or other Business Intelligence software
Create compelling and strategic presentations to obtain buy-in and alignment from executive team and key stakeholders
Support weekly results reporting, highlighting trends and identifying channel / market opportunities


Critical Qualifications


University degree in Marketing, Analytics and/or Business Administration
2-3 years professional experience
Analytical skills: Ability to quantify and analyze data and provide meaningful insights along with recommendations.
You can collaborate cross-functionally with internal teams and partners
Experience with Microsoft Excel, MicroStrategy
Previous experience with market strategy and analytics


#EmployeeReferralProgram

Adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information

Position Type: Management

Job Status: Regular - Full Time

Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Work Arrangement: Hybrid

Application Deadline: 08/30/2024

For work arrangements that are ‚ÄòHybrid‚Äô, successful candidates must be based in Canada and report to a set Bell office for a minimum of 3 days a week. Recognizing the importance of work-life balance, Bell offers flexibility in work hours based on the business needs.

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

We know that caring for our team members is at the heart of a healthy, positive and thriving workplace. As part of our team, you‚Äôll enjoy a comprehensive compensation package that includes a competitive salary and a wide range of benefits to support the well-being of you and your family. As soon as you join us, you'll be eligible for medical, dental, vision and mental health benefits that you can tailor to your specific needs. Plus, as a Bell team member, you'll enjoy a 35% discount on our services and access exclusive offers from our partners.

We value the experiences that have shaped who you are, and we know the diversity of your talent will bring even greater strength to our team. At Bell, everyone belongs and you‚Äôll feel valued, respected and supported as you grow and reach your full potential.

We also want to make sure that everyone has an equal opportunity to join our team. We encourage individuals who may require accommodations during the hiring process to let us know. For a confidential inquiry, email your recruiter or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions or feedback regarding accessibility at Bell, we invite you to complete the Accessibility feedback form or visit our Accessibility page for other ways to contact us.

Artificial intelligence may be used to assess parts of your application. Please review our privacy policy (see Phenom for details) to learn more about how we collect, use, and disclose your personal information.

Title: Analyst, SCM Data
Description:
Req ID: 122563

Remote Position: Hybrid

Region: Americas

Country: Canada

State/Province: Ontario

City: Toronto

Summary

As the Analyst, SCM Data, you will be joining a team that embraces data and technology to develop advanced and innovative solutions. In this role, you will engage with Supply Chain cross functional business partners and facilitate building data pipelines and analytics projects to tailor solutions to business problems, using analytics to provide insights to enable incremental results.

Detailed Description

Key Responsibilities


Support ongoing data projects for Cost Productivity, Price Productivity, and First Quote Competitiveness.
Data Pipeline: Gather required data, organize and manage the data, clean and prepare for modelling.
Data Analysis: Support and maintain Machine Learning Models for consumption by Business users.
Story Telling: Develop dashboards and recurring reports to translate data & information into insight.
Dedication to ensuring your work is well documented and version controlled.


Knowledge/Skills/Competencies


Experience using the following services/tools:
Microsoft Azure cloud services: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks
Google Cloud Platform: BigQuery, Cloud Storage, and other services.
Power BI platforms.
Python.
Relational SQL databases.
The ability to quickly familiarize yourself with new languages, tools, frameworks.
General knowledge of the supply chain is considered an asset.


Typical Experience

Prefer 1-3 years of relevant supply chain experience, and open to considering new graduates with internship expereince.

Typical Education

Post-secondary education or University Degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics,

Computer Science, Analytics, or consideration of an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Notes

This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time.

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).

At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.

Company Overview

Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world‚Äôs best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development ‚Äì from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud.

Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.

Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.

Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development ‚Äì from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud.

Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.

Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.

Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

Title: Business Data Analyst, Retro Admin
Description:
PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it‚Äôs like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.



Job Description



About this job:

The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for the analysis, development, and support of all outgoing client data files for processing in PartnerRe systems. Data is produced in various file formats and usually includes transaction, in force, valuation and underwriting files, which have process streams that vary by function.

Support the PartnerRe monthly retro billing process (including account and data reconciliations, exception handling, account booking).
Update accounting system to track retro premium and commission accounts. Find and correct any discrepancies.
Identify/present variances, account trending, premium calculations/verifications and draw conclusions from the findings.
Ensure monthly retro processing continue to meet stated metrics. Responsibilities include data/plan mapping (including entry and verification of manual data loads) for all clients, investigation and resolution of client issues, and accounting loads/verification.
Create, maintain and test the ETL scripts used for acquiring, transforming and loading into PartnerRe systems/tools.
Analyze and design management reporting as defined by management. Write VBA code, macros, and SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and distribute data.
Document all TAI processes and procedures put into production.
Adhere to all IT controls and security established by IT management.
Ensure the Team Lead is informed of ongoing work activities and any unusual circumstances to ensure quality and timely deliverables.
Assist other teams within North American Life Operations when necessary including, claims, assumed and reporting teams.
Assist Valuation and Pricing with requests for data and data inquiries. Analyzing discrepancies and providing documentation.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, initiate internal reports and create efficiencies to improve data quality.
Liaise with Underwriting for data checking, management reporting, and discussion on results for Retro business (including facultative applications).
Assist with Enhancement Projects including creation of project, testing and preparation for deployment. Defect/bug discovery and acceptance testing for the administration system. Document testing and outcomes and liaise with other departments to ensure tasks and bugs are completed to specifications.
Participation in client visits.
Communicate with clients to facilitate transmission of monthly transaction files and address any questions/clarifications regarding data issues with clients.
Support client audits (desk and on-site audits).


Qualifications



About you:

The successful candidate should be a conscientious individual with exceptional problem-solving skills and a high degree of professional ethics and intellectual curiosity. In addition, the candidate should be a well-rounded individual who possesses the right combination of communication skills, an inquiring mind and creative mindset.

Qualifications and Experience

1-4 years of experience in a financial institution with some data management expertise
1-3 years of TAI Experience
Knowledge of insurance industry is a plus
Undergraduate or Graduate degree in business or STEM disciplines
Basic knowledge of audit & quality assurance principles
Interpersonal skills and relationship management
Proficient in SQL, MS Office, Alteryx
Some experience with VBA
Basic French language skills is a plus


Additional Information



PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

Thank you,

PartnerRe Hiring Team

Title: Senior Analyst Data & Analytics
Description:
Permanent Full Time

This role is a data subject matter expert for sales leaders and wholesalers to better diagnose sales results. Through timely predictive + descriptive analytics + data visulaization, the Senior Analyst will continue building our capability to use analytics to drive growth.

Accountabilities


Define, implement, and monitor comprehensive business strategies to drive organizational growth and achieve KPIs. Ensure ongoing strategic alignment with short and long-term business objectives
Enable effective, efficient working relationships with the sales team, finance, and technology partners
Engage and communicate strategic data programs across the Advisory Network business
Influence senior leaders within Advisory Network to understand business drivers and enable them to make decisions based on data
Oversee and support projects throughout the entire analytics lifecycle
Assist the business in the ideation of new analytics initiatives ranging from descriptive, diagnostics, predictive to prescriptive
Present and communicate the insights and recommendations generated in a visual and simplified language
Work with large datasets that are not consistently clean or fully modelled
Learn how to retrieve data from these systems via multiple languages
Build, implement and maintain data models, custom reports, and dashboards


Qualifications & Competencies


Master‚Äôs degree in related field of study, or an equivalent combination of bachelor‚Äôs degree and extensive related work experience.
CFA certification is an asset.
Experience within the Insurance & Financial Services sector would be an asset.
Strong experience in working with data analytics tools (SQL, Python, R), Databases (SQL Server), Cloud (Azure), data visualization tools (Power BI).
Strong experience working with raw data and manipulating large datasets.
Subject matter expertise in data analytics.
Polished communication and presentation skills to audiences including senior leadership.
Strong analytical skills for problem solving purposes and to monetize value for the organization.
Ability to work with little to no documentation or instruction.
Think outside the box and identify solution to overcome obstacles.
Experience working on project teams to analyze business needs.
Proven ability to learn and handle multiple priorities in a challenging work environment.


The base salary for this position is between $65,400- $114,500 annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today!

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You‚Äôre part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you‚Äôll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It‚Äôs our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that‚Äôs trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Canada Life serves‚ÄØthe financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we‚Äôre one of Canada‚Äôs leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.‚ÄØ

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee‚ÄØhas the opportunity to‚ÄØreach their potential.‚ÄØ

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Canada Life policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com.

Canada Life‚ÄØwould like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
QUANTITATIVE ANALYST

¬†

Hillsdale Investment Management Inc. (Hillsdale) is an independent, employee-controlled, and client-aligned investment boutique managing investments on behalf of a select group of sophisticated institutional and private wealth investors.¬†We engage in disciplined active investment management, specializing in equities, alternatives, ESG, and customized mandates.¬†We are committed to producing the highest quality equity investment strategies.¬†Hillsdale is recognized for both investment and service excellence ‚Äì a reflection of our relentless pursuit of research and development and the dedication of our employees who invest alongside our clients.

¬†

Hillsdale has been recognized as a Great Place to Work for our industry and across Canada.




We have an opportunity for a Quantitative Analyst to join our Portfolio Management team. Reporting to the Senior Portfolio Manager, you will:

Develop and enhance Hillsdale‚Äôs existing stock selection models
Research and develop new factors, strategies and stock selection models
Provide routine support to Portfolio Managers for managing multiple portfolios
Process large structured and/or unstructured datasets to extract predictive signals
Present research and portfolio analysis results to key internal stakeholders
Collaborate and effectively coordinate with cross-functional teams on a day-to-day basis




WHAT WILL YOU BRING?




A minimum of 3 years of financial industry experience in a quantitative role
Degree(s) in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or a related discipline
Ability to think critically and creatively while incorporating economic intuition with empirical evidence
Attention to detail with a high level of accuracy in complex analysis
Understanding of financial theory and financial statements, including accounting concepts
Experience working with financial datasets and data vendors
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines




Nice to Have (preferred but not required)




Prior Quantitative Investing experience is a huge plus
Experience in one or more: Factor Models, Econometrics, Data Science, Machine Learning, Asset Pricing
CFA, FRM or related designation
Programming skills: Python, Excel/VBA, R, MATLAB, etc.




WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU?

¬†

Competitive compensation package.
Supportive amenities and initiatives: access to a fully stocked kitchen, catered lunches, ergonomic home office setup, regular employee appreciation events, and retreats.
Flexible work environment and commuting reimbursement when you do work from the office.
Centrally located office at King and Bay with remarkable views of Toronto and Lake Ontario.




Application Deadline: This job posting will remain open until the position is filled.




Hillsdale is an equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.¬†We encourage applications from people of all abilities and will make reasonable accommodations upon request.




Not sure if you qualify?¬†Apply anyway! Our workforce comes from diverse backgrounds and industries. Please forward a resume to careers@hillsdaleinv.com.¬† Both full-time and contract arrangements will be considered.

¬†

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those selected for an interview and legally eligible to work in Canada will be contacted.¬†

HTML:
QUANTITATIVE ANALYST

 

Hillsdale Investment Management Inc. (Hillsdale) is an independent, employee-controlled, and client-aligned investment boutique managing investments on behalf of a select group of sophisticated institutional and private wealth investors. We engage in disciplined active investment management, specializing in equities, alternatives, ESG, and customized mandates. We are committed to producing the highest quality equity investment strategies. Hillsdale is recognized for both investment and service excellence ‚Äì a reflection of our relentless pursuit of research and development and the dedication of our employees who invest alongside our clients.

 

Hillsdale has been recognized as a Great Place to Work for our industry and across Canada.


We have an opportunity for a Quantitative Analyst to join our Portfolio Management team. Reporting to the Senior Portfolio Manager, you will:

  • Develop and enhance Hillsdale‚Äôs existing stock selection models
  • Research and develop new factors, strategies and stock selection models
  • Provide routine support to Portfolio Managers for managing multiple portfolios
  • Process large structured and/or unstructured datasets to extract predictive signals
  • Present research and portfolio analysis results to key internal stakeholders
  • Collaborate and effectively coordinate with cross-functional teams on a day-to-day basis


WHAT WILL YOU BRING?


  • A minimum of 3 years of financial industry experience in a quantitative role
  • Degree(s) in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or a related discipline
  • Ability to think critically and creatively while incorporating economic intuition with empirical evidence
  • Attention to detail with a high level of accuracy in complex analysis
  • Understanding of financial theory and financial statements, including accounting concepts
  • Experience working with financial datasets and data vendors
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines


Nice to Have (preferred but not required)


  • Prior Quantitative Investing experience is a huge plus
  • Experience in one or more: Factor Models, Econometrics, Data Science, Machine Learning, Asset Pricing
  • CFA, FRM or related designation
  • Programming skills: Python, Excel/VBA, R, MATLAB, etc.


WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU?

 

  • Competitive compensation package.
  • Supportive amenities and initiatives: access to a fully stocked kitchen, catered lunches, ergonomic home office setup, regular employee appreciation events, and retreats.
  • Flexible work environment and commuting reimbursement when you do work from the office.
  • Centrally located office at King and Bay with remarkable views of Toronto and Lake Ontario.


Application Deadline: This job posting will remain open until the position is filled.


Hillsdale is an equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We encourage applications from people of all abilities and will make reasonable accommodations upon request.


Not sure if you qualify? Apply anyway! Our workforce comes from diverse backgrounds and industries. Please forward a resume to careers@hillsdaleinv.com.  Both full-time and contract arrangements will be considered.

 

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those selected for an interview and legally eligible to work in Canada will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst - Data Science and BI
Description:
Make your next move an expert one.

At Colliers it‚Äôs not our success that sets us apart, it‚Äôs how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what‚Äôs right for our clients, people and communities.

Why Colliers?

Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers‚Äô continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.


This position is a hybrid role based out of our Toronto Office**


About You

You‚Äôre a collaborative team player with expertise in bridging business and technical teams, focusing on Business Intelligence (BI) projects. Your skills span Business Reporting, Data Modeling, Self-Service BI, Advanced Analytics, Data Visualization, and Integration. You thrive on identifying opportunities and implementing solutions for business growth and operational efficiency.

In this role, you will‚Ä¶


Collaborate with teams to document business requirements for data, reporting, and analytics.
Conduct stakeholder interviews to guide development teams effectively.
Analyze existing data sets, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Demonstrate understanding of Software Development Lifecycle and Master Data Management Concepts.
Evaluate and propose strategies for report consolidation and renewal.
Direct report development using BI tools for actionable insights.
Identify business capability gaps, leveraging data science tools for analysis.
Stay updated on industry best practices in business intelligence.


What You‚Äôll Bring


Bachelor's degree in business, Data Science, Computer Science, or related field.
3 to 5 years' experience as a Business Analyst in data analytics and BI.
Strong analytical skills and entrepreneurial spirit.
Proficiency in BI tools like Tableau, Power BI.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and project management skills.
Experience with Geospatial and Property data models is preferred.


Make your next move an expert one and join us as we lead the industry into the future.

Direct applicants only please, no agencies.

Colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@colliers.com.

Title: Data Analysis and Database Specialist
Description:
Data, Research and Evaluation

Full Time, Permanent

Hybrid

Level 7

Covenant House helps youth ignite their potential and reclaim their lives. As Canada‚Äôs largest agency serving youth who are homeless, trafficked or at risk, we offer the widest range of services to hundreds of young people every day.

More than a place to stay, we provide life-changing care with unconditional love and respect. We meet youth‚Äôs immediate needs and then we work together to achieve their future goals. We offer 24/7 crisis shelter transitional housing options on-site and, in the community, health and well-being support, training and skill development, and ongoing care once youth move into the community.

For over 40 years, Covenant House has been dedicated to its mission of serving youth on the street and to protect and safeguard all youth with absolute respect and unconditional love. Since 1982, Covenant House has supported more than 100,000 young people.

Overview


Reporting to the Efforts to Outcomes (ETO) Supervisor, the successful applicant will be responsible for:
Creating and generating reports using ETO client information system
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing extracts, reports, and performance indicators to identify and resolve problems, including data quality, integrity issues following data governance policies
Coordinates and prepares comprehensive data analysis and statistical reports for research, evaluation, policy, program and service activities
Using statistical analysis software to lead the development and delivery of functional analytics to support evidence-based decision-making.
Working with the department leads, Program Directors, and other relevant staff, ensure that the agency regularly reviews efforts towards outputs/outcomes (e.g., values, number of efforts, times spent)
Review all custom and standard reports for accuracy and timeliness so that the database maintains real time information about program participants and ensures that the agency has a process in place for a regular review conducted by appropriate staff (e.g., program manager)
Working with department leads to develop and maintain Policies, Standards and Controls about the safety of data in regard to regulatory compliance
Building advanced data visualizations (Tableau reports, infographics, scorecards, dashboards) that will support the dissemination of administrative data including outcomes and key performance indicators
Providing well-structured reports and documents to convey analysis and insights that are clear, concise and reader-friendly
Managing critical timelines and ensuring that deadlines are met
Performing other duties as required


Qualifications


The successful candidate will be a team player who has excellent communication and problem-solving skills. Their analytical ability and attention to detail coupled with their ability to prioritize and manage competing deadlines is a must.
Familiarity with ETO (Efforts to Outcomes) or another case management database is an asset.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, preferably within Computer Science, Statistics or approved equivalent combination of education and experience, with minimum two year‚Äôs experience in data analysis and management- including database design and advanced report writing using Structured Query Language (SQL) and other relational databases.
Experience with ETO, Tableau, and/or Qualtrics considered an asset
Experience with statistical software (e.g. R, SPSS)
Fluency in a programming language (e.g. Python) and or other programming languages would be an asset.
Proven passion for the data quality discipline
Strong interpersonal skills
Extremely meticulous in approach to work and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and within a team setting
Proven ability to meet established deadlines
Ability to quickly learn new tasks
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task and work on multiple projects simultaneously


Interested candidates should submit their cover letter and resume to this posting. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

At Covenant House Toronto we believe in a workplace culture of inclusion that is welcoming, respectful and safe for all staff. It is critical to Covenant House Toronto success to eliminate barriers and promote the inclusion of equity groups. Equity groups have been, and continue to be, underrepresented and marginalized in the workforce, leadership roles, and in some specific occupations. Equity groups include but may not be limited to Indigenous persons, racialized people, gender diverse people, 2SLGBTQIA+ people, and people with disabilities.

HTML:
Data, Research and Evaluation

Full Time, Permanent

Hybrid

Level 7

Covenant House helps youth ignite their potential and reclaim their lives. As Canada‚Äôs largest agency serving youth who are homeless, trafficked or at risk, we offer the widest range of services to hundreds of young people every day.

More than a place to stay, we provide life-changing care with unconditional love and respect. We meet youth‚Äôs immediate needs and then we work together to achieve their future goals. We offer 24/7 crisis shelter transitional housing options on-site and, in the community, health and well-being support, training and skill development, and ongoing care once youth move into the community.

For over 40 years, Covenant House has been dedicated to its mission of serving youth on the street and to protect and safeguard all youth with absolute respect and unconditional love. Since 1982, Covenant House has supported more than 100,000 young people.

Overview

  • Reporting to the Efforts to Outcomes (ETO) Supervisor, the successful applicant will be responsible for:
  • Creating and generating reports using ETO client information system
  • Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing extracts, reports, and performance indicators to identify and resolve problems, including data quality, integrity issues following data governance policies
  • Coordinates and prepares comprehensive data analysis and statistical reports for research, evaluation, policy, program and service activities
  • Using statistical analysis software to lead the development and delivery of functional analytics to support evidence-based decision-making.
  • Working with the department leads, Program Directors, and other relevant staff, ensure that the agency regularly reviews efforts towards outputs/outcomes (e.g., values, number of efforts, times spent)
  • Review all custom and standard reports for accuracy and timeliness so that the database maintains real time information about program participants and ensures that the agency has a process in place for a regular review conducted by appropriate staff (e.g., program manager)
  • Working with department leads to develop and maintain Policies, Standards and Controls about the safety of data in regard to regulatory compliance
  • Building advanced data visualizations (Tableau reports, infographics, scorecards, dashboards) that will support the dissemination of administrative data including outcomes and key performance indicators
  • Providing well-structured reports and documents to convey analysis and insights that are clear, concise and reader-friendly
  • Managing critical timelines and ensuring that deadlines are met
  • Performing other duties as required

Qualifications

  • The successful candidate will be a team player who has excellent communication and problem-solving skills. Their analytical ability and attention to detail coupled with their ability to prioritize and manage competing deadlines is a must.
  • Familiarity with ETO (Efforts to Outcomes) or another case management database is an asset.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, preferably within Computer Science, Statistics or approved equivalent combination of education and experience, with minimum two year‚Äôs experience in data analysis and management- including database design and advanced report writing using Structured Query Language (SQL) and other relational databases.
  • Experience with ETO, Tableau, and/or Qualtrics considered an asset
  • Experience with statistical software (e.g. R, SPSS)
  • Fluency in a programming language (e.g. Python) and or other programming languages would be an asset.
  • Proven passion for the data quality discipline
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Extremely meticulous in approach to work and attention to detail
  • Ability to work independently and within a team setting
  • Proven ability to meet established deadlines
  • Ability to quickly learn new tasks
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to multi-task and work on multiple projects simultaneously

Interested candidates should submit their cover letter and resume to this posting. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

At Covenant House Toronto we believe in a workplace culture of inclusion that is welcoming, respectful and safe for all staff. It is critical to Covenant House Toronto success to eliminate barriers and promote the inclusion of equity groups. Equity groups have been, and continue to be, underrepresented and marginalized in the workforce, leadership roles, and in some specific occupations. Equity groups include but may not be limited to Indigenous persons, racialized people, gender diverse people, 2SLGBTQIA+ people, and people with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst - Senior
Description:
Pay Rate: (flexible)
Location: 1 York Street Toronto, Ontario CAN
Contract Length: 10 Months


We at Raise are hiring right now for one of our Ontario Public Sector Clients. If you‚Äôre interested, apply below for your chance to join a great place to work.

Team: GRS Strategy, Data and Analytics

Business Unit: Group Retirement Services

Reports To: Director, Sponsor Data Insights and Products

Location: One York (Work From Home)

Background

Our Client's Canada‚Äôs Group Retirement Services is a market leader in Capital Accumulation Plans in Canada. Our vision is to become a lifetime savings partner for working Canadians & reinvent the formula for pension de-risking. One of the key enablers of our strategy is to transform into a digital and data-driven business.

The Data Analyst, reporting into the Director of Sponsor Data Insights and Products, is expected to be an effective partner with our Group Retirement Services portfolio. The successful candidate will assist in data entry tasks, supporting the run of recurring reporting, implement processes to automate/streamline existing processes and develop BI dashboards to enhance our existing suite of reports. This will result in improved efficiencies in GRS.

What Will You Do


Liaise directly with our key stakeholders to understand business needs and provide suitable analytical solutions.
Enhance our suite of reports to align with modern tools and data practices.
Develop continuous improvement solutions to automate, consolidate, or discontinue processes, with a focus on business value & efficiency.
Build robust documentation practices across all analytical products.
Manage multiple simultaneous data analytics/ Automation projects within assigned time and budget.
Comply fully with all privacy, confidentiality, do not contact, Code of Business Conduct, data security, End User Computing and other requirements related to customer data


Key Competencies


Ability to liaise with internal stakeholders and adapt the approach when dealing with technical and non-technical audiences.
Self-directed and proactive; thinking beyond the immediate problem with ability to analyze situations/problems systematically and deliver effective right-sized solutions in a timely manner.
Ability to manage In-depth prioritization, planning, and change management processes to stay within time/scope of a task in a fast-paced environment.
Proven problem-solving skills with the ability to break down high-level data into easily communicated information.
Strong analytical skills and business acumen with an eye for detail and accuracy


What You Will Need To Succeed


2 - 3 years‚Äô experience in a Data Analyst or Performance Analyst role
2 - 3 years of experience in Python/R/SAS for developing analytics led solutions.
2 - 3 years‚Äô experience working with visualization tools e.g. Tableau.
Advanced Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, Visual Basic
Proven ability to help drive large and strategic projects from concept to implementation that span multiple systems and business processes.
Strong understanding of data management principles, best practices, and data governance
Excellent communication skills to drive a data-driven culture and lead cross-functional initiatives.
Superior organizational skills, including process management to support workflow improvements.
Undergraduate in Business, Statistics, Computer Science (or equivalent university degree or college diploma)
Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry is an asset (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)


Looking for meaningful work? We can help

Raise is an established hiring firm with over 65 years of experience. We believe strongly in making the world a better place through work, which is why we‚Äôre a certified B Corporation and donate 10% of our profits to charity.

We strive to build teams that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, including people from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with visible/nonvisible disabilities.

We have a dedicated webpage for accommodations where you can learn more about what we offer, and request accommodation: https://raise.jobs/accommodations/

In order to submit candidates for roles, our clients will sometimes require personal information to confirm the identity of applicants and their legal status to work. Raise will never ask you for personal or banking information unless you have been selected for a job. If you are ever unsure about the legitimacy of this or another job posting by Raise (or have any other questions), please contact us at +1 800-567-9675 or hello@raiserecruiting.com

Title: 2025 Winter - GRM, Data Analyst Intern (8 Months)
Description:
Job Summary

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly motivated, strong passion towards data, and detail-oriented Data Analyst Co-op with Strong Python Coding skills to join our team for an 8-month term. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with our data team to support data-driven decision-making across the organization. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis, and real-world problem-solving skills.

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Are you interested in the opportunity to work as a Data Analyst at RBC? By applying to this job

posting, you will be considered for Data Analyst Role available at Operational Risk shared Services, where we leverage data-driven insights to solve complex business challenges. Our organization values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning, and we are looking for a motivated university student to contribute to our data analysis efforts.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly motivated, strong passion towards data, and detail-oriented Data Analyst Co-op with Strong Python Coding skills to join our team for an 8-month term. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with our data team to support data-driven decision-making across the organization. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis, and real-world problem-solving skills.

What will you do?


Data Collection and Preparation: Assist in gathering, cleaning, profiling and transforming data from various sources to ensure data integrity and readiness for analysis
Data Analysis and Visualization: Utilize Python and data analysis libraries (Pandas, Numpy, and many more) to analyze large datasets and generate meaningful insights. Familiar with some python visualization packages like plotly, matplotlib.
Automation and Scripting: Develop and maintain Python scripts to automate data processing tasks, streamline workflows, and improve efficiency.
Data Quality: support data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data used in analysis.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions and align with department goals


What do you need to succeed?


Currently enrolled at a Canadian post-secondary institution with a focus on computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics. preferably in third year or master‚Äôs degree study.
Advanced Programming skills in Python and R, especially, Packages like, Pandas, Numpy, Plotly, Matplotllib, Seaborn, etc.
Experienced with Data Transformation and Manipulation
Experienced with diagnostic data analytics
Experience or understanding of Relational Database (and SQL), Hadoop ecosystem, and data visualization tools.
Ability to perform complex data analysis.
Strong problem-solving abilities with a keen attention to details and a passion for data-driven decision making.


Nice-to-have


Proficient in building statistical and algorithmic models with complex and large datasets, including but not limited to: supervised statistical learning, clustering, natural language processing, recommendation systems, times-series analysis, experimental design (A/B testing), data visualization, deep learning
Knowledge of design, development, and implementation utilizing current analytics technologies and architecture, as well as data warehouse concepts and methodologies
Relational database concepts and design experience
Ability to learn and absorb new concepts (in business and in systems) quickly and apply new knowledge


What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


Mentorship and Development: Work closely with experienced professionals who will provide guidance and support to help you grow in your role
Real-World Experience: Gain hands-on experience in data analysis , data transformation, while working on impactful projects
Dynamic work environment: be part of a fast-paced and innovative team that values creativity and collaboration
Network and build lasting relationships with students from diverse backgrounds from across Canada
Participate in fun events and gamification challenges to help build your career tool kit while enjoying a work-life balance
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Enjoy a comfortable work environment with the option to dress casually


Please note: This posting is for a 8-months Winter 2025 Student placement with a start date of January 2025, and end date of August 2025. In order to be eligible for this 8-months Student position, you must either:


Be returning back to school after the work term end-date of August 2025 ; or
If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating in August 2025), you must require the full 8-months work term as a mandatory component to in order to graduate successfully.


Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered.

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is September 29, 2025. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. The successful candidate for this role will be required to be located within Ontario for the duration of the work term. Details regarding the specific virtual, hybrid, and in-office arrangements for this Integrated Learning/ Co-op position are to be discussed with the Hiring Manager.

ET25

Job Skills

Communication, Data Analysis, Detail-Oriented, Flask (Web Framework), Interpersonal Relationships, Listening Effectively, Pandas Python Library, Personal Development, Python (Programming Language), Python for Data Analysis, Python Matplotlib, Python Numpy, SQL Data Analysis, Taking Initiative

Additional Job Details

TORONTO

Canada

Full time

GROUP RISK MANAGEMENT

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a hybrid position in Vancouver. Candidates must be in British Columbia to be considered for this role.







This is a new role with a large healthcare organization in Vancouver. You will be joining a stable and tenured team and will support financial planning, applications and analyses. You will be working with internal financial data, and previous experience with this is required. About 70% of your role will be analytical, and 30% will involve working with SQL and writing SQL queries.







What you will do and how you will make an impact ‚Ä¶







[-] You will use SQL for data cleansing and exploration, and prepare the data for analysis.







[-] You will deep dive into this organization‚Äôs financial information and reports.







[-] You will conduct statistical analysis. You will look at cost patterns and variances, and identify trends.







[-] You will present your insights and recommendations to internal stakeholders, and ensure that business needs are met.







[-] You will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, and identify additional areas of opportunity. You will ensure that internal systems and operations are optimized.







[-] You will write SQL queries and create custom reports, as needed.







[-] You will support any system changes and develop documentation, and training materials.







Why we are excited about you ‚Ä¶







[-] You have strong problem-solving skills, and can perform well under minimal guidance







[-] You have previous experience with Microsoft SQL







[-] You have worked with financial data previously, such as revenue and expenses information







[-] You have strong presentation skills, and have experience sharing your findings with senior managers







Qualifications







[-] Minimum 3 years of experience in a data analytics / similar position







[-] Proven experience working with SQL







[-] Familiarity with Power BI or Tableau







Nice to have:







[-] Educational background, or previous experience with economics and statistics







Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let‚Äôs explore this together.







The interview process ‚Ä¶







A bit about myself - my name is Tanvi Krishna, and I am a recruitment consultant based in Vancouver, BC. I am constantly working on IT and creative roles, and I am always looking to meet new people.




If you're interested in pursuing this role, please apply to this posting. If you are selected for the next stage, I will contact you for an initial discussion. This will be a chance for us to discuss the job requirements in greater detail, as well as your career goals and preferences for your next position. We can also discuss other opportunities which may fit what you're looking for.




Please feel free to reach out and find me on LinkedIn by searching my name: Tanvi Krishna







Compensation & benefits ‚Ä¶







This is a full-time and permanent position that includes a competitive base salary, extended health and dental benefits, pension plan, and paid vacation.

Title: Entry-Level Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a motivated Entry-Level Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role is an excellent opportunity for recent graduates or individuals with foundational experience in data analysis to grow their career in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable insights.
Prepare reports and presentations of findings, clearly communicating complex data to stakeholders.
Assist in identifying trends and patterns in datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions.
Contribute to the development and improvement of data collection and analysis processes.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.


Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R (experience with statistical software is a plus).
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently when needed.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Canadian citizenship, permanent residency, or a valid work permit.


Benefits


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
Collaborative and inclusive work culture.


How to Apply: Please submit your resume

Title: Data Centre Analyst
Description:
Marketing Statement

A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.

At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We‚Äôre committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!

Summary

Responsibilities

The Data Centre Analyst (DCA) monitors and maintains the performance of the technical operations of all data centre facilities across the enterprise. Plans, schedules and executes the daily operational activities for all enterprise facilities ranging from the Data Centre to communication closets. Monitors and maintains the operational aspects of the enterprise backup system. Develops and maintains detailed documentation in support of the operation of the Data Centre.

Mitigates operational and system risk in support of enterprise risk management. Ensures the monitoring and analysis of Data Centre infrastructure statistical data. Plans and schedules the Data Centre infrastructure replacement lifecycle. Develops and refines Data Centre practices to follow accepted best practices.

Duties And Responsibilities

Plans, schedules and executes the daily operational activities for all enterprise facilities ranging from the Data Centre to communication closets. These activities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Analyzes the ongoing performance of the Data Centre infrastructure including servers, storage and supporting systems ensuring that the components are running at optimal levels,

Analyzes system power and cooling requirements at all sites and develop plans to increase the efficiency of those sites through a reduction in the consumption of both power and cooling,

Handles the support call lifecycle with infrastructure vendors in support of both component failures and analysis indicating component performance issues,

Provides expertise in the process of racking of network equipment, servers and storage according to data centre best practices.

Monitors and maintains the operational aspects of the enterprise backup system by:

Analyzing schedule policies and making adjustments to backup windows as needed relative to the requirements of the business,

Recommending best practices and advancements that support the current IT strategy,

Monitoring system health and daily backup jobs, on-demand restores of business data and the configuration of agents on computer systems.

Develops and maintains detailed documentation in support of the operation of the Data Centre.

Documentation includes run books for all infrastructure components describing period maintenance activities, standard operating procedures and system configurations.

Mitigates Operational And System Risk By

Analyzing operating system patches and system and storage firmware upgrades in support of enterprise risk management,

Planning and scheduling firmware upgrades and operating system patches with input from other BT teams to mitigate identified risks and within the parameters of the enterprise change management process,

Planning, scheduling and executing the testing of infrastructure components in collaboration with other enterprise teams.

Ensures the monitoring and analysis of Data Centre infrastructure as follows:

Develops infrastructure capacity monitoring programs to provide accurate forecasting and planning information,

Analyzes and establishes KPIs to provide accurate dashboard information,

Monitors enterprise resource consumption and develops trending analysis for storage and servers,

Monitors power and cooling and analyzes consumption trends for dashboard reporting,

Summarizes status providing monthly dashboard reporting including, but not limited to, power and cooling usage and infrastructure capacities.

Plans and schedules the Data Centre infrastructure replacement lifecycle as follows:

Remains current on technology roadmaps and makes recommendations to the IT Operations management team related to the infrastructure replacement program,

Plans and schedules the introduction of new infrastructure into the Data Centre to review the changing technologies and determine suitability in the enterprise environment,

Plans the configuration of infrastructure components for the enterprise procurement process,

Ensures assets, including racks, servers, storage, appliances and cabling are accurately recorded in the current asset management system,

Tracks and monitors the infrastructure equipment through the current asset management system.

Develops And Refines Data Centre Practices As Follows

Reviews current processes and procedures, identifies limitations, recommends and implements improvements,

Ensures the enterprise remains current on best practices and trends in data centre management,

Creates, reviews and maintains documentation in support of data centre good practices.

Performs related duties as assigned, such being items of a minor nature that do not affect the value of the job.

Qualifications

Requires a diploma in computing and information technology from a recognized institute of technology, specializing in network configuration and administration, and computer hardware systems.

Requires three (3) years previous experience in an information technology environment involving the installation, troubleshooting and support of corporate network and hardware systems, including one (1) year in a Data Centre environment supporting relevant power management, cooling and operation specific systems.

A further period of up to one (1) year on the job is required to become thoroughly familiar with the enterprise architecture plan, IS policies and standards, the enterprise Data Centre and specific network and hardware components.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

Salary $7,977 - $9,593 per month (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: July 31, 2024

Closing Date: Open until filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

TransLink is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

Title: Data Analyst x2
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst in search of your next contract opportunity? Our high-profile client is seeking to hire a 2 Data Analysts to join their talented team on a 6-month contract with a strong probability of extension. Apply for this amazing opportunity if this sounds like a good fit for you!

Advantages

What‚Äôs in it for you!

As a consultant with our client, you‚Äôll receive:


Highly competitive market hourly rates
A 6 month contract with a strong probability of extension
Remote interview process


Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to drive business value and value realization. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience consolidating complex data sets and building dashboard and scorecards to visualize portfolio status and performance.

Responsibilities:


Gather and consolidate data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets and external systems
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular validation and cleansing processes
Maintain and update data documentation, including data dictionaries and metadata.
Perform statistic analysis and data mining to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
Create and interpret data visualizations, reports, and dashboards to present findings
Prepare detailed reports and presentations summarizing data insights and recommendation
Provide actionable insights to improve business processes, performance, and strategies.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and requirements
Communicate complex data concepts in a clear and concise manner to non-technical stakeholders
Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend enhancements to data workflows and tools


Qualifications


Bachelors‚Äô degree in Business Administration, Data Science, Statistics, computer Science or related fields. A master‚Äôs degree or PMP/PMI certification is a plus.


Experience:


5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, with a proven track record in an analytical role.
Minimum 2+ years of experience working technology or related field
3+ years of excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)
Proficiency in data analysis tools and language (e.g., SQL, Python, R) preferred.


Summary

If you are a Data Analyst and the prospect of joining a dedicated team intrigues you, then this role with our high-profile client could be the perfect opportunity for you.

Apply below or reach out to your Randstad representative for more information.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

Title: Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
We are looking to hire a data analyst to join our data team. You will take responsibility for managing our master data set, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues. To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases.

Data Analyst Responsibilities


Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Managing users and user roles.
Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary.
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
Helping develop reports and analyses.
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.


Data Analyst Requirements:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree from an accredited university or college in computer science.
Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field.
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
Ability to translate business requirements into nontechnical, lay terms.
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
High-level written and verbal communication skills.
